thread.title: Manchester United and Man City fixtures changed for TV
thread.title_full: Manchester United and Man City fixtures changed for TV

posts.author: Liam Corless
posts.title: Manchester United and Man City fixtures changed for TV
posts.text:
Manchester United and Man City fixtures changed for TV Man Utd and Man City have both seen their penultimate Premier League matches of the season rearranged. Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get the biggest daily stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
Fixtures involving Manchester United and Manchester City in May have been changed for TV purposes.
United's game away to Huddersfield on the weekend of 4/5 May has been set for 5 May at 2pm, while City's home game against Leicester has been scheduled for a 12.30pm kick-off on 4 May.
Both matches could yet be rearranged again depending on whether either team progress to the semi-finals of the Champions League.
Regarding the two teams' respective rivals, City's sole title challengers Liverpool have had their game away to Newcastle moved to 4.30pm on 5 May, while Spurs, who are vying for a top-four spot with United, have had their game against Bournemouth moved to Monday 6 May (8pm kick-off).
As is the case with United's and City's fixtures, both of those games are also subject to further changes.
Arsenal and Chelsea's respective home games against Brighton and Watford remain 3pm Saturday kick-offs. Like us on Facebook

thread.title: «Manchester United, pronti 150 milioni per Koulibaly»
thread.title_full: «Manchester United, pronti 150 milioni per Koulibaly» - Corriere dello Sport

posts.author: corrieredellosport.it
posts.title: «Manchester United, pronti 150 milioni per Koulibaly»
posts.text:
NAPOLI - Spifferi di calcio mercato che arrivano dall’Estero, perché l’argomento ha un suo appeal e non c’è Paese in cui le voci non si diffondano. In Inghilterra, oggi come ieri, e magari anche come domani, è sempre il momento di Kalidou Koulibaly, difensore centrale del Napoli che ormai rientra tra i grandi interpreti del ruolo e che inevitabilmente viene accostato a club di assoluto richiamo.
De Laurentiis in ospedale: «Controlli di routine»
L’ultima arriva dalla Gran Bretagna, la scrive il Mirror, che annuncia la presentazione di un’offerta da parte del Manchester United per il senegalese, legato al Napoli da un contratto con scadenza 2023 e però avvicinabile solo attraverso il pagamento della clausola, valida esclusivamente per l’estero ed in vigore dalla prossima estate, dunque quella che sta per arrivare, di 150 milioni di euro.
Corsi: «Ho parlato con Giuntoli di Bennacer»

thread.title: Two Manchester United first team squad members to play for Under 23s
thread.title_full: Two Manchester United first team squad members to play for Under 23s

posts.author: Dan O'Toole
posts.title: Two Manchester United first team squad members to play for Under 23s
posts.text:
Sport Two Manchester United first team squad members to play for Under 23s Man Utd U23s vs West Brom at Old Trafford tonight and Ole Gunnar Solskjaer wants Andreas Pereira and Marcos Rojo to play. Share Rojo and Pereira are playing tonight Get the biggest Manchester United FC stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
Marcos Rojo and Andreas Pereira will line up for Manchester United's second string in their Premier League game against West Brom at Old Trafford tonight.
Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has sanctioned the first-team duo's participation in a bid to ensure maximum fitness levels are maintained as the season nears its conclusion.
Rojo is one of six players who could leave the club at the end of the season but is in contention for a return to the starting XI next week against West Ham since left-back options Luke Shaw and Ashley Young are suspended. Shaw collected his 10th yellow card of the season in the 2-1 defeat at Wolves and is banned for two games while Young was sent off for two bookable offences at Molineux.
Argentina international Rojo has made just five appearances for United this season amid injury issues. The 29-year-old's substitute appearance against Watford last week was his first appearance under Solskjaer. Read More Six British players United should target this summer
Pereira, meanwhile, has made seven Premier League appearances under United's recently-installed permanent manager and scored his first league goal in the 3-2 victory against Southampton on March 2.
The 23-year-old started United's round-of-16 second leg with Paris Saint-Germain last month and injury to Ander Herrera could put Pereira in the frame for a return in the quarter-final first leg against Barcelona on Wednesday.
Youngsters Mason Greenwood and Tahith Chong could be involved at Old Trafford, as could midfield pair James Garner and Angel Gomes. The quartet have all figured under Solskjaer off the bench. Read More

thread.title: Agent reveals whether Raphael Varane has held transfer talks with Manchester United
thread.title_full: Agent reveals whether Raphael Varane has held transfer talks with Manchester United

posts.author: Liam Corless
posts.title: Agent reveals whether Raphael Varane has held transfer talks with Manchester United
posts.text:
Agent reveals whether Raphael Varane has held transfer talks with Manchester United Raphael Varane is said to be considering his Real Madrid future because he wants a new challenge. Share Raphael Varane of Real Madrid Get the biggest Manchester United FC stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
Raphael Varane is considering his future at Real Madrid but has not yet spoken to any other club regarding his future.
That's according to football agent Bruno Satin, who claims Varane is eager for a new challenge having won everything there is to win with Los Merengues.
Varane has won 16 trophies during his eight years at the Bernabeu, including four Champions Leagues, two La Ligas and one Copa del Rey,
However, he has not held talks with United according to Satin, who represents several French players.
"A final decision hasn't been made yet; he [Varane] is mulling things over at the moment," Satin told Canal+.
"He's won everything at Madrid, and at the end of the day he's achieved everything he needed to - which is why he feels like now is maybe time for a change.
"But I can assure [you] that he's not in negotiations with anyone at the moment." Read More Manchester United transfer news LIVE Paul Pogba 'contract demands' revealed and David de Gea linked with PSG move
United are keen to bolster their defence in the summer, with Varane and Kalidou Koulibaly viewed as ideal potential partners for Victor Lindelof.
Either player would likely cost United a world-record fee for a defender as they both have several years to run on their current contracts with their respective clubs.
Varane's deal at Madrid runs until 2022, while Koulibaly's at Napoli expires in 2023.
It is understood United would be willing to spend £100million on a player of Varane's profile but their chances of landing him slimmed when Zinedine Zidane was re-appointed the Spanish club's manager last month. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
Speaking in a press conference on Tuesday, Zidane made it clear that he wants Varane to remain at the club
"I do not want a Real Madrid without Varane," Zidane said. "He is a young player who has been here for eight years." Read More

posts.title: Jacqueline Jossa undergoes stunning blonde makeover days after love rival Alexandra Cane also dyes her hair
posts.text:
BLONDE AMBITION Jacqueline Jossa undergoes stunning blonde makeover days after love rival Alexandra Cane also dyes her hair
Jacqueline was furious after husband Dan snogged the reality star behind her back on a boozy night out in Manchester By Mary Gallagher 5th April 2019, 2:05 pm Updated: 5th April 2019, 2:06 pm JACQUELINE Jossa underwent a dramatic makeover and dyed her hair blonde - days after Alexandra Cane.
The Sun Online told how her husband Dan, 27 , was spotted kissing the Love Island star last month. Instagram 3 Jacqueline Jossa dyed her hair blonde just days after love rival Alexandra Cane did the same
She's now transformed her look with a bright new hair do, just one day after stunning Alex did the same.
Jacqueline shared a photo of the results on Instagram and wrote alongside the snap: "New hair "
Fans loved her new look and showered her with compliments, as one said: "What a difference cool"
Another noticed her glamorous make-up that included heavy mascara, eyeliner, and bronzer, and said: "New makeup look! Suits you!" Instagram Alex shared her new blonde hair style yesterday and wrote 'New hair, new attitude'
Meanwhile, ex make-up artist Alex wrote alongside her hair photo yesterday: "New hair, new attitude."
Jacqueline's glamorous new look comes after her marriage to Dan, 27 , hit another stumbling block.
Eyewitnesses told The Sun Online that Dan couldn't get enough of Alexandra when they met in a club in Manchester.
They told us: “Dan was all over Alexandra. At one point he grabbed her and kissed her." Splash News 3 Jacqueline has been sleeping in separate beds from husband Dan Osborne
Another onlooker added: “He was putting his hands all on her - grinding against her and thrusting his hips.”
The pair left together and Dan later followed Alexandra on Instagram."
Upon hearing the news, Jacqueline booted Dan out of the house. Dan Osborne denies kissing Alex Cane but accepts he was having drink and a little dance with friends MOST READ IN TV & SHOWBIZ GOODBYE MIKE Love Islanders sob as Caroline Flack joins celebs at Mike Thalassitis' funeral TV STAR DEAD Fawlty Towers actor who starred in iconic 'Basil the rat' episode dies at 89 GET A GROOM 'Jilted John' who was ditched days before 2015 wedding proposes to SAME woman called off GMB host Ranvir Singh hints that she split from husband after checking his phone BUN'S OUT OF THE OVEN Gordon Ramsay's wife Tana, 44, gives birth to 5th baby with cute name WAVE WATCHERS Gemma Collins shows off incredible weight loss as she soaks up the sun rot a mess Katie Price’s mucky mansion still a mess with mouldy mattresses and filthy pool time to grieve Megan McKenna spotted grabbing lunch in Nashville before ex Mike's funeral Gossip Mel B 'is dating ex-girlfriend Christine Crokos' after Geri fling drama 'super mum' Liam Payne pays tribute to 'amazing' ex Cheryl after Naomi left her devastated
The couple - who married in 2017 - can't stand to be in the same room as one another and are sleeping apart.
Sources close to the couple said they are keen to put on a united front in public after a humiliating few weeks - but behind closed doors things have soured.
“Dan and Jacqueline wanted to fix their relationship, but it’s been really tough,” said the friend.

thread.title: Manchester United : le clan Romelu Lukaku ouvre la porte à un départ cet été
thread.title_full: Manchester United : le clan Romelu Lukaku ouvre la porte à un départ cet été

posts.author: Cedric Rablat, Maxime Barbaud
posts.title: Manchester United : le clan Romelu Lukaku ouvre la porte à un départ cet été
posts.text:
Accueil > Premier League > Transferts > Manchester United : le clan Romelu Lukaku ouvre la porte à un départ cet (...) Manchester United : le clan Romelu Lukaku ouvre la porte à un départ cet été Longuement interrogé par Sky Sports, l'agent de Romelu Lukaku a mis la pression sur les épaules des dirigeants de Manchester United. Il assure que le Belge pourrait partir dès cet été alors qu'il lui reste encore trois ans de contrat. Romelu Lukaku n'est pas certain de vouloir rester à Manchester United l'an prochain ©Maxppp
La saison de Romelu Lukaku (25 ans) avec Manchester United demeure compliquée. Titulaire indiscutable sous José Mourinho, l’attaquant belge a vu son statut évoluer depuis l’arrivée d’Ole Gunnar Solskjaer sur le banc. Le Diable Rouge, qui a tout de même inscrit douze réalisations en Premier League, et démarré sept des dix derniers matches comme titulaire, ne sait pas encore s’il poursuivra l’aventure avec les Red Devils la saison prochaine. Son agent, Federico Pastorello a fait le point sur la situation personnelle de son poulain. Il assure qu’une discussion aura lieu avec les dirigeants mancuniens cet été mais ouvre d’ores et déjà la porte à un départ alors qu’il est arrivé il y a seulement deux ans contre 85 M€.
« En ce moment, il est très concentré sur la fin de saison. La lutte pour la 3ème ou 4ème place est féroce en Angleterre, donc regardons ce qui va se passer dans le futur, à la fin de la saison. C’est quelqu’un qui aime connaître une culture différente, un football différent. C’est sa seconde saison ici et il lui reste trois ans de contrat. Il voit un moyen de faire carrière dans différents pays car il aimerait remporter des trophées et faire ses preuves en disant à ses enfants : "j’ai gagné là-bas, j’ai gagné là-bas et j’ai gagné là-bas" et "j’étais un très bon joueur dans tous les championnats." Le futur est très ouvert mais pour le moment nous ne discutons pas la fin de saison est très importante » prévient l’agent du Belge invité à s’exprimer sur Sky Sports . Lukaku ouvert à tous les championnats
Même s’il ne sait pas encore pour quelle compétition européenne il va se qualifier l’an prochain, Manchester United commence déjà à préparer la saison suivante. Ole Gunnar Solskjaer a été prolongé et a fait ses premières demandes concernant le mercato . Le Norvégien va aussi devoir gérer l’épineux cas Paul Pogba , courtisé par le Real Madrid, et faire le tri parmi 15 joueurs en fin de contrat . Un nouveau dossier brûlant s’ajoute donc sur son bureau avec les déclarations de l’agent de Romelu Lukaku. « Il aime l’Italie. Quand il était petit, il suivait beaucoup le Calcio. Aujourd’hui tout le monde est d’accord pour dire que la Premier League est le meilleur championnat. Mais il y a quelques années, l’Italie était le meilleur championnat et il faisait rêver les jeunes footballeurs. »
Le représentant du joueur est formel, il apprécie beaucoup les méthodes de l’entraîneur malgré des débuts compliqués où Lukaku n’a pas beaucoup joué. « Au cours de cette période, ce qu’il a apprécié chez le manager, c’est qu’il a su garder son implication avec beaucoup d’attention » . Finalement, l’attaquant a su répondre présent lorsque Solskjaer a fait appel à lui comme en Ligue des Champions lors du match retour face au PSG. Une performance de haut vol dont il bénéficiera cet été au moment de discuter de son avenir. « Des équipes comme le Real Madrid et Barcelone attirent bien sûr tous les champions, il se retrouvera un jour en Liga. La Bundesliga aussi est assurément un très bon championnat » conclut l’agent de Lukaku. Voilà qui en dit long sur l’état d’esprit du joueur, à moins que ce soit une stratégie pour mieux renouveler son contrat. Réponse cet été.

thread.title: Radical Champions League changes which could affect Man Utd and Man City
thread.title_full: Radical Champions League changes which could affect Man Utd and Man City - Manchester Evening News

posts.author: Paul Clarke Senior Sports Wire Writer
posts.title: Radical Champions League changes which could affect Man Utd and Man City
posts.text:
Radical Champions League changes which could affect Man Utd and Man City There are more alterations to the Champions League which are being discussed. Share Paul Clarke Senior Sports Wire Writer 12:33, 5 APR 2019 Champions League trophy (Image: FABRICE COFFRINI/AFP/Getty Images) Get the biggest daily stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
Premier League clubs including Manchester United and Manchester City are set to discuss the potential impact of radical changes to the Champions League.
The club’s will assemble at a shareholders meeting today to debate the pros and cons of an increase in the amount of Champions League group matches.
Man Utd and Man City had to contend with just six group matches this season before making it through to the knockout stages.
But Juventus are one of the key clubs aiming to completely change the group stages of the Champions League. Juventus’ chairman Andrea Agnelli is also an Executive Member of the European Football Association.
The radical plans include altering the group stages from eight groups of four teams to four groups of eight teams.
It’s also said that the top-four qualification process could be abandoned in favour of something more of a closed shop which could serve the most historically successful clubs across Europe. Read More
All of these issues will be on the table to discuss at today’s shareholders meeting.
The proposed start date for the expanded competition is the 2024/25 season and it’s believed Premier League clubs have serious reservations about how the extra fixtures would be worked into the football calendar. It’s understood that one of the domestic cup competitions could be under threat as a result. Read More

thread.title: Six British players Manchester United should target this summer - Richard Fay
thread.title_full: Six British players Manchester United should target this summer - Richard Fay - Manchester Evening News

posts.author: Richard Fay
posts.title: Six British players Manchester United should target this summer - Richard Fay
posts.text:
Sport opinion Six British players Manchester United should target this summer Man Utd are looking to invest in young British talent this summer and there are plenty of exciting prospects who could make their mark at Old Trafford. Share Get the biggest Manchester United FC stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
Manchester United are well aware of what they need to do in the summer transfer window.
Six barren years without a Premier League title is not good enough for a club of such magnitude and now a massive overhaul is required if the gap is to be truly closed on Man City and Liverpool.
United have already acted quickly to ensure Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's future was confirmed far earlier than initially expected, but now the real work begins as the rebuilding process reaches its next stage.
In order for United to truly eradicate their post-Sir Alex Ferguson blues the club needs to cut the sentiment and cast a ruthless assessment over each and every first-team member.
Solskjaer's first test will be to live up to his baby-faced assassin demeanour and put an abrupt end to any first-team members who have overstayed their welcome on the fringes of the United squad. Read More Manchester United might already have David de Gea's replacement
Next the Norwegian must be supported by those in power above him and be given such freedom to pursue any deal which he deems to be appropriate.
United sources have already signalled their intent of signing the best young homegrown talents at the end of the season, and there are six candidates who most all be considered if the club are to reclaim their fearsome reputation.
It is highly likely that whoever comes in at centre-back this season won't be British, with Leicester defender Harry Maguire highly valued by his club. Proven quality is needed with Kalidou Koulibaly and Milan Skriniar two such players more worthy of the almighty transfer tags. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
The first homegrown recruit should come in the shape of an exciting versatile player like Aaron Wan-Bissaka. Antonio Valencia is leaving and Ashley Young's age is beginning to show more than ever before. Diogo Dalot and Luke Shaw already offer attractive options at full-back, but the Crystal Palace youngster would only strengthen such resources.
Signing a new midfielder could also present itself as a necessity should Ander Herrera depart the club at the end of his contract. United also need to prepare for life after 30-year-old Nemanja Matic and another central reinforcement could be required to offset the loss of Marouane Fellaini. Declan Rice is an ideal nominee to sit at the core of a new-look middle three.
Perhaps the second most glaring issue with United in recent years has been their unbalance upfront and some supporters will still be bemused as to why Alexis Sanchez was signed to bolster an already overloaded left wing a year ago.
This summer is it crucial a new right wing option is signed, and suddenly there are four players who could all make an immediate impact on Old Trafford.
The obvious candidate has to be England sensation Jadon Sancho, enough has been said about his abilities and he is definitely the leading target for such a role. However, depending on how much money is required to sign a new centre-back there could be stricter funds on recruiting a new attacking option.
Such a scenario would open the door to Callum Hudson-Odoi or David Brooks to make the switch. Both are cheaper options than Sancho and are both beginning to show signs that they could play regularly for a 'big six' side. Read More

thread.title: Mike Phelan threatens to leave Solskjaer’s side after seeking assurances in talks with Man Utd
thread.title_full: Mike Phelan threatens to leave Solskjaer’s side after seeking assurances in talks with Man Utd

posts.author: John Hutchinson
posts.title: Mike Phelan threatens to leave Solskjaer’s side after seeking assurances in talks with Man Utd
posts.text:
MIKE DROP Mike Phelan threatens to leave Solskjaer’s side after seeking assurances in talks with Man Utd
Fergie's former assistant believes there are too many people involved in the management and recruitment teams By John Hutchinson 5th April 2019, 12:27 pm Updated: 5th April 2019, 12:27 pm MIKE PHELAN could be set to LEAVE Manchester United over concerns with the management structure.
Following Ole Gunnar Solskjaer signing a three-year contract to become permanent manager , it was expected Phelan would stay on as assistant. Reuters 2 Mike Phelan has still not signed a deal to remain at Manchester United beyond this season
Both have been credited to turning around Manchester United 's season, with a top-four finish very much the aim.
But according to MailOnline , Phelan, who was Sir Alex Ferguson's trust lieutenant during the glory days, is "considering his position" after having talks with the club.
His issues are believed to be centred around a complicated management and recruitment system, something the club are keen to sort out.
But with 58 scouts based all over the world, Phelan "wants to establish a clearer line of communication between the coaching team and the Old Trafford hierarchy".
The 56-year-old returned to the club this season, five-and-a-half-years after leaving together with the retiring Fergie. Latest Manchester United News

thread.title: Không phải Facebook, K+ tiếp tục độc quyền phát sóng Ngoại hạng Anh 3 mùa giải tại Việt Nam
thread.title_full: Không phải Facebook, K+ tiếp tục độc quyền phát sóng Ngoại hạng Anh 3 mùa giải tại Việt Nam

posts.title: Không phải Facebook, K+ tiếp tục độc quyền phát sóng Ngoại hạng Anh 3 mùa giải tại Việt Nam
posts.text: Không phải Facebook, K+ tiếp tục độc quyền phát sóng Ngoại hạng Anh 3 mùa giải tại Việt Nam Thứ Sáu, 05/04/2019 18:18 PM GMT+7 (VTC News) - Ban tổ chức Ngoại hạng Anh đã trao cho truyền hình K+ quyền phát sóng độc quyền toàn bộ giải đấu trong 3 mùa giải tới (2019/2020, 2020/21 và 2021/22). Thắng nghẹt thở Tottenham, Liverpool chiếm lại ngôi đầu của Man City Theo đó, toàn bộ các trận đấu mỗi mùa giải (380 trận) sẽ được phát sóng độc quyền trên các kênh K+. Ông Lê Chí Công, Tổng giám đốc công ty VSTV/K+ cho biết: “K+ rất vui mừng mang đến cho khán giả 3 mùa tiếp theo giải Ngoại hạng Anh từ 2019 đến 2022. K+ sẽ tiếp tục đồng hành cùng người hâm mộ Việt Nam với các môn thể thao và các giải bóng đá hàng đầu thế giới, khẳng định luôn dành cho các thuê bao của mình những nội dung tốt nhất.” Ông Stephane Baumier, Phó Tổng giám đốc của VSTV/K+ cho biết thêm: “Với thỏa thuận này, K+ khẳng định cam kết luôn mang đến cho khán giả nội dung thể thao đỉnh cao độc quyền và các nội dung sản xuất có tính chuyên môn cao được khán giả yêu thể thao ghi nhận, gia tăng những giá trị không thể so sánh cho gói kênh K+ và 4 kênh K+.” Ngoại hạng Anh sẽ được K+ phát sóng trên toàn lãnh thổ Việt Nam trên các nền tảng rộng rãi nhất hiện nay thuộc mọi hạ tầng: Truyền hình số vệ tinh với gói K+ Premium+; Truyền hình trên internet (OTT) với K+ TV Box; Thiết bị di động có kết nối internet (mobile, laptop, máy tính bảng) qua ứng dụng myK+. Với thỏa thuận bản quyền giải Ngoại hạng Anh vừa đạt được, K+ đã nắm trong tay 3 giải đấu hấp dẫn bậc nhất cấp CLB châu Âu là: Ngoại hạng Anh, UEFA Champions League và Europa League. Trước đó, có thông tin Facebook sẽ độc quyền phát sóng giải Ngoại hạng Anh tại Việt Nam và Thái Lan. Tuy nhiên, vì nhiều lý do, mặc dù đã mua bản quyền, nhưng Facebook đã quyết định rút lui. Sự tụt dốc kinh ngạc của Manchester United sau trận thắng lịch sử trước Paris Saint-Germain khiến nhiều người hoài nghi về thành công và năng lực của Solskjaer. Mặc dù đang ít hơn 1 điểm so với Man City nhưng những vòng đấu cuối mang lại nhiều lợi thế hơn cho Liverpool và chắc chắn họ cần tận dụng để vô địch. Chủ đề: Bấm thích và chia sẻ bài viết này:

thread.title: Tahith Chong praises Ole Gunnar Solskjaer influence at Manchester United
thread.title_full: Tahith Chong praises Ole Gunnar Solskjaer influence at Manchester United - Manchester Evening News

posts.author: Richard Fay
posts.title: Tahith Chong praises Ole Gunnar Solskjaer influence at Manchester United
posts.text:
Sport Tahith Chong praises Ole Gunnar Solskjaer influence at Manchester United Man Utd youngster Tahith Chong made his first-team debut under Ole Gunnar Solskjaer in the FA Cup victory over Reading earlier in the year. Share Get the biggest Manchester United FC stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
Tahith Chong has thanked Ole Gunnar Solskjaer for giving youth a fair chance during his time at Manchester United.
Chong made his debut in the FA Cup earlier in the season to become one of a number of academy stars to have been handed a first-team debut since the Norwegian took over from Jose Mourinho last December.
Mason Greenwood and James Garner have both also made their first appearances under the new United manager and will hoping to continue to be involved with the first-team towards the end of the season.
Chong and his fellow youth teammates will be in action on Friday night when they face West Brom at Old Trafford, and speaking ahead of the game the 19-year-old thanked Solskjaer for his continued support.
“It was just a proud moment making my debut against Reading,” Chong told ManUtd.com. “For me and everyone, in and around the club. We won the game as well, which was good.
“The hard work eventually pays off, which is good to see. Read More Manchester United transfer news LIVE Paul Pogba 'contract demands' revealed and David de Gea linked with PSG move
“I think, ever since the manager came in, he has given me my debut and others have had theirs too. I think nine players that have come through the academy have now appeared under him now so it’s amazing to see the trust both him and the club are willing to put in youth.
“Being at Manchester United, you have so many new experiences and are learning every day. You’re seeing how players go into games and how they prepare.
”I think it’s not specifics really, just small stuff you pick up and put that in your back pocket to use it one day. It’s good to pick it up, stuff I didn’t know about. I think it’s both on and off the field, you go to train with them and see things and think: ‘Hey, okay, I might start doing that as what he did there was really good'". Read More

thread.title: Borussia Dortmund give Manchester United fresh Jadon Sancho transfer update
thread.title_full: Borussia Dortmund give Manchester United fresh Jadon Sancho transfer update - Manchester Evening News

posts.author: Richard Fay
posts.title: Borussia Dortmund give Manchester United fresh Jadon Sancho transfer update
posts.text:
Borussia Dortmund give Manchester United fresh Jadon Sancho transfer update Man Utd are interested in England international and former Manchester City forward Jadon Sancho. Share Get the biggest Manchester United FC stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
Borussia Dortmund are adamant that Manchester United target Jadon Sancho will not be allowed to leave the club this summer.
United are interested in a move for the former Man City winger as they look to overhaul their squad at the end of the season and back new manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer with the funds to mount a genuine Premier League title bid.
Sancho is one such player who fulfills their desired criteria of top-quality homegrown talent, but Dortmund chief executive Hans-Joachim Watzke is certain the youngster won't be allowed to leave this year.
"We will not sell him, that is fact," Watzke told Eurosport Germany.
" It is clearly discussed with every person who is involved that Jadon plays in the next season for BVB."
Despite only becoming a regular in the Dortmund first-team from October of last year, the youngster is already being tipped for huge things in the game.
And although Dortmund are delighted with the progress he has made, they do not want Sancho to become distracted by all of the transfer speculation surrounding him. Read More Manchester United transfer news LIVE Paul Pogba 'contract demands' revealed and David de Gea linked with PSG move
Waztke added: "His progress is brilliant. For his age he plays extremely remarkable because he does things you cannot plan like this. But we have to be careful that we do not trigger the hype. This boy just turned 19 years old.
"He is not allowed to lose a millimetre of focus because for the top players every thousandth counts.
"Cristiano Ronaldo has not been at the top of the world for many years because of his talent, but because of his focus no one else has.
"If Jadon proves that in the next few years, we can talk about a world career as well. At this time, we can only speak about his huge potential." Read More

thread.title: Manchester United must not fall into Barcelona transfer trap - Samuel Luckhurst
thread.title_full: Manchester United must not fall into Barcelona transfer trap - Samuel Luckhurst - Manchester Evening News

posts.author: Samuel Luckhurst
posts.title: Manchester United must not fall into Barcelona transfer trap - Samuel Luckhurst
posts.text:
Sport opinion Manchester United must not fall into Barcelona transfer trap Philippe Coutinho has been baselessly linked with Man Utd and their meeting with Barcelona in the Champions League is timely for Kia Joorabchian. Share Barcelona line up against Lyon Get the biggest Manchester United FC stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
Gerard Pique was restricted to fewer Manchester United appearances than Scott McTominay in four seasons and one campaign spent on loan at Real Zaragoza. Winner's medals eluded him and his omission from the 2008 Champions League final squad, while not as much of a jolt as Ji-Sung Park’s, was just as harsh.
Nevertheless, last month Pique proclaimed: "I’m coming back to my second home." He is one of the more charismatic and engaging footballers and has never concealed his fondness for United. When the MEN marked the date he joined the club on Twitter with a picture of Sir Alex Ferguson and Pique resembling a father and son before they depart for a cup final at his unveiling, Pique quote-tweeted the post and beamed: "Great memories." He’s the only Gerard who has lifted the Premier League crown.
Pique's return and Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's presence on the Camp Nou touchline are romantic sub-plots to the most heart-fluttering quarter-final draw in the Champions League. Solskjaer harped on about 1999 and all that before and after the Miracle in Paris but it did not keep United in the FA Cup and they are sixth again. Nostalgia for the past is not going to get Solskjaer far in the present. Read More Manchester United might already have David de Gea's replacement
Another plot strand is Philippe Coutinho is back in England's north-west. The 26-year-old was replaced by Lionel Messi with Barça 3-2 down at Villarreal on Tuesday. Villarreal were 4-2 up in the 90th minute and it ended 4-4. "Barca draw thanks to Messi and Suarez," Marca wrote. In Catalonia, the Mundo Deportivo splash read 'Gol de liga'.
Coutinho opened the scoring yet received a 5/10 from Sport. "Tucked home the first goal but should have made it 3-0 but hit the post. Went from more to less and was taken off for Messi," they summarised. Ominously for Coutinho, the hamstrung Ousmane Dembele is back in training ahead of Tuesday's flight to Manchester. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
Both of Barça’s nine-figure acquisitions have underwhelmed but patience is wearing thin with Coutinho and he could be marginalised by the precocious Frenkie de Jong next season. The Avengers sequel might not be the only endgame in the summer.
Coutinho, 26, was not just spuriously linked with United in January but baselessly so. Context was provided in the New Year to clarify United had no interest but what industry observers describe as the 'circle of s***e' reaches far and wide. Read More Why United could break City's transfer record in summer window
Back in 2012, a parody account of a football journalist cost Liverpool hundreds of thousands of pounds for Fabio Borini and their new director of communications his job. The Twitter persona of 'Duncan Jenkins' had duped Roma into believing his 'tip-offs' were genuine and their asking price rose. Liverpool’s new DoC, Jen Chang, confronted the user behind Jenkins and allegedly made threats. The former Soccer Illustrated editor, once prolific on Twitter, has still not tweeted since October 22, 2012.
Players and their representatives continue to capitalise on the rumour wind tunnel. Coutinho’s camp are already plotting the most advantageous exit strategy and United are in need of creativity in midfield. Coutinho, of course, lived in north-west England for five years with Liverpool and pallied up with United’s Brazilian right-back Rafael da Silva. Two plus two equals... Read More United fans make Kalidou Koulibaly transfer demand after viral training video
There is no suggestion whatsoever United covet Coutinho but the association has stuck and next week's tie is well-timed for his advisor, Kia Joorabchian. Type ‘Philippe Coutinho’ into Google and 'Man Utd' is the third result after 'stats' and 'wife'. Joorabchian, has ample online interest to trade off.
United have not closely dealt with Joorabchian since Sir Alex Ferguson grew suspicious of his 'engineering' a departure for Carlos Tevez 10 years ago. United’s era of cosying up to renowned agents - Jorge Mendes, Mino Raiola and Fernando Felicevich - has eased significantly to the point Liverpool are paying agents more than double. United have a preference for British potential but, without a technical director, are proceeding with the same strategy as last year. Coutinho tries to get away from Nemanja Matic during the 0-0 in 2017
Frittering £100m or so on a Barcelona substitute would be endemic of the pre-2019 Ed Woodward but the market inflation has tempered United's excitement. Gareth Bale could publicly flirt with United in June and leave them unmoved. Only if United's priority targets are unattainable, Real Madrid and Barca have team-focused forwards who are.
It is a familiar tactic with Europe's elite: If you have a luxury to flog, United are the suckers to target. Barca tried it with Yerry Mina last year and Real did likewise with James Rodriguez. United resisted. They should do so again.
Manchester isn't Coutinho's second home. Read More

thread.title: Os próximos objectivos de Ronaldo e Messi
thread.title_full: Os próximos objectivos de Ronaldo e Messi

posts.title: Os próximos objectivos de Ronaldo e Messi
posts.text:
Recordes que Ronaldo e Messi ainda não bateram - Notícias Recordes que Ronaldo e Messi ainda não bateram Sexta-Feira, 5 de Abril de 2019 Sumário do artigo
Cristiano Ronaldo atingiu outro recorde, mas tem ainda mais objectivos a atingir, tal como Lionel Messi. Lionel Messi e Cristiano Ronaldo: Quantos mais recordes irão eles bater? ©Getty Images Corpo do artigo
A luta incessante de Cristiano Ronaldo e Lionel Messi pelo título de melhor marcador na história do futebol europeu talvez seja a maior emoção desportiva do momento. No entanto, ambos precisam de elevar consideravelmente o seu nível se quiserem bater os seguintes recordes da Taça dos Clubes Campeões Europeus e da UEFA Champions League.
Cristiano Ronaldo fixou mais um recorde a 12 de Março, quando se tornou, aos 34 anos e 35 dias, no jogador mais velho a apontar um "hat-trick" na UEFA Champions League, na vitória por 3-0 sobre o Atlético. Esse recorde pertencia a Claudio Pizarro, que ao serviço do Bayern marcou três golos na goleada por 6-1 sobre o LOSC Lille, a 7 de Novembro de 2012, com 34 anos e 34 dias. O grande Alfredo Di Stéfano ©UEFA.com Golos em finais
Mais golos em finais da Taça dos Campeões: 7 – Alfredo Di Stéfano, Ferenc Puskás (ambos Real Madrid) Golos em mais finais da Taça dos Campeões : 5 – Alfredo Di Stefano (Real Madrid, 1956, 1957, 1958, 1959, 1960) Mais golos numa final da Taça dos Campeões : 4 – Ferenc Puskás (Real Madrid, 1960)
Messi marcou golos em somente duas finais (2009 e 2011), enquanto Ronaldo tem quatro (um em 2008 e 2014, e dois em 2017), mas está ainda a três do recorde partilhado por dois antecessores no Real Madrid. O astro português participou também em cinco finais: menos uma do que Di Stéfano e menos duas do que os recordistas Francisco Gento (Real Madrid) e Paolo Maldini (Milan).
Entretanto, o bis de Ronaldo na final de 2017 é o mais perto que qualquer um deles conseguiu para igualar os quatro tentos de Puskás em 1960.
Mais jogos nas competições de clubes da UEFA
Mais jogos na UEFA Champions League/Taça dos Campeões (incluindo qualificação): 179 – Iker Casillas Mais jogos nas competições de clubes da UEFA (incluindo qualificações) : 186 – Iker Casillas Iker Casillas continua a jogar aos 37 anos ©Getty Images
Ronaldo (127) e Messi (111) estão numa classe à parte no que toca a golos marcados nas provas da UEFA, mas têm um longo caminho a percorrer para alcançar Iker Casillas no número de jogos disputados.
Messi está em 27º nos encontros realizados, com 135, enquanto Ronaldo – que é dois anos e 139 dias mais velho do que Messi – ocupa o quinto lugar, com 168. Ronaldo ainda está longe do antigo colega no Real Madrid, mas o camisola 7 de Portugal só precisa de mais seis jogos para igualar o registo de 174 conseguido pelo lendário Paolo Maldini no Milan.
Em relação à principal competição de clubes da Europa, Ronaldo está no segundo lugar, com 164 jogos (Messi é oitavo, com 131). No entanto, Casillas continua com uma vantagem de 15 encontros em relação à estrela lusitana.
Sucesso com equipas diferentes
Vitórias em finais com mais equipas na UEFA Champions League: 3 – Clarence Seedorf (Ajax 1995, Real Madrid 1998, Milan 2003, 2007) Mais golos na UEFA Champions League ao serviço de equipas diferentes: 6 – Zlatan Ibrahimović (Ajax, Juventus, Inter, Barcelona, Milan, Paris Saint-Germain) Zlatan Ibrahimović marcou na UEFA Champions League por seis clubes ©AFP/Getty Images
Cristiano Ronaldo é o único a ter marcado golos em finais da UEFA Champions League por dois clubes vencedores diferentes – Manchester United em 2008 e Real Madrid em 2014 e 2017. O desafortunado Velibor Vasović fez o mesmo, mas por duas equipas derrotadas, Partizan em 1966 em Ajax em 1969. A transferência de Ronaldo para a Juventus no Verão permite-lhe tentar igualar o feito único de Clarence Seedorf na competição: vencê-la por três clubes diferentes.
O recorde de Zlatan Ibrahimović parece ainda mais distante de Messi e Ronaldo, pois teriam de mudar de clubes regularmente – mantendo a veia goleadora – para perfazer seis. Todos os golos de Messi até ao momento foram com a camisola do Barcelona, enquanto Ronaldo apenas representou, United, Real e Juventus na UEFA Champions League.
Marcador mais velho
Final da UEFA Champions League: Paolo Maldini (36 anos e 333 dias) Milan - Liverpool FC (25/05/2005) UEFA Champions League, da fase de grupos até à final: Francesco Totti (38 anos e 59 dias)CSKA Moscovo - Roma (25/11/2014) Taça dos Campeões: Manfred Burgsmüller (38 anos e 293 dias)Bremen - Dínamo Berlim (11/10/1988) Iniciar sessão gratuita para ver os resumos Veja o golo recordista de Totti e mais
Se a dupla quiser bater o recorde de Maldini terá de ser paciente. A primeira hipótese de Ronaldo será na final de 2021/22, enquanto Messi só terá oportunidade na final de 2023/24 – e, mesmo assim, desde que o jogo não se realize antes de 23 de Maio, situação em que teriam de esperar mais um ano.
Para ultrapassar o recorde de marcador mais velho na UEFA Champions League, Ronaldo precisaria de marcar, da fase de grupos até à final, depois de 1 de Abril de 2023, e Messi após 22 de Agosto de 2025. Para ser o marcador mais velho na história da Taça dos Campeões, Ronaldo terá de marcar após 22 de Novembro de 2023 e Messi após 13 de Abril de 2026.
Golos mais rápidos
Golo mais rápido na UEFA Champions League: Roy Makaay (10,12 segundos)Bayern - Real Madrid (07/03/2007) Golo mais rápido numa final da UEFA Champions League: Paolo Maldini (53 segundos) Milan - Liverpool (25/05/2005) Iniciar sessão gratuita para ver os resumos Golos mais rápidos na Champions League
Roy Makaay estabeleceu uma marca algo assustadora ao marcar pouco depois do pontapé-de-saída frente ao Real Madrid. O golo mais madrugador de Ronaldo UEFA Champions League aconteceu aos quatro minutos pelo Real Madrid, frente à Juventus em Outubro de 2013 , enquanto o mais veloz de Messi chegou ao terceiro minutos da vitória do Barcelona sobre o Celtic, por 7-0, em Setembro de 2016 .
O golo madrugador de Maldini na final contra o Liverpool é outra marca que Ronaldo ou Messi nem chegaram perto; ambos os tentos de Messi na final foram na segunda parte dos encontros, ao passo que o tento mais rápido dos quatro de Ronaldo aconteceu aos 20 minutos da final de 2017, em Cardiff, diante da Juventus.
"Hat-tricks"
"Hat-trick" mais rápido na UEFA Champions League: Bafétimbi Gomis (8 minutos)Dínamo Zagreb - Lyon , 07/12/2011
Para além de se ter tornado no jogador mais velho a marcar um "hat-trick" na UEFA Champions League (com 34 anos e 35 dias), o feito de Ronaldo nos oitavos-de-final frente ao Atlético deixou-o em igualdade com Messi, como jogadores com mais "hat-tricks" na principal competição europeia de clubes (oito).
Luiz Adriano alcançou algo novo ao marcar "hat-tricks" em dois jogos consecutivos na época passada da UEFA Champions League, frente ao BATE – cinco golos no primeiro confronto da fase de grupos e três no segundo , mas Ronaldo igualou o feito do brasileiro com três tentos ante o Bayern e o Atlético na fase a eliminar de 2016/17 .
Recordes duradouros
Golos em mais épocas da UEFA Champions League: Ryan Giggs (16) Messi quer superar o recorde de Raúl González ©Getty Images
Messi marcou pela 14ª época consecutiva na UEFA Champions League, igualando o recorde de Raúl com golos em mais campanhas seguidas na competição. Ronaldo marcou nas últimas 14 em que participou – e 14 no total – após não o ter conseguido nas duas primeiras em que participou, ambas com o United. Assim, em 2020/21 ambos podem igualar o registo de Ryan Giggs.
Total por época
Mais golos numa única temporada nas competições europeias: Radamel Falcao (18), Porto 2010/11 Falcao no final de uma campanha recordista ©Getty Images
A campanha gloriosa de Radamel Falcao na UEFA Europa League 2010/11 fixou uma marca que Messi e Ronaldo ainda não foram capazes de igualar. O total do avançado colombiano inclui um golo na fase de qualificação e 17 na competição propriamente dita. O melhor ano de Messi foi em 2011/12, quando terminou a época europeia com 14 golos, enquanto Ronaldo estabeleceu um recorde na Taça dos Campeões Europeus/UEFA Champions League, com 17 tentos em 2013/14.
Consistência goleadora
Melhor média de golo por jogo nas competições de clubes da UEFA*: 0,87 – Gerd Müller (Bayern)
Em 2017/18, Ronaldo superou o recorde de Ruud van Nistelrooy de marcar em nove jogos seguidos na UEFA Champions League (estabelecido ao serviço do Manchester United em 2002/03), atingindo os 10 encontros consecutivos no triunfo por 3-1 na recepção à Juventus nos quartos-de-final. O recorde de Gerd Müller é imbatível? ©Getty Images
No entanto, no que toca a golos por jogo, Messi e Ronaldo não conseguem competir com os detentores dos recordes. Na UEFA Champions League, Ronaldo tem 0,76 por jogo – 125 golos em 164 jogos – e tem 0,76 nas competições de clubes da UEFA – 127 em 168. Messi tem marcado de forma mais consistente (0,82 na UEFA Champions League – 108 golos em 131 jogos; 0,82 no conjunto de todas as competições da UEFA – 111 em 135).
A média de Gerd Müller de 0,97 golos por jogo (34 em 35 jogos da Taça dos Campeões Europeus) continua a parecer uma marca inalcançável. Para conseguir um registo semelhante, Messi teria de fazer "hat-tricks" nos 11 jogos na prova, enquanto Ronaldo precisaria de marcar por três vezes em cada um dos próximos 17 desafios.
*Por competições de clubes da UEFA entendam-se Taça dos Clubes Campeões Europeus/UEFA Champions League, Taça UEFA/UEFA Europa League, Taça Intercontinental, Taça dos Vencedores de Taças, SuperTaça Europeia da UEFA e Taça UEFA Intertoto.
Dados válidos até 5 de Abril de 2019 © 1998-2019 UEFA. All rights reserved. Última actualização: Sexta-Feira, 5 de Abril de 2019 notitle

thread.title: Los récords que Ronaldo y Messi no han batido (todavía)
thread.title_full: Los récords que Ronaldo y Messi no han batido (todavía)

posts.title: Los récords que Ronaldo y Messi no han batido (todavía)
posts.text:
Los récords que Ronaldo y Messi no han batido (todavía) - Noticias Los récords que Ronaldo y Messi no han batido (todavía)
El luso ha logrado un récord de goles en la #UCL, pero él y el argentino aún buscan superar más registros.
Cristiano Ronaldo y Lionel Messi continúan con su particular batalla para convertirse en el máximo goleador en Europa, pero ambos necesitan estar a su mejor nivel si quieren batir todos los récords de la Copa de Europa y de la UEFA Champions League.
Cristiano Ronaldo logró otro récord el 12 de marzo cuando se convirtió (con 34 años y 35 días) en el jugador con más edad en hacer un 'hat-trick' en la UEFA Champions League, en el 3-0 ante el Atlético. Hasta ese momento el registro lo tenía Claudio Pizarro, cuando con el Bayern hizo tres en el 6-1 ante el Lille el 7 de noviembre de 2012 con 34 años y 34 días. El gran Alfredo Di Stéfano ©UEFA.com Goles en finales
Más goles en finales de la Copa de Europa: 7 - Alfredo Di Stéfano, Ferenc Puskás (ambos en el Real Madrid CF) Goles en más finales de la Copa de Europa: 5 - Alfredo Di Stéfano (Real Madrid, 1956, 1957, 1958, 1959, 1960) Más goles en una única final de la Copa de Europa: 4 - Ferenc Puskás (Real Madrid, 1960)
Messi ha marcado sólo dos goles en finales (2009 y 2011), mientras que Ronaldo ha logrado cuatro (uno en 2008, otro en 2014 y dos en 2017), pero aún está a tres del récord que comparten dos exjugadores del Madrid. Ha jugado seis finales, una menos que Di Stéfano y dos menos que los jugadores con más finales disputadas: Francisco Gento (Real Madrid) y Paolo Maldini (AC Milan).
El doblete de Ronaldo en 2017 es lo más cercano a los cuatro goles marcados por Puskás en la final de 1960. Partidos en competición UEFA
Más partidos en la UEFA Champions/Copa de Europa (incluyendo la fase de clasificación): 179 – Iker Casillas Más partidos en competiciones de clubes de la UEFA (incluyendo la fase de clasificación) : 186 – Iker Casillas Iker Casillas sigue en la Champions League a sus 37 años ©Getty Images
Ronaldo (127) y Messi (111) dominan en lo que se refiere a goles en competiciones de clubes de la UEFA, pero todavía tienen camino que recorrer para alcanzar a Casillas en cuanto a partido europeos se refiere.
Messi está lejos en la clasificación histórica de partidos en competición UEFA con 135, mientras Ronaldo, dos años y 139 días mayor que Messi, es quinto con 168. Ronaldo no superará a su excompañero en el Madrid este temporada, pero el luso sólo necesita seis más para igualar a Paolo Maldini y sus 174 partidos con el Milan (récord para un jugador de campo).
En lo que se refiere a la máxima competición europea, los 160 partidos de Ronaldo le colocan segundo en el ranking (Messi es sexto con 131), a 15 partidos de Casillas. Éxitos en diferentes equipos
Más finales ganadas con más equipos en la UEFA Champions League: 3 - Clarence Seedorf (Ajax 1995, Real Madrid 1998, Milan 2003, 2007) Más equipos con los que ha marcado en la UEFA Champions League: 6 - Zlatan Ibrahimović (Ajax, Juventus, Inter, Barcelona, Milan, Paris Saint-Germain) Zlatan Ibrahimović ha marcado en la UEFA Champions League con seis clubes diferentes ©AFP/Getty Images
Cristiano Ronaldo es el único jugador que ha marcado goles en finales de la UEFA Champions League con dos equipos diferentes y que han ganado la competición: con el Manchester United en 2008 y con el Real Madrid en 2014 y 2017. Velibor Vasović es el único otro jugador que ha marcado en finales de la Copa de Europa en dos clubes, pero en ambos casos terminó en el lado perdedor: con el Partizán en 1966 y con el Ajax en 1969. Al fichar Ronaldo el pasado verano por la Juventus, el luso podría igualar a Clarence Seedord, que es el único jugador hasta el momento que ha jugado y ganado la final con tres equipos diferentes.
El record de Ibrahimović también parece a salvo de Messi y Ronaldo, ya que el sueco cambiaba de club con regularidad y seguía marcando, Con seis clubes de la UEFA Champions League lo ha hecho. Todos los goles de Messi hasta la fecha han sido con el Barcelona mientras que Ronaldo ha visto puerta con el United, Real Madrid y Juventus en la principal competición de clubes del continente. Goleador más veterano
Final de la UEFA Champions League: Paolo Maldini (36 años y 333 días), Milan - Liverpool (25/05/2005) Fase de grupos hasta la final de la UEFA Champions League: Francesco Totti (38 años y 59 días), CSKA - Roma (25/11/2014) Copa de Europa: Manfred Burgsmüller (38 años y 293 días), Werder Bremen - Dínamo Berlin (11/10/1988) Iniciar sesión para ver gratis los resúmenes Cinco grandes goles de Totti
Sí el dúo dinámico pretende eclipsar el récord de Maldini como el jugador más veterano que marca en una final, tendrán que tener paciencia. La primera ocasión de Ronaldo será en la final de 2021/22 mientras que Messi deberá esperar a la 2023/24 siempre y cuando el decisivo encuentro no tenga lugar antes del 23 de mayo, en ese caso tendrán que esperar una temporada más.
Para superar al goleador más veterano en la Champions League, Ronaldo necesita marcar en la competición, fase de grupos hasta el final, después del 1 de abril de 2023 y Messi después del 22 de agosto de 2025. Para convertirse en el goleador más veterano de la Copa de Europa, Ronaldo deberá ver puerta después del 22 de noviembre de 2023 y Messi más allá del 13 de abril de 2026. Goles más rápidos
Gol más rápido de la UEFA Champions League: Roy Makaay (10,12 segundos), Bayern - Real Madrid (07/03/2007) Gol más rápido en una final de la UEFA Champions League: Paolo Maldini (53 segundos) Milan - Liverpool (25/05/2005) Iniciar sesión para ver gratis los resúmenes Los goles más rápidos de la Champions
Goles más rápidos en la Champions League" ]Roy Makaay estableció un complicado récord de batir cuando marcó nada más empezar el encuentro ante el Real Madrid. Los goles más rápidos de Ronaldo y Messi en la UEFA Champions League llegaron en el minuto cuatro: Ronaldo ante la Juventus en octubre de 2013 y Messi frente al Celtic en un 7-0 firmado en septiembre de 2016 .
El rápido tanto de Paolo Maldini ante el Liverpool es una marca de la que ni Ronaldo ni Messi han estado cerca nunca, ya que los dos goles de Messi fueron en la segunda parte mientras que el primero de Ronaldo llegó en el minuto 20 de la final ante la Juventus en Cardiff en 2017. 'Hat-tricks'
'Hat-trick' más rápido en la UEFA Champions League: Bafétimbi Gomis (8 minutos), Dínamo Zagreb - Olympique Lyonnais , 07/12/2011
Además de convertirse en el goleador con mayor edad en lograr un 'hat-trick' en la UEFA Champions League, con 34 años y 35 días, el triplete de Ronaldo en los octavos de final ante el Atlético igualó a Cristiano Ronaldo en número de 'hat-tricks' con Messi en la máxima competición de clubes de Europa al alcanzar los ocho.
Sin embargo ninguno ha estado cerca del rápido 'hat-trick' que consiguió Bafétimbi Gomis ante el Dínamo . El 'hat-trick' más rápido conseguido por Messi, el primero, le llevó 22 minutos (ante el Arsenal, 06/04/10) , aunque sólo 16 minutos separaron su segundo gol del cuarto en los cinco que marcó ante el Bayer 04 Leverkusen el 7 de marzo de 2012 . El 'hat-trick' más rápido de Ronaldo fue en 12 minutos, contra el Malmö en la sexta jornada de esta fase de grupos. Iniciar sesión para ver gratis los resúmenes Los récords especiales de Luiz Adriano
Luiz Adriano abrió un nuevo camino cuando marcó dos 'hat-tricks' consecutivos en la UEFA Champions League frente al BATE, cinco goles en el primer partido y tres en el segundo . Pero Ronaldo lo igualó con sus 'tripletes' ante el Bayern y el Atlético en la fase de eliminatorias de la edición 2016/17. Más goles a lo largo de las temporadas
Goles en más temporadas consecutivas de la UEFA Champions League: Ryan Giggs (16) Messi, con el récord de Raúl en el horizonte ©Getty Images
Messi logró marcar por 14ª edición consecutiva de la UEFA Champions League en la 2018/19 para igualar a Raúl el récord de más #UCL consecutivas anotando. Ronaldo marcó en las últimas 14 (y 14 en total) tras no anotar en sus primeras dos campañas (ambas con el United). Los dos pueden igualar a Giggs en la 2020/21. Más goles en una única temporada
Más goles en una única temporada europea: Radamel Falcao (18), Oporto 2010/11 Falcao puso fin a una temporada de récord ©Getty Images
La hazaña goleadora de Radamel Falcao en la temporada 2010/11 de la UEFA Europa League todavía no ha podido ser igualada ni por Messi ni por Ronaldo. La gesta del colombiano incluye un gol en la fase de clasificación y 17 en la competición en sí. La mejor campaña de Messi fue la 2011/12, cuando terminó el año europeo con 14 tantos mientras que Ronaldo estableció un nuevo récord en Copa de Europa/UEFA Champions League en la 2013/14, cuando marcó 17. Consistencia goleadora
Mejor media goleadora (goles por partido) en competiciones de clubes de la UEFA*: 0,87 - Gerd Müller (Bayern)
En la 2017/18, Ronaldo eclipsó el récord de Ruud van Nistelrooy de nueve partidos consecutivos de la UEFA Champions League establecido con el Manchester United en la 2003/03 cuando anotó su décimo tanto en la derrota por 3-1 de cuartos de final ante Juventus.
Sin embargo, cuando hablamos de goles por partido, Messi y Ronaldo no pueden competir con el mejor en este aspecto. El promedio de Ronaldo en la UEFA Champions League es de 0,76 goles por partido (125 goles en 164 partidos) y de 0,76 en todas las competiciones de clubes de la UEFA (127 en 168). Messi tiene unos números un poco mejores en promedio, con 0,82 goles por partido en la UEFA Champions League (108 goles en 131 partidos, para 0,82 por partido en todas las competiciones UEFA, 111 en 135).
El promedio de 0,97 de Gerd Müller continúa casi que inalcanzable (34 en 35 partidos de Copa de Europa). Para que llegaran a estos números, Messi tendría que lograr 'hat-tricks' en sus próximos diez partidos en todas las competiciones, mientras que Ronaldo debería lograrlos en sus próximos 17 encuentros.
*Las competiciones de clubes de la UEFA incluyen la Copa de Europa/UEFA Champions League, Copa de la UEFA/UEFA Europa League, Copa Intercontinental, Recopa de la UEFA, Supercopa de la UEFA y Copa Intertoto de la UEFA.
Todaas las estadísticas actualizadas a 5 de abril de 2019

thread.title: Records Ronaldo and Messi have not broken (yet)
thread.title_full: Records Ronaldo and Messi have not broken (yet)

posts.title: Records Ronaldo and Messi have not broken (yet)
posts.text:
Records Ronaldo and Messi have not broken (yet) - News Records Ronaldo and Messi have not broken (yet) Friday 5 April 2019 Article summary
Cristiano Ronaldo has snaffled up a scoring record, but he and Lionel Messi still have few more targets to aim for. Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo: how many more records will they break? ©Getty Images Article body
Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi's ongoing battle to be the top goalscorer in European football remains perhaps the sport's greatest drama of our age, but both still need to raise their game considerably if they are to scoop certain European Champion Clubs' Cup and UEFA Champions League records.
Cristiano Ronaldo set another record on 12 March when he became (at 34 years and 35 days) the oldest player to score a UEFA Champions League hat-trick, in a 3-0 win against Atlético. Bayern's Claudio Pizarro had held that record, having hit three in a 6-1 win against LOSC Lille on 7 November 2012, aged 34 years and 34 days. The great Alfredo Di Stéfano ©UEFA.com Final goals
Most goals in European Cup finals: 7 – Alfredo Di Stéfano, Ferenc Puskás (both Real Madrid) Goals in most European Cup finals: 5 – Alfredo Di Stéfano (Real Madrid, 1956, 1957, 1958. 1959, 1960) Most goals in a single European Cup final: 4 – Ferenc Puskás (Real Madrid, 1960)
Messi has scored only two final goals (in 2009 and 2011) while Ronaldo has four (one apiece in 2008 and 2014, and two in 2017) but is still three shy of the record shared by two Real Madrid predecessors. The Portuguese has also made six final appearances: one less than Alfredo Di Stéfano and two short of record holders Francisco Gento (Real Madrid) and Paolo Maldini (AC Milan).
Meanwhile Ronaldo's final double in 2017 is the nearest either he or Messi have come to matching Puskás's four-goal haul from 1960. UEFA competition appearances
Most appearances in UEFA club competitions (including qualifying) : 186 – Iker Casillas Iker Casillas is still going strong at 37 ©Getty Images
Ronaldo (127) and Messi (111) are in a field of their own when it comes to UEFA club competition goals, but have a way to go to reach Iker Casillas's level in terms of European games.Indeed Messi is 27th in the all-time UEFA competition appearance rankings with 135; Ronaldo – two years and 139 days older than Messi – ranks fifth with 168. Ronaldo will not overhaul his one-time Real Madrid team-mate any time soon, but needs just six more appearances to catch Milan hero Maldini's outfield record of 174.
When it comes to Europe's elite competition, Ronaldo's 164 outings put him second in the rankings (with Messi eighth on 131); however, Casillas remains 15 appearances ahead of him. Success with different sides
Final wins with the most teams in the UEFA Champions League: 3 – Clarence Seedorf (Ajax 1995, Real Madrid 1998, Milan 2003, 2007) Highest number of teams scored for in the UEFA Champions League: 6 – Zlatan Ibrahimović (Ajax, Juventus, Internazionale, Barcelona, Milan, Paris Saint-Germain) Zlatan Ibrahimović has scored in the UEFA Champions League for six clubs ©AFP/Getty Images
Ronaldo is unique in having scored in UEFA Champions League finals for two different winning clubs – Manchester United in 2008, and Madrid in 2014 and 2017. The luckless Velibor Vasović is the only player to register in European Cup finals in two different losing causes: Partizan in 1966 and Ajax in 1969. Ronaldo's summer move to Juventus put him in line to replicate Clarence Seedorf's unique feat of winning the competition with three different clubs.
Zlatan Ibrahimović's record looks even safer from Messi and Ronaldo, who would have to start moving clubs regularly – while still scoring – to make it to six. All of Messi's strikes to date have come for Barcelona, while Ronaldo has only played for United, Madrid and Juventus in the UEFA Champions League. Oldest goalscorer
UEFA Champions League final: Paolo Maldini (36 years 333 days) – Milan v Liverpool (25/05/2005) UEFA Champions League, group stage to final: Francesco Totti (38 years 59 days) – CSKA Moskva v Roma (25/11/2014) European Cup: Manfred Burgsmüller (38 years 293 days) – Werder Bremen v Dynamo Berlin (11/10/1988) Log in for free to watch the highlights Totti's landmark goal and more
If our dynamic duo are to surpass Maldini's record as the oldest final scorer, they will have to be patient. Ronaldo's first chance will be in the 2021/22 final, while Messi will not be in line until the 2023/24 showpiece – and only then provided it does not take place before 23 May; otherwise he would have to wait another year.
To overtake the UEFA Champions League oldest scorer mark, Ronaldo will need to register in the competition, group stage to final, after 1 April 2023, and Messi after 22 August 2025. To become the European Cup's all-time oldest scorer, Ronaldo will have to find the net after 22 November 2023, and Messi after 13 April 2026. Fastest goals
Fastest UEFA Champions League goal: Roy Makaay (10.12 seconds) – Bayern München v Real Madrid (07/03/2007) Fastest UEFA Champions League final goal: Paolo Maldini (53 seconds) – Milan v Liverpool (25/05/2005) Log in for free to watch the highlights Fastest Champions League goals
Roy Makaay established a somewhat daunting target with his strike pretty much straight from kick-off against Madrid in 2007. Ronaldo's earliest UEFA Champions League effort came in the fourth minute – for Madrid against Juventus in October 2013 – while Messi's fastest arrived three minutes into Barcelona's 7-0 win against Celtic in September 2016 .
Maldini's quickfire final goal versus Liverpool is also a mark neither Ronaldo nor Messi have come close to achieving; both of Messi's final goals were in the second half, with the earliest of Ronaldo's four coming 20 minutes into the 2017 decider against Juventus in Cardiff. Hat-tricks
Fastest UEFA Champions League hat-trick: Bafétimbi Gomis (8 mins) – Dinamo Zagreb v Olympique Lyonnais , 07/12/2011
As well as becoming the oldest UEFA Champions League hat-trick scorer (aged 34 years and 35 days), Ronaldo's round of 16 treble against Atlético drew him level with Messi's all-time record of eight hat-tricks in Europe's top club competition.
However, neither have outstripped Bafétimbi Gomis's lightning-quick treble against Dinamo . The swiftest of Messi's hat-tricks – his first – took 22 minutes (v Arsenal, 06/04/10 ), though a mere 16 minutes separated his second and fourth strikes in his five-goal salvo against Bayer Leverkusen on 7 March 2012 . Ronaldo's 12-minute treble against Malmö is his fastest to date. Log in for free to watch the highlights Luiz Adriano on ‘special’ goal records
Luiz Adriano broke new ground by scoring back-to-back UEFA Champions League trebles for Shakhtar against BATE in 2014/15 – five goals in the first group meeting and three in the second – but Ronaldo matched him with trebles against Bayern München and Atlético in the 2016/17 knockout phase . Long-distance records
Goals in most UEFA Champions League seasons: Ryan Giggs (16) Messi has his eye on Raúl González's record ©Getty Images
Messi scored in a 14th successive UEFA Champions League campaign in 2018/19 to equal Raúl's record for goals in the most successive UCL seasons. Ronaldo has scored in his last 14 – and 14 in total – having failed to register in his first two campaigns, both with United. Both can match Ryan Giggs's tally in 2020/21. Single-season total
Most goals in a single European season: Radamel Falcao (18), Porto 2010/11 Falcao at the end of his record-breaking campagn ©Getty Images
Radamel Falcao's glorious exploits in the 2010/11 UEFA Europa League set a mark that Messi and Ronaldo have been unable to emulate. The Colombian's haul included one goal in qualifying and 17 in the competition proper. Messi's best year came in 2011/12 when he ended the European season with 14 strikes, while Ronaldo set a European Cup/UEFA Champions League record with 17 in 2013/14. Goalscoring consistency

posts.author: Richard Fay
posts.title: Ivan Rakitic responds to praise from former Manchester United manager Jose Mourinho
posts.text:
Ivan Rakitic responds to praise from former Manchester United manager Jose Mourinho Former Man Utd manager Jose Mourinho recently piled the praise on Barcelona midfielder Ivan Rakitic. Share Get the biggest Manchester United FC stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
Barcelona midfielder Ivan Rakitic admits he was flattered to receive such glowing admiration from former Manchester United manager Jose Mourinho.
The Croatia international has established himself as one of the key performers at the Catalan club and played a pivotal role in his nation's journey to the World Cup final last summer.
Rakitic has just two years remaining on his current deal at the Nou Camp and speculation continues to surround his future at the club, particularly after Barcelona agreed a deal to sign Frenkie de Jong at the end of the season.
Reports have previously linked United with a move for the 31-year-old, and speaking recently Mourinho described the Croat as one of the 'most underrated players' in the world.
"‘He’s a fantastic player at every level," the Portuguese said. "He does the defensive work on the right side to compensate for [Lionel] Messi. He runs miles. Read More Manchester United might already have David de Gea's replacement
"In ball possession he’s fantastic, he’s simple, he’s effective. He’s one of the most underrated players. So I want to finish by saying that because normally we speak about the big names and for me Rakitic [is at that level]."
Rakitic was blown away by the comments Mourinho made, and while thanking the former United manager he also revealed that he hopes to see the Portuguese return to management soon.
"It was amazing to hear that. When I heard it, I said that not even my Dad would not say that," Rakitic told GQ.
"He is one of the greatest coaches in the world and gave me a lot of confidence and motivation. I want to see Mourinho in football soon." Read More

posts.title: Man Utd targets Bale, Varane and Kroos could help Real raise £500m for Pogba and Hazard swoops
posts.text:
Bale out funds Man Utd targets Bale, Varane and Kroos could help Real raise £500m for Pogba and Hazard swoops
Zinedine Zidane prepared to sacrifice up to nine first-team players to bankroll moves for superstar duo and new squad members Gossip 5th April 2019, 9:25 am Updated: 5th April 2019, 9:45 am REAL MADRID could reportedly be set to raise £500million to help capture Paul Pogba and Eden Hazard by offloading as many as NINE players this summer.
Spanish newspaper AS claims Manchester United targets Gareth Bale, Raphael Varane and Toni Kroos are all possibly heading out of the Bernabeu this summer as Zinedine Zidane prepares for an epic rebuild. AFP Real Madrid could raise up to £500m through the sales of players including Man Utd target Gareth Bale
The Frenchman is believed to be lining up a mega-money swoop for United midfield superstar Pogba, 26.
While Chelsea contract rebel Hazard, 28, looks set to end his Stamford Bridge spell and become a Galactico.
However, the pair are sure to cost a pretty penny , with Real also announcing plans for an incredible £500m stadium redevelopment .
And it means Zidane is ready to bid farewell to a number of first-team stars as he looks to usher in a bold new era and challenge Barcelona once more.
Centre-back Varane, 25, midfielder Kroos, 29, and winger Bale, also 29, have all been linked with United as part of Real’s move for Pogba. Who could leave Real this summer?

thread.title: 'United wil Barça en Real afschrikken en hoort eis van 580.000 euro per week'
thread.title_full: 'United wil Barça en Real afschrikken en hoort eis van 580.000 euro per week'

posts.title: 'United wil Barça en Real afschrikken en hoort eis van 580.000 euro per week'
posts.text:
'United wil Barça en Real afschrikken en hoort eis van 580.000 euro per week' Goal Transfers Manchester United wil zo snel mogelijk verlengen met Paul Pogba, zo melden diverse Engelse media vrijdag.
De middenvelder ligt nog tot medio 2021 vast, waarbij de Engelse topclub de eenzijdige optie heeft om met een jaar te verlengen. Desalniettemin hoopt de grootmacht op een nieuwe krabbel van de middenvelder, die nadrukkelijk wordt gelinkt aan een vertrek bij the Red Devils .
De laatste dagen wordt Pogba in verband gebracht met een overstap naar onder meer Real Madrid en Barcelona . Zaakwaarnemer Mino Raiola zou achter de schermen al druk bezig zijn om een transfer naar de top van LaLiga te realiseren. Manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer zei onlangs al dat hij en de club in gesprek zijn geweest met Pogba over de toekomst van de Fransman.Volgens Engelse media gaat United binnenkort om de tafel met Pogba om een contractverlenging tot medio 2024 te bespreken. De middenvelder eist naar verluidt echter een weeksalaris van circa 580.000 euro als hij zich voor een langere periode verbindt aan de topclub. Pogba wil hiermee naast Alexis Sánchez komen te staan qua gage, aangezien de Chileen sinds zijn komst in 2018 reeds in het bezit is van een 'megacontract'. Pogba, die momenteel ongeveer 350.000 euro per week toucheert, is niet de enige speler van United die wordt gelinkt aan een transfer. Ook onder anderen Sánchez, Ander Herrera, Juan Mata, David de Gea, Marcos Rojo, Matteo Darmian en Antonio Valencia zouden op weg naar de uitgang zijn bij de huidige nummer zes van de Premier League.

thread.title: Worse for wear Ross Barkley falls into taxi at 5am and Danny Drinkwater leaves club with two mystery women as Chelsea stars hit town
thread.title_full: Worse for wear Ross Barkley falls into taxi at 5am and Danny Drinkwater leaves club with two mystery women as Chelsea stars hit town

posts.author: Alex Terrell
posts.title: Worse for wear Ross Barkley falls into taxi at 5am and Danny Drinkwater leaves club with two mystery women as Chelsea stars hit town
posts.text:
EFL HIT BAR Worse for wear Ross Barkley falls into taxi at 5am and Danny Drinkwater leaves club with two mystery women as Chelsea stars hit town
The Blues stars had a night out at swanky club Raffles after seeing Drake at the O2 with the players given a day off after their 3-0 win over Brighton Pictured 5th April 2019, 8:53 am Updated: 5th April 2019, 9:07 am CHELSEA star Ross Barkley looked worse for wear as he stumbled into a taxi at 5am following a night out clubbing with his team-mates.
Blues pal Danny Drinkwater left with two mystery women after a team social at exclusive Raffles club just a short walk from Stamford Bridge. Splash News Ross Barkley stumbles into a taxi after 5am following a night out at Raffles Club in West London Splash News Ross Barkley sports a Boston Red Sox jacket after leaving Raffles Splash News 9 Danny Drinkwater hops into a taxi with two mystery women after his night out
The West London club do not play until Monday night when they face bitter rivals West Ham at home.
And the players made the most of being given a day off by boss Maurizio Sarri by heading to see Drake at the O2 Arena.
Barkley , 25, donned a Boston Red Sox jacket and clambered into a taxi having initially left the club before heading back in to grab a bottle of water.
Gary Cahill, Ruben Loftus-Cheek and Ethan Ampadu all left at around 1.30am, before Olivier Giroud departed around 2.25am.
England midfielder Loftus-Cheek, 23, sported a 'Money Mayweather' hoodie with an image of Floyd Mayweather on the front after his night out. HITTING FORM
Barkley has been in good form for club and country in recent weeks, scoring two for England in their 5-1 win at Montenegro, before he played the full 90 minutes in the controversial 2-1 win over Cardiff last weekend.
Giroud and Loftus-Cheek were both on the scoresheet as Chelsea put three past Brighton on Wednesday to fire them above Manchester United and into fifth in the table as the top-four race in the Premier League reaches boiling point.
One familiar face leaving the party was Love Island star Kaz Crossley.
The make-up artist, 24, has returned to her day job following her fun in the sun last summer. Splash News Love Island star Kaz Crossley also left the same night club with a grin on her face Splash News Drinkwater, right, covered his face after hopping into a taxi with two women Splash News Ruben Loftus-Cheek donned a Floyd Mayweather hoodie as he left the venue Splash News Gary Cahill left at around 1.30am wearing a white t-shirt and suit jacket Splash News Drinkwater lets off a grin as he heads away from the venue Splash News 9 Olivier Giroud leaves wearing a black leather jacket Chelsea 3-0 Brighton - Chelsea stroll past Brighton to go above Man Utd and stay in the hunt for a Champions League place

thread.title: Bực M.U bám riết, Real đâm 'nhát dao thứ 2' kết liễu mộng bom tấn 500 triệu
thread.title_full: Bực M.U bám riết, Real đâm 'nhát dao thứ 2' kết liễu mộng bom tấn 500 triệu

posts.title: Bực M.U bám riết, Real đâm 'nhát dao thứ 2' kết liễu mộng bom tấn 500 triệu
posts.text:
Bực M.U bám riết, Real đâm 'nhát dao thứ 2' kết liễu mộng bom tấn 500 triệu 07:33 Thứ sáu 05/04/2019 | 4 BongDa.com.vn Sau tuyên bố cứng rắn, Los Blancos tiếp tục có động thái chấm dứt hy vọng câu kéo trụ cột của Quỷ Đỏ.
Cách đây 2 ngày, Manchester United đã phải hứng chịu thất bại đáng quên trước Wolverhampton Wanderers. Bất chấp sớm có bàn mở tỷ số do công Scott McTominay, Quỷ Đỏ vẫn ôm hận khi bị đội chủ nhà lội ngược dòng hạ gục 2-1. Trắng tay tại Molineux Stadium, United rơi xuống vị trí thứ 6 và đối diện nguy cơ không thể lọt vào Top 4 Premier League.
Ở trận cầu với Wolves, Chris Smalling gây thất vọng với bàn phản lưới nhà trong hiệp hai. Dù là những cái tên có thâm niên trong phòng thay đồ United nhưng Smalling và 1 trung vệ người Anh khác là Phil Jones không ít lần mắc sai lầm trên sân, khiến đội nhà phải trả giá.
Trong bối cảnh Eric Bailly thường xuyên chấn thương, BLĐ Quỷ Đỏ đặt quyết tâm chiêu mộ 1 trung vệ đẳng cấp sát cánh cùng Victor Lindelof mùa tới. Mục tiêu những người đứng đầu sân Old Trafford tin tưởng có thể vá lỗ hổng hàng thủ là Raphael Varane của Real Madrid. United khao khát có Varane.
Varane cân nhắc khả năng ra đi vào mùa hè, nhưng Los Blancos kiên quyết không nhả người. Đội chủ sân Bernabeu tuyên bố sẽ chỉ nhả trụ cột nếu nhận đủ 500 triệu euro tiền phá vỡ hợp đồng .
Trong diễn biến mới nhất, AS cho hay Real còn muốn chấm dứt hoàn toàn hy vọng của United, bằng cách gửi đến Varane đề nghị gia hạn mới. Los Blancos tự tin HLV Zinedine Zidane có thể thuyết phục cậu học trò đồng hương cam kết tương lai tại CLB. Phụng Sồ | 06:40 05/04/2019

thread.title: Romelu Lukaku's agent hints at possible Manchester United exit
thread.title_full: Romelu Lukaku's agent hints at possible Manchester United exit

posts.author: Richard Fay
posts.title: Romelu Lukaku's agent hints at possible Manchester United exit
posts.text:
Richard Fay 08:31, 5 APR 2019 Sport Romelu Lukaku's agent admits the forward will keep his options open in regards to his Manchester United future.
The Belgian forward has struggled for consistency during his two-season spell at Old Trafford despite maintaining his incredible scoring run since joining the club.
Lukaku has netted 42 goals during his brief spell at United but has often found himself out of the team with Marcus Rashford instead often favoured as the starting striker.
The 25-year-old is still happy to be at United, but his agent Federico Pastorello admits Lukaku is open to moving to a new league in the future.
"At the moment he is very focused on finishing the season,” Pastorello told Sky Sports.
Read More Manchester United transfer news LIVE United prepare for Barcelona clash as Eric Bailly emerges as 'shock' target for Real Madrid “The competition for third and fourth place in England is very tight so let’s see what will happen in the future at the end the season.
“It’s his second season here and he will still have three years on his contract until the end. Let’s see. He’s someone who loves to know a different culture, a different football.
“He sees a way to have a career playing in different countries because he would like to win some trophies and prove himself and say to his children ‘I won there and I won there and I won there’ and ‘I was a very good player in all the top championships’ so let’s see, the future is really very open but, at the moment, we don’t discuss about that because really the season is in a big moment.”
