posts.title: fans make Kalidou Koulibaly transfer demand after viral training video
posts.text:
Richard Fay 08:08, 5 APR 2019 Sport Manchester United supporters have demanded the club to sign Kalidou Koulibaly this summer after a video of his skills in training went viral.
Koulibaly is a target for United as they look to reinforce their back line with a new top quality addition at the end of the season, and based on his latest exploits he is exactly what the club need.
Although the Senegal international is known for his composure at the heart of defence, it is his skills with the ball at his feet which have really had supporters talking.
Napoli uploaded a clip to social media on Thursday which showed the centre-back in training beating a teammate with step overs before scoring an outrageous rabona effort into the top corner of the net.
The skill shown from Koulibaly was a world away from some of the football seen at United this season, and supporters are demanding he is signed in the coming months.
Incredible
One of the best defenders in the world, ladies and gentlemen @kkoulibaly26 @sscnapoli pic.twitter.com/ftLC3NIipY
— 433 (@official433) April 4, 2019
Needed
Imagine smalling or Jones doing this great banter they would fall over instantly
— Nathan (@NSG94) April 4, 2019
Woodward, are you watching?
@ManUtd are you watching this?
— varun surana (@varunsurana1234) April 4, 2019
Simple
@ManUtd
— Gabriel Avila (@GABRIELavila30) April 4, 2019
Write the cheque
This is Koulibaly in training... Ed better be writing that cheque immediately #MUFC pic.twitter.com/g9RmI6TMF1
— Ben Senior (@BenSenior_) April 4, 2019
Required recruitment
@markgoldbridge this guy is a must for utd this summer
— cjhgaming (@CallumHillyer) April 4, 2019
Break the bank
I’d break the bank for KK, Guy is worth two defenders.
— Andy Chist (@JustifiableFist) April 4, 2019

thread.title: Arsenal & Manchester United target Samuel Umtiti might seek transfer if he continues as substitute
thread.title_full: Arsenal & Manchester United target Samuel Umtiti might seek transfer if he continues as substitute

posts.author: Metro Sport Reporter
posts.title: Arsenal & Manchester United target Samuel Umtiti might seek transfer if he continues as substitute
posts.text:
Major Unai Emery target Nicolas Tagliafico scores humiliating own goal
Spanish outlet Sport claim that although Umtiti does not want to leave the club, the Barcelona dressing room know that will change if he continues to be sidelined.
A serious knee injury kept Umtiti out of action for much of the season, but Clement Lenglet has kept his place in Ernesto Valverde’s side despite the return of his more experienced countryman. Advertisement Advertisement
Umtiti warmed the benched for both legs against Lyon in the Champions League and has moved in and out of Barcelona’s eleven in La Liga since returning to action in February. Umtiti started for France during in the international break (Picture: Getty)
Barcelona are open to offloading the 25-year-old as they prepare to move for fellow defender and Ajax star Matthijs de Ligt this summer.
The Catalan giants are not ruling out keeping Umtiti on the books, but have been frustrated by his conduct in the last year.
Barcelona were unhappy Umtiti, who is valued at around £77million, took so long to agree a new contract last summer. Barcelona are considering cashing in on Umtiti (Picture: Getty)
Umtiti then further irked his employers by refusing to have surgery on a knee injury to correct a long-term issue.
Barcelona’s wishes were resisted by Umtiti and instead he sought alternative treatment in Qatar, before eventually realising surgery had to be done.
Umtiti has made just eleven appearances this season and Barcelona feel if he was not so stubborn about having surgery, then the knee issue could have been resolved much earlier in the campaign. Advertisement

thread.title: What Benjamin Mendy needs to do to save his Man City career - Charlotte Duncker
thread.title_full: What Benjamin Mendy needs to do to save his Man City career - Charlotte Duncker - Manchester Evening News

posts.author: Charlotte Duncker
posts.title: What Benjamin Mendy needs to do to save his Man City career - Charlotte Duncker
posts.text:
Share Comments By Charlotte Duncker 08:00, 5 APR 2019 Sport opinion Benjamin Mendy has not played for Manchester City since November. Get the biggest Manchester City FC stories by email Subscribe See our privacy notice More newsletters Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email "We don't have many options," Pep Guardiola lamented after Oleksandr Zinchenko limped off in the win against Cardiff with what looked like a hamstring injury.
The Ukrainian has been a revelation at left-back for Manchester City in the past couple of months, establishing himself as first choice, and it is testament to his commitment and recent performances that Guardiola was left to rue his potential absence ahead of the FA Cup semi-final at Wembley this weekend.
But Guardiola does have an option at left-back for Saturday.
And the player in question isn't an unknown academy prodigy that will be thrust into the limelight for the first time but instead a £50 million France international in the form of Benjamin Mendy.
When pushed on injuries in his squad ahead of the game against Cardiff, Guardiola did not mention Mendy. Fabian Delph and Sergio Aguero were the only named absentees but there was still no room for Mendy in the squad.
Guardiola was non-committal when asked if Mendy would come into the starting XI on Saturday.
“We’ll see tomorrow how he feels and how he trains,” Guardiola said. “We don’t have many options.”
Man City vs Cardiff reaction Player ratings: Man City player ratings vs Cardiff
Highlights: Man City vs Cardiff
Foden: How Man City fans rated his performance
Report: Kevin De Bruyne inspires win
Zinchenko: Guardiola provides injury update
De Bruyne: City star's advice to Foden
The France international has had his fair share of bad luck with injuries since joining City. He missed the majority of last season with a cruciate knee injury and had to have surgery on the opposite knee this season.
But, since recovering from his latest setback at the start of February, he has been in just one matchday squad, against West Ham, and hasn't played a game since November last year.
While there should be some sympathy that the start of his City career has been blighted with injury, the reality is the 24-year-old has not helped himself with matters off the pitch.
Guardiola shrugged off the suggestion Mendy was in a nightclub at 3.30am the night before he was expected in training but there's only so long the City manager will act calmly about such reports.
"They are old enough to know what they have to do, I’m not his father. I would prefer him to go home earlier but I don’t control the players in that situation," Guardiola said when the reports were put to him.
Read More Man City extend impressive Manchester United record with Premier League win over Cardiff Read More Man City star Kevin De Bruyne makes bold England Euro 2020 claim “(I’m) not frustrated, I’m a relaxed guy. It might not look like it but I sleep quite well.”
Guardiola was also stunned when it was suggested Mendy was in Hong Kong in February. It turned out to be a prank from the France international but the fact that it wasn't beyond the realms of possibility that the defender would pull that kind of stunt says it all.
He's become more popular for his off the pitch antics than he has for heroics on it and if he's going to stay at the club beyond the summer that's going to have to change.
Guardiola sent a rallying call to his squad players in his Cardiff programme notes where he reaffirmed the importance of the strength in depth in their squad to get them over the line in the remaining three competitions.
Read More Man City - key information Transfers latest Pep Guardiola Sergio Aguero Pep Guardiola's contract With Zinchenko and Delph out injured, it's Mendy's time to shine.
He's been in regular training for a while now but clearly isn't doing enough at the CFA to prove to Guardiola why he deserves a place in the match day squad, let alone the starting XI.
The big question will be whether Guardiola is prepared to take a risk on him on Saturday evening in a crucial game in City's Quadruple hopes, when he hasn't played in five months.
He's got to convince City chiefs in the next few weeks why they shouldn't consider cutting their losses and letting him go when the transfer window opens.
That starts on Saturday at Wembley, but, if he can't make the squad for that then it would likely signal the beginning of the end.

thread.title: Hasebe: "Ich will noch einmal in die Champions League"
thread.title_full: Hasebe: "Ich will noch einmal in die Champions League"

posts.title: Hasebe: "Ich will noch einmal in die Champions League"
posts.text:
Sprunggelenk-OP: Tawathas trauriges Ende in Frankfurt Hasebe: "Ich will noch einmal in die Champions League" Nach dem Gewinn der Deutschen Meisterschaft 2009 mit dem VfL Wolfsburg spielte Makoto Hasebe in der Saison 2009/10 zum ersten und einzigen Mal in der Champions League. Zum Abschluss seiner Karriere will er es mit Frankfurt noch einmal unbedingt in die Königsklasse schaffen - die Chancen stehen keineswegs schlecht. Will unbedingt noch einmal in der Königsklasse ran: Frankfurts Makoto Hasebe. © imago
Es gab Zeiten, und die liegen gar nicht mal so lange zurück, da reiste Frankfurt als der große Außenseiter nach Gelsenkirchen. Diese Saison ist das anders, Schalke steckt im Abstiegskampf, die Eintracht greift nach den Sternen. Wenn die Hessen am Samstag auf die Königsblauen treffen, sind sie der klare Favorit. Hasebe hat das Schalker Pokal-Aus gegen Werder Bremen vor dem Fernseher verfolgt und sieht für Frankfurt "große Chancen", den nächsten Dreier einzufahren. Im Brustton der Überzeugung sagt er: "Wenn wir 100 Prozent auf den Platz bringen, werden wir sicher gewinnen." Hasebe: "Wir können vielleicht noch Platz 3 erreichen"
Um den großen Traum von der Königsklasse zu realisieren, wird sich die Mannschaft in den verbleibenden sieben Ligaspielen nur wenige Punktverluste erlauben dürfen. Dass es noch zu einem Einbruch wie in den vergangenen beiden Jahren kommen könnte, glaubt Hasebe nicht. Der 35-Jährige verweist auf die hohe Qualität des Kaders, die dazu führe, dass auch verletzte Stammspieler "fast gleichwertig ersetzt" werden könnten. Deshalb ist er überzeugt, dass die Mannschaft ihr Niveau bis zum Schluss halten kann. Hasebe richtet den Blick sogar nach oben: "Wir können vielleicht noch Platz 3 erreichen. Trotzdem müssen wir bescheiden bleiben und uns auf jedes einzelne Spiel konzentrieren." Rolle als Libero auf den Leib geschneidert
In die Königsklasse durfte er in seiner langen Karriere erst einmal reinschnuppern, das ist beinahe zehn Jahre her. In der Saison 2009/10 schied er mit Wolfsburg jedoch schon in der Gruppenphase nach Spielen gegen Manchester United, ZSKA Moskau und Besiktas Istanbul aus. Seinerzeit agierte er übrigens noch in der Mittelfeldraute als halbrechter Achter - heutzutage kann man sich das kaum noch vorstellen. Die Rolle als Libero ist dem früheren Kapitän der japanischen Nationalmannschaft auf den Leib geschneidert. Sein Können würde er kommende Spielzeit nur zu gerne eine Etage über der Europa League unter Beweis stellen: "Ich will unbedingt noch einmal in der Champions League spielen - mit der Eintracht." Tawatha: Saisonaus nach Sprunggelenks-OP
Auf Schalke kann Frankfurt den nächsten wichtigen Schritt in Richtung Königsklasse machen. Ob Trainer Adi Hütter auf die Dienste von Sebastien Haller (Bauchmuskelprobleme) und Mijat Gacinovic (Fersenprobleme) zurückgreifen kann, war auch am Donnerstag noch unklar. Das Duo trainierte weiterhin nur individuell, was die Einsatzchancen für den Samstag nicht gerade erhöht. Derweil gab der Klub bekannt, dass Linksverteidiger Taleb Tawatha am Mittwoch am Sprunggelenk operiert wurde, das ist gleichbedeutend mit dem Saisonaus. Da der Vertrag des Israelis ausläuft, wird er wohl nie wieder für die Eintracht spielen - eine Verlängerung mit dem Reservisten ist nahezu ausgeschlossen.
Julian Franzke

thread.title: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer wants Callum Hudson-Odoi, Declan Rice and Aaron Wan-Bissaka at Man Utd as he targets English rebuild

posts.author: Anthony Chapman
posts.title: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer wants Callum Hudson-Odoi, Declan Rice and Aaron Wan-Bissaka at Man Utd as he targets English rebuild
posts.text:
EFL New Era Ole Gunnar Solskjaer wants Callum Hudson-Odoi, Declan Rice and Aaron Wan-Bissaka at Man Utd as he targets English rebuild
Red Devils boss ready to splash the cash on trio of English stars as he looks to usher in new era Gossip 5th April 2019, 7:54 am Updated: 5th April 2019, 7:54 am MANCHESTER UNITED boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is reportedly lining up bids for three of English football’s top youngsters.
The Times claims Chelsea winger Callum Hudson-Odoi, West Ham midfielder Declan Rice and Crystal Palace right-back Aaron Wan-Bissaka are all in Solskjaer’s sights as he looks to buy British this summer. EPA 3 Man Utd are lining up a raid on Chelsea for Callum Hudson-Odoi
United are believed to be in the market for a new winger, with former player Wilfried Zaha under scrutiny as out-of-contract Juan Mata prepares to join Barcelona .
But at 18-years-old, and with just a year left on his Chelsea contract, Hudson-Odoi has the potential to be a far better signing.
The newly-capped England international is upset he has not been given enough playing time at Stamford Bridge.
And Hudson-Odoi could turn his back on Maurizio Sarri’s side for a controversial switch to their Premier League rivals. FRESH LOOK
Meanwhile, fellow Three Lions debutant Rice, 20, has become one of the Premier League’s leading anchormen following a meteoric rise under Manuel Pellegrini.
United look set to lose Ander Herrera on a free transfer to Paris Saint-Germain , with Paul Pogba’s future also up in the air .
Rice is already a commanding presence in the centre of the park and could be just the man needed to dictate United’s play from deep.
Solskjaer is also keen to bring a new right-back to Old Trafford, with exiled captain Antonio Valencia heading for the exit. Latest Man Utd News Exclusive VERY ANDY Herrera gets £52MILLION if he quits Utd for PSG to be one of world's highest paid Live Blog Man United transfer news LIVE - Latest updates from Old Trafford FERGIE'S RISE Sir Alex Ferguson's company's value rises to £11m after earning £2m last year QUEUE BEAUTY Solskjaer plots Carrington revamp to give Man Utd stars separate dinner queue Exclusive Man Utd ready for Pogba talks to fend off Real - but star wants £500k-a-week
And Wan-Bissaka, 21, would represent another fine long-term signing.
The ace is yet to be capped by Gareth Southgate but is a regular for Aidy Boothroyd’s Under-21s.
Palace could be willing to talk figures, although additional interest from Manchester City is sure to see Wan-Bissaka’s asking price rise sharply. posts.title: Herrera to pocket £52MILLION if he quits Man Utd for five-year PSG deal to be one of world’s top-paid stars
posts.text:
EFL NEW PAY ERA Herrera to pocket £52MILLION if he quits Man Utd for five-year PSG deal to be one of world’s top-paid stars
Midfielder's contract ends this summer and he's set for £200k-a-week Paris move as Utd chiefs don't like his £160k demands Exclusive 5th April 2019, 7:51 am Updated: 5th April 2019, 7:52 am By Andrew Dillon Invalid Date, ANDER HERRERA stands to trouser a whopping £52MILLION if he walks out of Old Trafford this summer.
The Manchester United midfielder is poised to sign a five-year contract with French giants Paris Saint-Germain worth around £200,000 a week which will make him one of the richest players in world football. Getty - Contributor 1 In-form midfielder Ander Herrera is thought to want £160,000 a week but Manchester United seem certain to reject that - meaning he could join PSG
Spaniard Herrera is reluctantly leaving the club he joined in 2014 from Athletic Bilbao having failed to agree new terms.
The 29-year-old will be a free agent come June after five years with the Red Devils, which has enabled moneybags PSG to offer such huge wages long term.
United’s board would not meet Herrera’s request for £160,000 a week which looks set to trigger a parting of the ways.
Herrera and many other leading figures at United believe they deserve some pay parity with striker Alexis Sanchez who is believed to earn around £505,000 a week.
But new permanent boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is set to let at least four other senior stars leave this summer. most read in football

thread.title: Les folles exigences de Paul Pogba pour rester à Manchester United
thread.title_full: Les folles exigences de Paul Pogba pour rester à Manchester United

posts.author: Alexis Pereira
posts.title: Les folles exigences de Paul Pogba pour rester à Manchester United
posts.text:
Accueil > Premier League > Transferts > Les folles exigences de Paul Pogba pour rester à Manchester United Les folles exigences de Paul Pogba pour rester à Manchester United Publié le : Alexis Pereira Suivre @apereira__ Alors qu'Ole Gunnar Solskjaer souhaite en faire la pierre angulaire de son Manchester United la saison prochaine, Paul Pogba a fait savoir à sa direction quelles étaient ses attentes sur le plan salarial. Et ça pique ! Paul Pogba demande un salaire fou pour rester à MU ! ©Maxppp
Manchester United s’est remis sur de bons rails depuis le départ de José Mourinho. Ole Gunnar Solskjaer a réussi à pacifier et relancer un vestiaire démotivé. Qualifiés pour les quarts de finale de Ligue des Champions et toujours en course pour une place sur le podium de Premier League en fin de saison, les Red Devils ont repris espoir. Paul Pogba (26 ans) est l’un des symboles de ce retour en forme. Décevant sous les ordres du Special One, le champion du Monde 2018 revit avec le Norvégien.
Il est donc logique de voir le coach mancunien, confirmé pour les trois prochaines saisons, vouloir s’appuyer sur lui pour bâtir son groupe à l’avenir. Pour l’exaucer, MU souhaiterait lui offrir un nouveau courant jusqu’en juin 2024 (il est actuellement lié jusqu’en juin 2021). L’international tricolore (66 sélections, 10 réalisations), en position de force donc, ne dit pas forcément non. Mais la Pioche et son représentant, le truculent Mino Raiola, se montrent exigeants. Pogba veut 30,3 M€ par an !
Selon les informations du Sun , qui a annoncé en exclusivité l’arrivée de l’attaquant camerounais Eric Maxim Choupo Moting au Paris SG l’été dernier, le milieu de terrain exige de devenir, à égalité avec le Chilien Alexis Sanchez (29 ans), le joueur le mieux payé du club. Autrement dit, l’ancien pensionnaire du Havre demande 583 665€ par semaine, soit 30,3 M€ par an comme base pour des négociations au sujet d’un nouveau contrat qui s’ouvrent la semaine prochaine selon le tabloïd anglais.
Une somme folle. Mais entre la volonté de Solskjaer et la menace Real Madrid, les pensionnaires d’Old Trafford semblent dans l’impasse. Marca croit en effet savoir que le Français est partant pour rejoindre Zinedine Zidane au Santiago Bernabeu . Les Anglais savent donc qu’ils vont devoir se montrer particulièrement séduisants pour parvenir à le retenir. Quoi qu’il décide pour cet été, pour Paul Pogba, c’est le jackpot assuré !

thread.title: How much United's perfect transfer window would cost - Tyrone Marshall
thread.title_full: How much Manchester United's perfect transfer window would cost - Tyrone Marshall - Manchester Evening News

posts.author: Tyrone Marshall
posts.title: How much United's perfect transfer window would cost - Tyrone Marshall
posts.text:
Tyrone Marshall 07:00, 5 APR 2019 Sport opinion United might have to break their transfer record to sign Jadon Sancho this summer (Image: PA) The revolving door at Carrington could be kept busy this summer as Ole Gunnar Solskjaer looks to turn his Manchester United squad into title challengers.
United are targeting at least three new additions during the next transfer window but with departures on the cards it could yet be more.
It may need to be more if Solskjaer's side are to make the leap to catch Manchester City and Liverpool next term, but if United are to pull off what would be considered a 'dream' summer then it may set them back more than £300million.
Using estimated transfer values from the CIES Football Observatory five significant new arrivals could cost United a combined £332million, with little in the way of sales coming back into the coffers.
The CIES Football Observatory use a detailed methodology to estimate values, based on statistical performance, age, position, remaining contract length and clubs likely to be interested. Importantly over the last five years they boast that "the correlation between values estimated and fees paid has constantly been above 75%."
Read More How Manchester United could line up with transfer targets next season So the estimated value of some of United's targets can act as an ideal starting guide for the size of cheques Ed Woodward can expect to be signing this summer.
Starting at the back, Napoli central defender Kalidou Koulibaly is valued at €57.3million (£49m). That fee may look a little on the low side given Napoli's suspected demands and the fact that Liverpool's £75million signing of Virgil van Dijk has distorted the market for defenders, but it might give United confidence that a little bit of negotiation might get them Koulibaly for a reasonable fee.
A world class central defender is a must this summer and Koulibaly looks the most attainable, with Raphael Varane likely to remain at Real Madrid following Zinedine Zidane's return.
United have also been linked with a move for Crystal Palace right-back Aaron Wan-Bissaka. The 20-year-old Englishman fits the profile of an ideal United recruit under Solskjaer, but given they spent £19million on Diogo Dalot last year he wouldn't seem to be a priority. It would certainly box off the right-back position for the best part of a decade however, and at £24million Wan-Bissaka could prove to be a bargain.
Kalidou Koulibaly of Napoli (Image: Danilo Di Giovanni/Soccrates/Getty Images) In midfield United have been linked with moves for West Ham's Declan Rice, another whose age and nationality fits the Solskjaer profile, as well as Atletico Madrid's Saul Niguez.
Moves for both may be dependant on Ander Herrera's Old Trafford future, but they would certainly both strengthen the United midfield. Rice has had a superb season with the Hammers, but did sign a long-term deal earlier in the campaign. At £59million he would be an expensive recruit, but could begin the transition of replacing Nemanja Matic.
Niguez can play in a variety of midfield positions, both defensively and offensively, and has plenty of big-game experience under Diego Simeone in Madrid. At 24 he has years ahead of him and would bring some of that warrior-like Atletico mentality to United. He could be a bargain at £74million.
Read More Manchester United might already have United's number one target this summer is likely to be Jadon Sancho . The teenager has enjoyed a stunning year at Borussia Dortmund and looks the perfect Old Trafford recruit. He would bring pace and energy to the attack and at 19 has a long future stretching ahead of him, for England and for his club side.
The bad news is his estimated value is £126million. That would smash United's transfer record, but there's no doubt signing Sancho would be a major statement of intent at Old Trafford. Imagine a front three of Sancho, Marcus Rashford and Anthony Martial next season.
With the ins complete United could offload a few players, but they shouldn't expect to recoup much in the way of fees. Antonio Valencia is out of contract, while Matteo Darmian and Marcos Rojo could fetch around £15million in total.
United have been linked with Saul Niguez (Image: Gonzalo Arroyo Moreno/Getty Images) United would listen to interest in Alexis Sanchez , but from a value of £85million a year ago, the CIES Football Observatory now estimate he's worth just £29million. In truth, United would probably snap your hand off for that.
Eric Bailly has fallen out of favour recently and could fetch around £21million, while if both Rice and Saul arrive, Andreas Pereira may be allowed to leave. He's valued at £11million.
But this window should be all about the incomings at United. They need a big summer to make up ground on City and Liverpool, but it could be an expensive one.
Read More How Luke Shaw altered Manchester United's transfer plans Read More Why Paul Pogba should ignore Real Madrid and become a Manchester United great

thread.title: These young men lost their lives in open water - their families hope new safety measures will prevent more deaths
thread.title_full: These young men lost their lives in open water - their families hope new safety measures will prevent more deaths - Manchester Evening News

posts.author: Sophie Halle-Richards
posts.title: These young men lost their lives in open water - their families hope new safety measures will prevent more deaths
posts.text:
Share Comments By Sophie Halle-Richards 06:00, 5 APR 2019 News Steven Dyson (top left), Dylan Ramsay (bottom left), Dwayne Thompson (middle) and Paul Lawson all died in open water (Image: Manchester Evening News / United Utilities) Get the biggest daily Emergency throwlines have been installed at seven reservoirs across Greater Manchester in memory of young men who have lost their lives in water-related tragedies.
The scheme, launched by United Utilities was launched on Thursday in a bid to prevent reservoir and other water-related deaths.
It comes after Greater Manchester Fire and Rescue Service revealed that 17 people have drowned in Greater Manchester in the last three years.
The throwlines, which could buy valuable time for a swimmer in difficulty, have been installed at 20 locations around eight reservoirs in Manchester and Lancashire, dedicated to someone who lost their life.
Bereaved families and water safety campaigners reiterated a stark warning to anyone tempted by open-water swimming, but welcomed the initiative which they believe could save lives.
The throwlines will be accompanied by dedications from families who have lost love ones in reservoir and open-water related deaths.
The family and friends of Paul Lawson at Greenbooth Reservoir (Image: United Utilities) In June last year alone, three young men under the age of 25 lost their lives in reservoir's across the region.
They included 20-year-old Dwayne Thompson, who died after getting into trouble whilst swimming in Audenshaw Reservoir.
His mother later told an inquest that her son, who had autism, had died because he didn't understand signs warning people not to swim in the water.
A total of three emergency throwlines have now been installed at the reservoir, dedicated to Dwayne, in the hope that nobody else will lose their life.
Dwayne Thompson with his mum Amanda (Image: Manchester Evening News.) A further three throw lines were planted at Gorton Reservoir where the body of 18-year-old Mark Allen was discovered by police divers in the same month as Mr Thompson.
Mr Allen was understood to have been at a beauty spot with friends when he went into the water. It is unclear how he got into trouble.
The body of another young man was found at High Rid Reservoir in Bolton on the same day.
A further three throw lines have been put in place at the reservoir, with dedication still to be confirmed.
Read more of today's top stories Dylan Ramsey was just 13-years-old when he died after swimming with friends at Hill Top Quarry in Whittle-le-Woods, Lancashire.
Despite being a strong swimmer, Dylan got into difficulties. An inquest heard at the time there were no signs indicating the dangers of entering the water.
Emergency throw lines at Audenshaw Reservoir and Fishmoor Reservoir in Blackburn, Lancashire have been dedicated to the teenager.
Beckie Ramsay with a picture of her son Dylan, who drowned in an old water-filled quarry (Image: MEN Media) Dylan's mother, Beckie Ramsay has been raising awareness of the dangers of open water swimming through her campain "Doing it for Dylan" following the death of her son.
Speaking at the unveiling ceremony at Greenbooth Reservoir in Rochdale , she said: "When I lost Dylan everything changed, and I made the decision to spend the rest of my life doing whatever I can to help prevent another mum going through what I have.
"Dylan was a strong swimmer and he became a victim because he didn't know the dangers of swimming in open water.
"I hope when people see the throw lines and the dedications written by bereaved families it will make them think twice.
"If it stops just one youngster taking that chance it will be a success."
Bereaved families attended the event at Greenbooth Reservoir near Rochdale. United Utilities has installed new throwlines dedicated to the families’ loved ones who have drowned in open water in Greater Manchester and Lancashire (Image: United Utilities) The body of Steven Dyson, a 'fun loving' 22-year-old was discovered in water in the Summerseat area of Ramsbottom in January 2018 following a six-day search.
The youngster was reported missing after he failed to return home following a New Year's Eve party.
An inquest into Mr Dyson's death revealed he had been punched in the face during an altercation prior to his death.
Coroner Joanne Kearsley said it was impossible to say for sure how Steven ended up in the water.
Two throw lines have been installed at Jumbles Reservoir in Bolton , dedicated to Steven's memory.
Steven Dyson (Image: MEN Media) Three throw lines were installed at Hollingworth Lake in Rochdale and two at Greenbooth Reservoir in Rochdale where 16-year-old Paul Lawson tragically drowned in June 2017.
Area Manager Paul Etches from Greater Manchester Fire and Rescue Service said: "We are really pleased to be working on this safety campaign with partners to help raise awareness of the throwline boards which have recently been installed at seven locations across Greater Manchester where people have lost their lives.
"Our firefighters are trained in water rescue but sometimes it just isn't possible to get to the people in time to save them.
Paul Lawson, 16, of Wardle, Rochdale, who drowned while swimming in Greenbooth Reservoir in Rochdale (Image: MEN MEDIA) "We have sadly seen 17 people drown in Greater Manchester in the last three years alone, with many others suffering injuries.
"As the warm weather approaches we want to remind people about the dangers that come with swimming in reservoirs and other open water.
"The throwlines can buy valuable time and help people keep their head above the water until firefighters arrive to help, however, we urge people to stay out of the water - it can be very deep and cold enough to cause shock and even the strongest swimmers can find themselves in difficulties."
If the throwline pilot scheme is a success United Utilities will consider rolling it out to other reservoir sites around the North West.

thread.title: Manchester United might already have David de Gea's replacement - Samuel Luckhurst
thread.title_full: Manchester United might already have David de Gea's replacement - Samuel Luckhurst - Manchester Evening News

posts.author: Samuel Luckhurst
posts.title: Manchester United might already have David de Gea's replacement - Samuel Luckhurst
posts.text:
Share Comments By Samuel Luckhurst 06:00, 5 APR 2019 Sport opinion Henderson has been excellent for Sheffield United this season Get the biggest Manchester United FC There is a certain irony in Manchester United priding itself on its academy whilst targeting young homegrown players. James Garner has signed two new contracts over the past year, while Angel Gomes and Mason Greenwood signed their first professional deals in 2018. The focus has shifted onto Declan Rice, Callum Hudson-Odoi and Jadon Sancho, though.
United will almost certainly not sign all three in the summer but their interest is concrete. Sancho is the perfect profile of signing for United in that he fits their new age range, is British and would occupy a problem position. There is also the braggart buy sub-plot in that Sancho was once on City's books.
Rice, 20, is a logical option and Hudson-Odoi, 18, more opportunistic as he enters the final year of his Chelsea contract. It must be dispiriting for Tahith Chong, last seen playing that near-fatal crossfield pass across the Parc des Princes pitch in added time, who is also older than Sancho. Now the senior squad is fuller and fitter, Garner, Gomes, Greenwood and Chong could all figure for the Under-23s against West Brom at Old Trafford on Friday night.
Wolves vs Manchester United reaction Ratings: Manchester United player ratings: Three players get 2/10 Opinion: Manchester United's tactical risk backfires vs Wolves Solskjaer: Why Ashley Young played in a back three for Manchester United vs Wolves News: Why Luke Shaw will miss next two Man Utd Premier League fixtures News: Solskjaer reveals Manchester United Premier League top four points target Highlights: Wolves vs Manchester United highlights The quartet have at least appeared for the first-team. Greenwood became the 231st academy graduate to make that breakthrough whereas Dean Henderson is still waiting. The last time the 22-year-old ran out at Old Trafford it was in the 2015 FA Youth Cup and Axel Tuanzebe, Cameron Borthwick-Jackson and Marcus Rashford were among his teammates. Yet United might have a £20million on-loan asset.
United are working to address the stagnation their Under-23 players succumb to but Henderson has bucked the trend at loan level. He has worked his way up the ladder from non-league (Stockport) to the Championship with Sheffield United, via Grimsby in League Two and Shrewsbury in League One.
Read More Why United could break City's transfer record in summer window 'Thank you Deano' read one message from a Shrew at the Play-off final defeat at Wembley in May. Henderson saved a spotkick in Shrewsbury's defeat by Rotherham and was selected in the League One Team of the Year. United belatedly finalised a new contract that Henderson only signed on the proviso he head out on loan again. He could end this campaign as the Championship's standout 'keeper.
At Leeds last month, Henderson was subjected to what the Press Association's Simon Peach, sat in the press box, described as the 'most relentless stick I have ever heard a player get'. That was a mere week after Henderson copped plenty of Yorkshire verbals in the Sheffield Steel derby at Hillsborough. Henderson was regularly referred to as 'scum' (reserved for United-related players) at Leeds but ended the encounter by cupping his ear. 'Deano, Deano' echoed around Elland Road.
Read More How United could line up with transfer targets next season The Blades dropped back down to third at the weekend but are just two points behind Leeds for the second automatic promotion spot. Henderson started England Under-21s' European Championship warm-up with Germany at Bournemouth last week and is in competition with Angus Gunn to start at the finals in Italy and San Marino in June. Gareth Southgate name checked Henderson amid a possible senior call-up later this year.
Regardless of whether Sheffield United go up, stay down in the second tier, or if Henderson is Gunn's deputy for the U21s, his re-sale value in the summer will be higher than the fee they obtained for Sam Johnstone. United banked £6.5m rising to £10m from West Brom after Johnstone was denied promotion with Aston Villa. Johnstone only ever made the bench at United and, curiously for a player who told confidants he was 'desperate' to leave, had no qualms about agreeing a new contract after eight loans at the age of 23.
Read More United stance on David de Gea contract situation revealed Johnstone, already 26, is potential Premier League standard, but his peripatetic time at United is a reminder of the near-impossible task their academy goalkeepers face. The last to hit double-figures for appearances was Gary Walsh in 1994-95. Mark Bosnich did so in 1999-00, but was re-signed. The only post-war United academy number one was Jack Crompton, a relative late bloomer at 24 in 1946.
Substitutes were only allowed in the English league in 1965-66 and since David Gaskell supported Alex Stepney, the academy goalie has been synonymous with back-up, whether it be Walsh, Kevin Pilkington, Nick Culkin, Paul Rachubka, Ben Amos, Johnstone or Joel Pereira. Henderson occupied that role for two substitute appearances in the FA Cup against Shrewsbury in 2016 and Blackburn in 2017. Only his mentality is strikingly different.
Read More United targeting three signings in transfer window but there could be more "I wouldn't have signed a new deal if I wasn't going straight out on loan," Henderson said in June. "So I made sure that was part of it. Because I need to keep improving my development to go to the next level.
"I don't agree with sitting in your comfort zone, if you're good enough go and prove it, don't sit there and say you're good, just go out and show you're good."
Henderson has had an excellent season with Sheffield United United are still struggling to tie down David de Gea on a new long-term deal with less than 15 months to run on his contract. Talks started 18 months ago when United were second to City only on goal difference. De Gea wants to win the Champions League and wants reassurances it is possible at United, who are prepared to risk allowing him to negotiate with overseas clubs next January.
Negotiations could extend beyond the summer window and United will not be short of external candidates to replace De Gea. Jan Oblak's representatives would welcome a big move away from Atletico Madrid but United have the option to look to within. Henderson is destined for Premier League football next season, with or without Sheffield United, and that could be the final step on the ladder to emulating Crompton.
United have their own homegrown target.
Read More Why Paul Pogba should ignore Real Madrid Read More United told how much Wan-Bissaka and Zaha could cost

thread.title: Man Utd interest in Premier League ace is real... but Woodward strategy is WRONG - Castles
thread.title_full: Man Utd interest in Premier League ace is real... but Woodward strategy is WRONG - Castles

posts.title: Man Utd interest in Premier League ace is real... but Woodward strategy is WRONG - Castles
posts.text:
Manchester United have a 'real' interest in Crystal Palace star Aaron Wan-Bissaka, says Castles (Pic: GETTY) But Castles has slammed Ed Woodward for targeting young players over experienced leaders (Pic: GETTY)
Wan-Bissaka joined Palace at the age of 11 and started off as a winger in their youth setup.
He broke into the first team under the unsuccessful Frank de Boer, who moved the youngster to wing-back and highlighted his defensive quality.
Now the Croydon man is a key member of Hodgson’s backline; but unfortunately for Eagles fans, Castles doesn’t think he will stick around for long.
“It’s obvious why he’s being linked with moves to big clubs, it’s ‘cos he’s young, he’s English, he’s very good,” he said. Wan-Bissaka is likely to leave Palace this summer, according to Castles (Pic: GETTY)
“He’s not gonna spend his career at Crystal Palace if he carries on playing the way he does and I think there’s a very good chance that he’ll move this summer.
“People around him are pushing for that. I think if he doesn’t move you’ll probably see another improved contract at Crystal Palace.
“But he’s English, which is obviously of great appeal to Premier League clubs because he ticks the homegrown player box, he’s quick, good going forward, he’s able to tackle, he’s a very focused defender.
“I think he impressed immediately as he got into the Crystal Palace team. He came in because they had injuries and had to throw him in probably earlier than people expected him to play, but he looked the part straightaway and when you see that in a young player, it’s always a good sign.” Related articles

thread.title: „Times“-Bericht | 6 Profis auf ManUtd-Streichliste - Solskjaer will englischen Kern um Sancho, Rice & Co.
thread.title_full: „Times“-Bericht | 6 Profis auf ManUtd-Streichliste - Solskjaer will englischen Kern um Sancho, Rice & Co.

posts.author: Transfermarkt
posts.title: „Times“-Bericht | 6 Profis auf ManUtd-Streichliste - Solskjaer will englischen Kern um Sancho, Rice & Co.
posts.text:
05.04.2019 - 06:42 | Quelle: Times/Transfermarkt.co.uk | Lesedauer: unter 2 Min. „Times“-Bericht 6 Profis auf ManUtd-Streichliste - Solskjaer will englischen Kern um Sancho, Rice & Co.
Bei Manchester United steht laut einem Bericht der „ Times “ der erste große Kader-Umbruch seit 2015 an – damals durchgeführt von Louis van Gaal . Chefcoach Ole Gunnar Solskjaer soll dafür eine Streichliste haben, auf der bis zu sechs Spieler stehen. Allesamt Legionäre, die 29 oder älter sind. Bei den Neuzugängen soll sich der Fokus derweil auf junge Engländer richten. Mitarbeiter 2 2
„Ole ist am Steuer“, verkündete der Rekordmeister zuletzt bei der Verlängerung mit seinem Trainer. Die Verteidiger Marcos Rojo (29) und Matteo Darmian (29) sollen verkauft werden, der Vertrag von Antonio Valencia (33) nicht verlängert. Mit den Spaniern Juan Mata (30) und Ander Herrera (29) wird seit 18 Monaten ohne Erfolg verhandelt – Stand jetzt verlassen die Mittelfeldspieler ManUnited im Sommer ablösefrei ( alle auslaufenden Verträge ). Herrera etwa soll sich mit PSG auf einen Wechsel geeinigt haben. Marktwert Linksaußen
Ob auch Transferflop Alexis Sánchez (30) gehen muss, habe Solskjaer noch nicht entschieden. Zudem wird es nicht leicht werden, einen Abnehmer für den bestbezahlten Profi der Premier League zu finden, der in dieser Saison erst ein Tor erzielen konnte.
Coutinho & Co. Gerüchte um ManUtd-Zugänge Zur Übersicht Während sich die Trennung von diesem Sextett eher im Gehaltsgefüge als in der Transferbilanz bemerkbar machen würde, dürften Solskjaers vermeintliche Wunschspieler den Klub hunderte Millionen Euro kosten. Die „Times“ nennt mit Jadon Sancho (19, BVB), Callum Hudson-Odoi (18, Chelsea), Aaron Wan-Bissaka (21, Crystal Palace) und Declan Rice (20, West Ham) vier einheimische Talente als große Transferziele. Mit diesem „englischen Kern“ wolle man die Lücke zu Manchester City und dem FC Liverpool schließen. Wie zu den großen Zeiten unter Sir Alex Ferguson, die auch Solskjaer als Spieler miterlebte, wolle man wieder vermehrt auf Engländer setzen. Marktwert Rechtsaußen
Allein für dieses Quartett dürfte eine Ablöse jenseits der 250-Millionen-Marke fällig werden. Ähnlich kostspielig wären auch die Verpflichtungen der beiden weiteren von der „Times“ gelisteten Profis: Raphaël Varane (25, Real Madrid) und Saúl Ñíguez (24) – beiden wird ein Wechselwunsch nachgesagt. Der reichste Klub der Welt könnte eine Einkaufstour dieser Größenordnung stemmen, wenn er sich nicht wieder zahlreiche Absagen seiner Wunschspieler einholt. Dies war zuletzt der Fall unter José Mourinho , der es sich zum Saisonbeginn nicht nehmen ließ, regelmäßig über diesen Umstand zu klagen. Marktwert Zitat von face_the_truth der unterschied zu mbappe ist, als er wechselte spielte er bei monaco schon davor tolle leistungen und steigerte sich in seinem letzten jahr auf weltklasse und das über mehr als 1 jahr. bei sancho ist es sein erstes jahr weswegen ich skeptisch bin mit der ablöse um sie so hoch wie bei mbappe anzusetzen. sollte er nächste jahr die leistungen halten oder sogar steigern, dann ist er definitiv für unter 150mio nicht zu haben 1. Es ist völlig egal, ob Sancho besser / schlechter / gleich gut wie Mbappé ist. Wir (der BVB) haben einen Vertrag mit dem Spieler. Einen sehr langen Vertrag. Ihr (Man Utd) könnt das, was wir fordern entweder bezahlen oder ihr sucht euch andere Spieler. So einfach ist das. Das mag arrogant klingen. Ist aber kurz gefasst das wichtigste Argument. Dem BVB ist auchvöllig egal, ob der Käufer mit dem Preis glücklich ist oder nicht. 2. Aber der BVB will gar nicht verkaufen. Also warum sollten wir plötzlich damit anfangen, wie gut er im vergleich zu Mbappé ist oder zu Neymar (bei ihm war es auch nicht der Wert sondern eine AK, denn Barcelona hätte ihn auch nicht für 222 Mio verkauft). Das wäre Verhalten, das man an den Tag legt, wenn man verkaufen will. 3. Der BVB wurde in den letzten Jahren nur so mit Geld zugesch*ssen. Der BVB weiß gar nicht mehr wohin mit der ganzen Kohle. Wir haben 14 Punkte Vorsprung auf Gladbach, sind also quasi schon für die CL 19/20 qualifiziert. Da gibt es noch mehr Geld. Wir belegen gerade Platz 1. Das zahlt sich dann auch in der TV-Verteilung der Bundesliga aus. Seit der Saison 15/16 hat der BVB ein Transferplus von über 180 Mio erzielt. Wenn der BVB etwas nicht braucht, dann ist es Geld. Wenn der BVB tatsächlich etwas braucht, dann sind es gute Spieler. Selbst wenn Man Utd 150 Mio bietet... was soll der BVB damit machen? Ein 2. Stadion bauen? 4. Mbappé war neben Dembelé DAS französische Talent. Und Sancho ist DAS englische Talent. Während es in Frankreich nur Paris gibt, die den Geldbeutel dafür so weit aufmachen, gibt es in England Man City, Man Utd, Liverpool, Tottenham, Arsenal, Chelsea (reicht 2020, wenn die Sperre vorbei ist, dann ist deren Geldbeutel auch wieder schön voll). Ansonsten ist das aber völlig egal, da Punkt 1 gilt. Bei Neymar: Er ist dank einer AK gewechselt. Und am Ende interessiert es den BVB nicht, wer für wen welches Geld bezahlt hat. 5. Man verkauft keine Spieler, die man behalten will zum fairen Marktpreis, sondern immer zur Schmerzgrenze. Umgekehrt verkauft man Spieler, die man loshaben möchte auch mal gerne unter dem eigentlichen Wert. Nur damit sie weg sind. Wenn Sancho nun einen fairen Wert von 80-100 Mio hat. Warum sollte sich der BVB dann mit 100-120 Mio zufrieden geben? 6. Die Punkte 1, 4 und 5 führen dazu, dass der BVB wohl ein sehr guter Verkäufer ist. Mal ehrlich: Dembelé war keine 150 Mio wert, die bekommen wir aber. Pulisic war auch keine 64 Mio wert bei 1 Jahr Restlaufzeit. Aubameyangs 64 Mio waren wohl noch am nächsten am realen Wert. Aber auch hier hat der BVB schon sehr viel rausgeholt. Man kann daraus 2 Dinge ableiten: 1) es besteht tatsächlich die Möglichkeit, Spieler beim BVB loszueisen. 2) Wenn das passiert, dann jedoch zu Mondpreisen. Wer nicht das nötige Kleingeld hat, muss sich in Frankreich nach Talenten umsehen challenge accepted! wenn es einen verein gibt der das nötige kleingeld hat, dann manchester united. denke mal vor allem weil er engländer ist würden wir hier mehr investieren als bei jedem anderen talent. kommt ja auch bei den fans gut an wenn man sieht, was man alles tut um englische spieler/talente zu bekommen. also mal schauen was im sommer passiert Zitat von face_the_truth rice wäre ein mega deal für die zukunft, wird aber sicher nicht billig weggehen wie du schon sagst. denke mal, dass man da auf die selbe summe wie bei einem bruno fernandes kommen würde sollte man den auch holen. Da du die Ablöse für Bruno Fernandes - den deiner Aussage? nach derzeit torgefährlichsten OFM Europas - auf 40-50 Mio. bezifferst, was ich dann doch eher mau finde, glaube ich, liegst du bei Rice ziemlich daneben. Ich bin mir nicht sicher ob Rice nur noch 1 Jahr Vertrag hat, das könnte ManU dann in die Karten spielen. Aber sollte er seinen Vertrag zwischenzeitlich verlängert haben, dann rechne ich bei einem Wechsel eher mit 80 Mio. Ablöse. Declan Rice hat erst kürzlich bis 2024 verlängert Der wird also auch teurer als 40-50 Millionen. West Ham wird wohl im Mittelfeld landen und hat dementsprechend gar keinen Druck ihn zu verkaufen. Außerdem ist er Engländer. weiß nicht, ob das so einen enormen unterschied ausmachen wird. west ham ist auch nicht finanzkraft schlecht hin, da wurd die letzten jahre auch enorm ausgegeben und es braucht einnahmen. vorstellbar für mich, dass man sich auf 50-60mio einigt und noch einige boni dabei sein werden West Ham will investieren, um nach oben zu kommen, da wird man so ein junges Talent, mit Rücksicht auf den Markt, bei gutem Management, nicht unter 70 - 80 Millionen ziehen lassen. wie gesagt würden bei 50-60mio noch einiges an boni dazukommen wodurch die summe zum schluss eh in dem bereich fallen würden. bei 70-80mio fixsumme kann man nicht mehr wirklich viele boni erwarten. das ist dann schon die max. summe für rice. ansonsten könnte man sich auch gleich einen rodrigo holen. oben mitspielen wollen die hammers schon seit nem jahrzehnt, aber investiert wird teilweise echt bescheuert. was mir als fan weh tut, ist es doch die erste adresse für mich nach united die ich unterstütze. man hat zahlreiche talente und dann werden sie wie quina nach watford abgegeben oder ein oxford zb kaum gefördert sondern nur verliehen. rice ist der einzige, der es geschafft hat, was jedoch kein grund zum feiern ist, da west ham united als die talentschmiede englands gilt und das nicht erst seit gestern. da setzt man leider nicht mehr ganz auf die eigene jugend, sondern holt zb ausrangierte stars wie zabaleta oder ü30er wie sanchez aus florenz. andere vereine würden sich die finger lecken für die jugend- und scoutingabteilungen der hammers und dann haut man lieber eine saison nach der andern geld aus dem fenster. bei den big six ist das irgendwie zu erwarten, weil da der druck auf erfolg höher ist, aber bei west ham kann man schon 1-2 saisons übergang riskieren wo man im mittelfeld ist, aber dafür hat man dann einen kader mit einigen talenten, die dann voll einschlagen würden. ...und dann hat es mit Rice mal ein Talent geschafft und WHU soll es für verhältnismäßig "Peanuts" hergeben? Boni sind immer so eine Sache... woran sollte man die bei einem Wechsel zu ManU knüpfen? Boni-Zahlung, wenn ManU Meister wird oder in die CL einzieht? ...würde ich mich aus WHU-Sicht nicht drauf einlassen, da die Top-6 halt dicht beieinander sind, wie man jetzt auch bei dem Kampf um Platz 3-4 sehen kann. Ich meine auch gelesen zu haben, dass man seitens WHU nicht bereit sei, Rice für unter 100 Mio. gehen zu lassen. Die werden bei einem Wechsel vermutlich nicht gezahlt werden aber daher tendiere ich halt in Richtung 70-80 Mio. ohne Boni. Ich könnte mir übrigens auch Harry Maguire bei ManU gut vorstellen, denn in der IV hat man mMn definitiv Handlungsbedarf. Zudem ein weiterer Engländer. Würde aber sicher auch sehr teuer werden. Eigentlich hat sich Leicester ja letzten Sommer mit Söyücü gerüstet um für den Abgang von Maguire vorbereitet zu sein. Stand jetzt kann ich mir ihn als Maguire-Ersatz aber leider gar nicht vorstellen.... daher mal schauen, ob Leicester bei Maguire verhandlungsbereit ist, falls ManU Interesse signalisiert. das wären dann meiner meinung nach zum großteil boni die leicht zu schaffen sind. als beispiel: 50-60mio fixsumme, 10mio für eine bestimmte anzahl an einsätzen (egal ob in einer oder 3 saisons erreicht), 5mio sollte er es ins englische nationalteam schaffen und bestimmte einsatzzahl dort (da gibts ja noch die diskussion ob er für england oder irland spielt), und dann noch kleinere punkte wie zb eine ohne gegentorklausel wenn er von beginn an spielt und meinetwegen auch ne weiterverkaufsbeteiligung von 10-15%. dann kommt man locker auf die 70-80mio oder vielleicht noch mehr. nur eben nicht als fixsumme bei der verpflichtung. in der IV muss ein erfahrener mann auf weltklasse niveau her. maguire ist gut, aber kein führungsspieler den es bei uns hinten dringend braucht. für mich sind da koulibaly oder skriniar die besseren kandidaten. sogar de ligt (spielte ja auch oft als kapitän bei ajax) würd ich da noch einordnen. Zitat von face_the_truth der unterschied zu mbappe ist, als er wechselte spielte er bei monaco schon davor tolle leistungen und steigerte sich in seinem letzten jahr auf weltklasse und das über mehr als 1 jahr. bei sancho ist es sein erstes jahr weswegen ich skeptisch bin mit der ablöse um sie so hoch wie bei mbappe anzusetzen. sollte er nächste jahr die leistungen halten oder sogar steigern, dann ist er definitiv für unter 150mio nicht zu haben 1. Dem BVB ist auchvöllig egal, ob der Käufer mit dem Preis glücklich ist oder nicht. 2. Aber der BVB will gar nicht verkaufen. Also warum sollten wir plötzlich damit anfangen, wie gut er im vergleich zu Mbappé ist oder zu Neymar (bei ihm war es auch nicht der Wert sondern eine AK, denn Barcelona hätte ihn auch nicht für 222 Mio verkauft). Das wäre Verhalten, das man an den Tag legt, wenn man verkaufen will. 3. Der BVB wurde in den letzten Jahren nur so mit Geld zugesch*ssen. Der BVB weiß gar nicht mehr wohin mit der ganzen Kohle. Wir haben 14 Punkte Vorsprung auf Gladbach, sind also quasi schon für die CL 19/20 qualifiziert. Da gibt es noch mehr Geld. Wir belegen gerade Platz 1. Das zahlt sich dann auch in der TV-Verteilung der Bundesliga aus. Seit der Saison 15/16 hat der BVB ein Transferplus von über 180 Mio erzielt. Wenn der BVB etwas nicht braucht, dann ist es Geld. Wenn der BVB tatsächlich etwas braucht, dann sind es gute Spieler. Selbst wenn Man Utd 150 Mio bietet... was soll der BVB damit machen? Ein 2. Stadion bauen? 4. Bola.net - Gelandang Manchester United, Andreas Pereira mengaku sangat antusias jelang perjumpaan dengan Barcelona. Andreas Pereira sangat yakin timnya akan menunjukkan karakter terbaik melawan Barcelona.
Manchester United berjumpa Barcelona pada babak perempat final Liga Champions. Laga leg pertama digelar pada Kamis (11/4) mendatang dan leg kedua dihelat di Old Trafford pada 17 April 2019.
Laga di Camp Nou tentu bakal menjadi tantangan tersendiri bagi Manchester United. Sebab, dalam empat laga terakhir, Setan Merah sedang berada dalam performa buruk. Manchester United tiga kali menelan kekalahan.
Seperti apa kesiapan Andreas Pereira jelang lawatan ke Camp Nou? Simak selengkapnya di bawah ini. Berita Terkait

posts.author: editor@bola.net (Editor)
posts.title: Kalah dari Wolves, MU Diyakini Masih Bisa Finis Empat Besar
posts.text:
HOME » LIGA INGGRIS » KALAH DARI WOLVES, MU DIYAKINI MASIH BISA FINIS EMPAT BESAR Kalah dari Wolves, MU Diyakini Masih Bisa Finis Empat Besar 05-04-2019 11:21 Ole Gunnar Solskjaer © MUFC Official
Bola.net - Langkah Manchester United untuk menembus posisi empat besar sedikit tersendat setelah menelan kekalahan dari Wolverhampton Wanderers. Meskipun begitu, Owen Hargreaves masih yakin kalau Setan Merah bisa finis di sana pada akhir musim nanti.
Setan Merah menelan kekalahan 1-2 dari Wolves saat berkunjung ke Molineux Stadium, Rabu (3/4/2019) dinihari WIB. Kekalahan itu tentu saja menghambat harapan mereka untuk bisa finis di zona Liga Champions.
Hasil itu membuat MU harus turun ke peringkat keenam dengan 61 poin. Mereka saat ini tertinggal dua angka dari Arsenal di posisi keempat dan Chelsea di posisi kelima.
Arsenal sendiri sekarang sedang berada dalam kondisi yang bagus dalam beberapa pekan terakhir. Kemenangan 2-0 atas Newcastle United memberi mereka dorongan besar dalam persaingan di posisi empat besar. Berita Terkait

thread.title: Manchester United squad predicted for 2019/20
thread.title_full: Manchester United squad predicted for 2019/20 - Manchester Evening News

posts.author: Nathan Bliss
posts.title: Manchester United squad predicted for 2019/20
posts.text:
Share Comments By Nathan Bliss 05:00, 5 APR 2019 Sport Get the biggest Manchester United FC stories by email Subscribe See our privacy notice More newsletters Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email With Manchester United finally confirming the appointment of Ole Gunnar Solskjaer as their permanent manager, the next thing on the agenda could be a squad overall.
United are planning to have a busy transfer window this summer, with a number of players set to leave and a new bunch of talented players set to arrive.
But how much will they spend? Will Solskjaer get who he wants?
Here is how the United squad could look in the 2019/20 season.
Manchester United's squad in 2019/20 To find out what United's squad could look like, we used popular football management simulation game Football Manager 2019 to predict the future.
We went into the Football Manager 2019 editor, confirmed Solskjaer as the permanent manager and then skipped ahead to the 2019/20 season to see how the squad looks.
(Image: Sports Interactive/Football Manager 2019) There was a major overhaul ahead of the 2019/20 season, with Solskjaer sanctioning a number of high-profile signings and departures.
(Image: Sports Interactive/Football Manager 2019) Transfers in:
Mauro Icardi (Inter Milan) - £99 million
Samuel Umtiti (Barcelona) - £80 million
Federico Chiesa (Fiorentina) - £52 million rising to £63 million
Nacho Fernandez (Real Madrid) - £43 million rising to £48 million
Iago Aspas (Celta Vigo) - £36 million
Moussa Diaby (PSG) - £1.2 million rising to £3.4 million
Adrien Rabiot (PSG) - Free Transfer
Transfers out:
Andreas Pereira (Bayer Leverkusen) - £32.5 million
Romelu Lukaku (Shakhtar Donetsk) - £23 million
Chris Smalling (Monaco) - £19 million
Marcos Rojo (CSKA Moscow) - £7.25 million rising to £10 million
Matteo Darmian (Burnley) - £5.5 million rising to £7.75 million
Ashley Young (Feyenoord) - £4.4 million rising to £5.5 million
Demetri Mitchell (Bristol City) - £1.4 million
Juan Mata (Inter Milan) - Free Transfer
Ander Herrera (Sevilla) - Loan
Diego Dalot (Newcastle) - Loan
Read More ESports Stories Sancho v Bale for United Five world class defenders RATED Compared: Saul vs Fernandinho Man United FIFA update What Manchester United's first XI looks like in 2019/20 With all the transfers completed, this is how the United starting XI looked ahead of the first game of the 2019/20 season.
(Image: Sports Interactive/Football Manager 2019) It's definitely a lot different to what we've seen in recent years, with a number of world-class players in a variety in positions.
The defence has been heavily strengthened, with Real Madrid defender Nacho playing at left-back and Barcelona central defender Samuel Umtiti marshaling the defence alongside Victor Lindelof. And, obviously, David De Gea remains in goal.
In midfield, Adrien Rabiot adds technical quality to a midfield of himself, Paul Pogba and Nemanja Matic, with the two Frenchman free to go and create further up the pitch with Matic offering the protection.
In attack, Marcus Rashford remains first choice, although he's deployed in a left wing position to make room for the arrival of Argentinian striker Mauro Icardi, who adds clinical finishing and a predatory instinct in front of goal.
On the opposite flank, exciting Fiorentina winger Federico Cheisa starts, adding an extra bit of quality.
On the bench, Solskjaer can choose from the likes of Iago Aspas, Anthony Martial, Jesse Lingard, Alexis Sanchez, Fred, Luke Shaw and Phil Jones.
That's a lot of depth.
Would you be happy with this line-up for the 2019/20 season?
And, would you be happy with these transfers? Both in and out?

HOME » LIGA INGGRIS » UNTUK KEMBALI KE LIGA CHAMPIONS, ARSENAL DISARANKAN PERCAYA PADA OZIL Untuk Kembali ke Liga Champions, Arsenal Disarankan Percaya pada Ozil 05-04-2019 11:00 | Mesut Ozil Mesut Ozil © AFP
Bola.net - Mantan striker Arsenal, Luka Podolski menyarankan Unai Emery untuk terus memainkan Mesut Ozil demi memenuhi target mereka menembus empat besar klasemen akhir dan bermain di Liga Champions lagi musim depan. Podolski percaya Ozil adalah pemain yang bisa diandalkan.
Arsenal saat ini bersaing ketat dengan tiga tim lainnya demi mengamankan peringkat empat besar. Ada Tottenham Hotspur, Chelsea, juga Manchester United yang juga memiliki peluang sama. Empoat tim merebutkan dua tempat sisa.
Sebab itu, Arsenal harus menurunkan skuat terbaik merka di sisa laga musim ini. Inilah alasan Podolski mendorong Emery untuk terus memercayai Ozil. Dia percaya Ozil bisa jadi penentu kemenangan Arsenal.

posts.title: Rentan Cedera, MU Tak Disarankan Gaet Raphael Varane
posts.text:
HOME » LIGA INGGRIS » RENTAN CEDERA, MU TAK DISARANKAN GAET RAPHAEL VARANE Rentan Cedera, MU Tak Disarankan Gaet Raphael Varane 05-04-2019 11:00 Raphael Varane © RMFC
Bola.net - Bek Real Madrid Raphael Varane dikabarkan menjadi target utama Manchester United pada musim panas mendatang. Namun, mantan pemain Liverpool Steve Nicol melarang Setan Merah untuk membeli Varane.
Varane dalam beberapa pekan terakhir dirumorkan akan hengkang dari Real Madrid. Ia kabarnya ingin mencari tantangan baru dalam karirnya setelah memenangkan banyak gelar bergengsi di Santiago Bernabeu.
Niatan Varane untuk pergi ini sudah sampai ke telinga klub-klub papan atas Eropa. Untuk itu beberapa di antara mereka sudah mulai menanyakan harga jual Varane ke Real Madrid.
Salah satu tim yang kabarnya serius memburu Raphael Varane di musim panas adalah Manchester United. Menurut laporan, Setan Merah mengincar Varane guna memperkuat lini belakang mereka yang rapuh. Berita Terkait

HOME » LIGA INGGRIS » TERMASUK HUDSON-ODOI, INI EMPAT PEMAIN BIDIKAN SOLKSJAER Termasuk Hudson-Odoi, Ini Empat Pemain Bidikan Solksjaer 05-04-2019 10:41 Callum Hudson-Odoi. © AP
Bola.net - Ole Gunnars Solksjaer diyakini bakal mendatangkan sejumlah amunisi baru untuk memperkuat Manchester United pada musim depan. Sejauh ini, ada empat pemain yang disebut bakal jadi incaran manajer berusia 45 tahun.
Solksjaer secara umum telah memberikan hasil yang bagus untuk Manchester United sejak ditunjuk sebagai manajer pada Desember 2018 lalu. Namun, dalam empat laga terakhir, performa Setan Merah mulai menunjukkan penurunan.
Manchester United menelan tiga kali kekalahan dalam empat laga terakhir di semua kompetisi. Tentu saja ini menjadi signal negatif bagi klub yang bermarkas di Old Trafford. Sejumlah perubahan pun disiapkan oleh Solksjaer.
Siapa saja pemain yang masuk dalam bidikan Solksjaer? Simak ulasan selengkapnya di bawah ini ya Bolaneters. Berita Terkait

Bola.net - Rencana Manchester United untuk membeli bek tengah Samuel Umtiti dari Barcelona bakal berantakan. Sebab, pihak pemain disebut tidak berniat untuk melakukan negosiasi transfer dengan Setan Merah.
Manchester United kini sudah punya lima pemain yang berposisi bek tengah yakni Victor Lindelof, Phil Jones, Chris Smalling, Marcos Rojo dan Eric Bailly. Namun, tidak satu pun di antara mereka mampu tampil konsisten.
Eric Bailly dan Marcos Rojo bahkan kini lebih sering berada di ruang perawatan dibanding bermain untuk Manchester United. Kondisi inilah yang membuat manajer Ole Gunnar Solksjaer membidik pemain baru.
Lantas, apa alasan Samuel Umtiti memilih menolak Manchester United? Simak ulasan lengkapnya di bawah ini ya Bolaneters. Berita Terkait

HOME » LIGA INGGRIS » PSG TAWARKAN GAJI RP 7,4 MILIAR SEPEKAN PADA DAVID DE GEA PSG Tawarkan Gaji Rp 7,4 Miliar Sepekan pada David De Gea 05-04-2019 09:54 David De Gea © AFP
Bola.net - Manchester United harus segera membuat sikap terkait masa depan penjaga gawang David De Gea. Sebab, PSG dikabarkan sudah siap menawarkan gaji dalam jumlah yang sangat besar kepada penjaga gawang asal Spanyol itu.
Kontrak David De Gea bersama Manchester United kini memasuki fase yang krusial. Pada 30 Juni 2019 mendatang, kerja sama Manchester United dengan David De Gea akan selesai. Sesuai aturan, David De Gea pun bisa melakukan negosiasi dengan klub lain.
Situasi tersebut tentu saja tidak cukup menguntungkan bagi Manchester United yang ingin memberikan kontrak baru. Apalagi, sejumlah klub telah menyiapkan tawaran yang menggiurkan pada penjaga gawang berusia 28 tahun tersebut.
Berapa gaji yang ditawarkan oleh PSG pada David De Gea? Simak selengkapnya di bawah ini. Berita Terkait

thread.title: Barca Bisa Terpuruk Setelah Messi Pensiun? Presiden Klub: Tentu Saja

posts.author: editor@bola.net (Editor)
posts.title: Barca Bisa Terpuruk Setelah Messi Pensiun? Presiden Klub: Tentu Saja
posts.text:
HOME » LIGA SPANYOL » BARCA BISA TERPURUK SETELAH MESSI PENSIUN? PRESIDEN KLUB: TENTU SAJA Barca Bisa Terpuruk Setelah Messi Pensiun? Presiden Klub: Tentu Saja 05-04-2019 09:40 | Lionel Messi Lionel Messi © AFP
Bola.net - Presiden Barcelona, Josep Maria Bartomeu mengakui bahwa klubnya bisa jadi kerepotan pasca Lionel Messi memutuskan gantung sepatu beberapa tahun ke depan. Messi adalah bagian besar dari Barcelona itu sendiri, jadi kehilangan pemain seperti Messi tentu bakal jadi pukulan berat.
Sudah banyak contoh klub-klub besar yang terpuruk pasca kehilangan sosok terpenting mereka, entah itu pelatih atau pemain. Manchester United mengalaminya ketika Sir Alex Ferguson pensiun - bahkan sampai saat ini MU masih belum bangkit sepenuhnya.
Rival Barca, Real Madrid juga menjalani musim terburuknya di 2018/19 ini pasca kepergian Cristiano Ronaldo dan Zinedine Zidane, meski akhirnya Zidane kembali jelang akhir musim ini. Artinya, klub besar pun masih begitu bergantung pada pemain andalan mereka.
Bartomeu menyadari itu, dia juga mengakui Barca bergantung pada Messi. Pun demikian, dia yakin Barca sudah berasa sebaik mungkin untuk menghindari keterpurukan tersebut. Baca komentar selengkapnya di bawah ini ya, Bolaneters! Berita Terkait

Bola.net - Manchester United bakal berada dalam situasi yang pelik terkait masa depan Paul Pogba. Sebab, pemain berusia 26 tahun tersebut dikabarkan telah membuat pengajuan kenaikan gaji dalam jumlah yang besar.
Sejak akhir Maret lalu, masa depan Paul Pogba bersama Manchester United memang diragukan. Pangkal masalahnya, Paul Pogba sempat mengucapkan kalimat bahwa bermain untuk Real Madrid adalah sebuah impian. Rumor kepindahannya pun segera merebak.
Kabar itu kemudian berlanjut dengan rumor bahwa sudah ada kontak awal antara pihak Paul Pogba, lewat sang agen Mino Raiola, dengan Madrid. Dan, situasi makin pelik. Manchester United tentu tidak ingin kehilangan Paul Pogba begitu saja.
