thread.title: Sun: «Pogba: chieste 500mila sterline a settimane per il rinnovo»
thread.title_full: Sun: «Pogba: chieste 500mila sterline a settimane per il rinnovo» - Tuttosport

posts.author: tuttosport.com
posts.title: Sun: «Pogba: chieste 500mila sterline a settimane per il rinnovo»
posts.text:
0 Sun: «Pogba: chiesti 30milioni di euro all'anno per il rinnovo»
Il centrocampista francese, obiettivo ormai dichiarato del Real Madrid, avrebbe posto le condizioni ai Red Devils per prolungare il contratto che lo lega al club: 500mila sterline a settimana venerdì 5 aprile 2019
MANCHESTER - Paul Pogba fissa il prezzo per la sua permanenza al Manchester United . È questa la notizia del giorno in casa Red Devils. Secondo il tabloid inglese The Sun, infatti, il centrocampista campione del mondo avrebbe chiesto al club un ingaggio di 500mila sterline a settimana; una cifra mostruosa che significherebbe 30milioni di euro all'anno e aggancio ad Alexis Sachez, calciatore attualmente con l'ingaggio più alto. Sarebbero queste le condizione poste dall'ex Juventus per rimanere ai Red Devils e rifiutare le avance del Real Madrid . Zidane: "Pogba al Real? Perché no..."
APPUNTAMENTO ALLA PROSSIMA SETTIMANA - Minola Raiola, agente del calciatore, e il Manchester United si intcontreranno la prossima settimana per discutere il rinnovo del contratto, attualmente in scadenza a giugno 2021. I Red Devils vorrebbero proporre un prolungamento di tre anni, accontentando dunque le richieste del tecnico Ole Gunner Solskjaer, che vorrebbe fare di Pogba il faro della propria squadra. L'attuale ingaggio del Polpo è di 300mila sterline a settimana, troppo basso secondo il calciatore e il proprio procuratore. Da Pogba a Balotelli: il mondo del calcio con Matuidi
LA CORTE DEL REAL - I Blancos nelle ultime settimane sono usciti allo scoperto, dichiarando il proprio interessamento per il centrocampista francese . Il Presidente Florentino Perez e il tecnico Zinedine Zidane non hanno mai nascosto il loro apprezzamento per Pogba e lo vorrebbero nella rosa delle Merengues per iniziare un nuovo ciclo la prossima stagione. Madrid , tra l'altro, sarebbe una destinazione molto gradita al calciatore che, però, nel caso in cui il Manchester United fosse disposto ad accontentare le sue richieste non potrebbe tirarsi indietro. Il calciomercato non è ancora aperto, ma per Paul Pogba, United e Real potrebbero aprire una vera e proprio asta a suon di milioni di euro.

thread.title: Super Computer simulates the rest of the 2019 Champions League | GiveMeSport
thread.title_full: Super Computer simulates the rest of the 2019 Champions League | GiveMeSport

posts.title: Super Computer simulates the rest of the 2019 Champions League | GiveMeSport
posts.text:
The 2019 Champions League final is on June 1. Super Computer simulates the rest of the 2019 Champions League
The Champions league is reaching it's business end and it's expected to be an exciting end to the competition.
The draw for the quarter-finals last month brought up some interesting ties.
Tottenham Hotspur will play Manchester City in an all-English tie, while Barcelona will play Manchester United.
With Real Madrid out, Barcelona and Juventus are perhaps the favourites for the crown.
But how exactly will the rest of the competition pan out?
talkSPORT have used a Super Computer to predict the quarter-finals, semi-finals and final.
And here's what it thinks will happen... Quarter-finals:
Ajax vs Juventus (Juventus win 3-1 on aggregate)
First leg - 1-1
Liverpool vs Porto (Liverpool win 5-1 on aggregate)
First leg - 3-0
Tottenham Hotspur vs Manchester City (Manchester City win 4-2 on aggregate)
First leg - 1-1
Barcelona vs Manchester United (Barcelona win 4-2 on aggregate)
First leg - 2-1Second leg - 1-2
So no real surprises there. Juventus, Liverpool, Manchester City and Barcelona are the favourites to go through to the last four and they all predicted to win their ties relatively comfortably. Semi-finals
Manchester City vs Juventus (Juventus win 3-2 on aggregate)
First leg - 1-1
Barcelona vs Liverpool (Barcelona win 4-3 on aggregate)
First leg - 2-1Second leg - 2-2
Anything could happen if these four teams make the semi's.
The Super Computer has predicted two hard-fought, entertaining ties, but it's Juventus and Barcelona who are predicted to make it through to the final in Madrid. Final
Juventus 2-1 Barcelona
So the Super Computer thinks Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi will meet in the final in Madrid, with Ronaldo's Juventus narrowly defeating Barcelona.
With the final on June 1, we will soon find out whether the Super Computer is right or not...
Jose Mourinho said last month that Juventus and Barcelona are indeed the favourites to contest the final.
"Juventus and Barcelona are the two great candidates for the competition and will reach the final," Mourinho told AFP, per Sky Sports.
"All they talk about is [Cristiano] Ronaldo and [Lionel] Messi but I prefer to talk about Juve and Barcelona. I will always be a football coach and football continues to be a team sport.
"Juventus and Barcelona have experience, talent and a special player each. There are these special players, the teams end up becoming the best."
He continued, per talkSPORT: “The English teams, as well as Ajax and Porto, are good sides too but they don’t have the same amount of experience.
“When you have Ronaldo or Messi, it certainly gives you a big plus.” Topics:

thread.title: The ECA are pushing UEFA to make 'radical changes' to Champions League after 2024 | GiveMeSport
thread.title_full: The ECA are pushing UEFA to make 'radical changes' to Champions League after 2024 | GiveMeSport

posts.title: The ECA are pushing UEFA to make 'radical changes' to Champions League after 2024 | GiveMeSport
posts.text:
Radical changes are being drawn up for the Champions League. The ECA are pushing UEFA to make 'radical changes' to Champions League after 2024 24/7
The Champions League is the biggest club competition in the world.
And in terms of quality, it is far better than even the World Cup these days, with the finest players on the globe going head-to-head over the season.
Winning the trophy is one of the most difficult things to do, making Real Madrid's three wins on the bounce even more impressive.
This year, there is no real clear favourite, with Barcelona, Juventus, Liverpool and Manchester City all enjoying wonderful seasons.
And who would bet against Ajax, Porto, Manchester United or Tottenham pulling off an upset against the quartet? It truly is the best tournament. De Bruyne: England are favourites for Euro 2020
However, it seems the European Club Association (ECA) are not content with maintaining the current format of the competition.
According to The Times , they are trying to force UEFA to make some 'radical changes' for after 2024 and they may not go down too well with fans across the continent. A NEW GROUP STAGE
One idea ECA are attempting to force is a new group format, having four groups of eight teams instead of eight groups of four.
That would mean each team partaking in 14 group games instead of the current six.
The system would be slightly similar to the old one, where there were two group stages before the knockout rounds - that was abolished after the 2002/03 season.
While it would mean more of Europe's top clubs facing each other throughout the season, there's simply nothing better than knockout football. THE CHAMPIONS LEAGUE AS 'A CLOSED SHOP'
The other radical change the ECA are putting forward to UEFA is to effectively remove the qualifying process altogether.
They want the competition to have the same teams year in, year out and Premier League clubs will be warned today about this potential scenario.
It could spell the end for smaller clubs making it to the pinnacle of the European game, in what would be a sad step backwards for football on the continent. Topics:

thread.title: Fulham xuống hạng: 6 "hàng hot" đang chờ đại gia "xâu xé"
thread.title_full: Fulham xuống hạng: 6 "hàng hot" đang chờ đại gia "xâu xé"

posts.title: Fulham xuống hạng: 6 "hàng hot" đang chờ đại gia "xâu xé"
posts.text:
Fulham xuống hạng: 6 "hàng hot" đang chờ đại gia "xâu xé" 10:00 Thứ sáu 05/04/2019 | 8 BongDa.com.vn Đội chủ sân Craven Cottage đã chính thức trở lại Championship và có thể chia tay đến 6 cầu thủ ngôi sao trong phiên chợ Hè 2019.
1. Aleksandar Mitrovic
Tiền đạo người Serbia đã cập bến Fulham và mang theo nhiều sự kì vọng của ban lãnh đạo cũng như các CĐV. 20,2 triệu euro là số tiền "The Whites" bỏ ra để có được trung phong 24 tuổi từ Newcastle United. Tuy nhiên, một cánh én đã chẳng thể làm nên mùa xuân. Aleksandar Mitrovic có xuất sắc đến đâu cũng không thể giúp đội nhà trụ lại Premier League. Một mình tuyển thủ Serbia không thể gồng gánh Fulham.
Tính đến thời điểm này, cầu thủ 24 tuổi đã ghi đến 10 bàn thắng và có 2 pha kiến tạo cho Fulham. Đây là thành tích ấn tượng dù đội chủ sân Craven Cottage không có được kết quả tốt. Với phong độ này, cựu cầu thủ Partizan hoàn toàn có thể chuyển đến một CLB có tham vọng hơn. Đáng chú ý, Inter Milan đã đánh tiếng muốn chiêu mộ Aleksandar Mitrovic.
2. Ryan Sessegnon
Cầu thủ sinh năm 2000 từ lâu đã trở thành mục tiêu săn đón của các đội bóng hàng đầu châu Âu, trong đó có cả PSG, Manchester United lẫn Tottenham Hotspur. Thậm chí, "Gà trống" từng gửi lời đề nghị 50 triệu bảng cho hậu vệ 18 tuổi nhưng đã bị Fulham từ chối. Thế nhưng, Spurs hoàn toàn có thể tái khởi động thương vụ trong phiên chợ Hè 2019. "Gareth Bale đệ nhị" sẽ ra đi?
Ryan Sessegnon đã ra sân tổng cộng 28 trận ở mùa giải năm nay, ghi 2 bàn thắng và có đến 6 pha kiến tạo cho "the Whites". Nếu chuyển sang một CLB lớn hơn, sao trẻ người Anh sẽ có cơ hội phát triển sự nghiệp và khẳng định mình ở những đấu trường danh giá.
3. Sergio Rico
Thủ thành "tội nghiệp" người Tây Ban Nha có lẽ đã cảm nhận được sự khắc nghiệt của bóng đá Xứ sở sương mù. Xuyên suốt Premier League mùa giải 2018/19 , cựu thủ môn Sevilla chỉ giữ sạch lưới được 2 trận. Sergio Rico muốn tiếp tục chơi bóng tại Premier League mùa giải tới.
Ở tuổi 25, Sergio Rico vẫn còn nhiều tiềm năng để phát triển. Cá nhân người gác đền sinh năm 1993 cũng bày tỏ mong muốn tiếp tục chơi bóng ở Ngoại Hạng Anh. Thời điểm hiện tại, anh vẫn đang thi đấu cho Fulham theo dạng cho mượn từ Sevilla.
4. Jean Michael Seri
Khi còn thi đấu ở Ligue 1 trong màu áo Nice, cầu thủ người Bờ Biển Ngà đã nổi lên như một trong những tiền vệ đáng xem nhất châu Âu. Thậm chí, giới chuyên môn đã đặt cho tiền vệ 27 tuổi biệt danh mỹ miều "Xavi châu Phi". "Xavi châu Phi" từng là mục tiêu của Arsenal.
Mặc dù vậy, quyết định gia nhập Fulham có lẽ là một bước lùi trong sự nghiệp cua Jean Michael Seri. Ngôi sao sinh năm 1991 đã bộc lộ rõ những điểm yếu về thể hình và không đóng góp được nhiều vào lối chơi chung cho đội chủ sân Craven Cottage. Sau 30 trận ra sân tại Premier League, anh mới chỉ ghi được 1 bàn thắng và có 3 pha kiến tạo cho các đồng đội.
5. Andre-Frank Zambo Anguissa
Để nâng cấp đội hình, Fulham đã quyết định "chơi lớn" khi chi tới 24,85 triệu euro để có được tuyển thủ Cameroon từ Marseille. Thế nhưng không khá hơn Jean Michael Seri là bao, đóng góp của Zambo Anguissa cho "The Whites" gần như là con số 0. Với tầm vóc của mình, Zambo Anguissa rất phù hợp với môi trường bóng đá Anh.
Tuy nhiên, cầu thủ 23 tuổi vẫn có thể tìm kiếm bến đỗ mới để tiếp tục chơi bóng ở môi trường đỉnh cao. Một trong những ý tưởng cho tiền vệ sinh năm 1995 đó là trở lại nước Pháp chơi bóng.
6. Luciano Vietto
Cùng với Aleksandar Mitrovic, tiền đạo người Argentina là một trong những điểm sáng của Fulham ở mùa giải năm nay. Sau 22 trận ra sân trên mọi đấu trường, cựu cầu thủ Villarreal đã ghi được 1 bàn thắng và có 4 đường kiến tạo.
Hết mùa giải năm nay, Luciano Vietto sẽ trở lại Atletico Madrid sau khi hết hạn hợp đồng cho mượn. Tuy nhiên, cầu thủ 25 tuổi sẽ khó lòng cạnh tranh với những cái tên khác và nhiều khả năng sẽ bị bán đứt trong phiên chợ Hè 2019. Giang Nam TỪ KHÓA

thread.title: Slow-motion footage of Phil Jones' face as Wolves scored their winner vs Man Utd | GiveMeSport
thread.title_full: Slow-motion footage of Phil Jones' face as Wolves scored their winner vs Man Utd | GiveMeSport

posts.title: Slow-motion footage of Phil Jones' face as Wolves scored their winner vs Man Utd | GiveMeSport
posts.text:
24/7
Manchester United lost ground in the race for the top four on Tuesday evening with a 2-1 defeat away to Wolves.
Scott McTominay actually gave United the lead in the 13th minute, but Diogo Jota's strike and an own goal from Chris Smalling saw them leave Molineux empty handed.
It means they're now sixth in the Premier League and two points behind fourth-placed Arsenal, who have a game in hand and can move five points ahead.
Ole Gunner Solskjaer will have been frustrated by his side's defending for Wolves' 77th-minute winner, with Phil Jones, David de Gea and Smalling all culpable.
Jones failed to win his header against Raul Jimenez, De Gea wandered into no man's land and Smalling missed his clearance before prodding the ball into the back of his own net.
It was comical from United, and what made the whole piece of play even funnier was Jones' face as he realised a goal was coming.
Classic. Jones has a reputation for pulling the funniest faces when he's defending and his expression against Wolves was another one to add to the collection.
What's more is Norwegian channel TV 2 Sporten have slowed down Wolves' goal and zoomed up on Jones to create a slow-motion video of his face. Check it out below.
We can't stop watching it either - it's just mesmerising.
Jones' gurns might not be around for much longer amid reports that Solskjaer could look to sell the Englishman and Smalling this summer as part of a squad revamp.
Solskjaer has improved United's defence since he replaced Jose Mourinho in December, but old habits die hard and they're still conceding sloppy goals.
Should Jones and Smalling leave, it's expected that the Red Devils will target the likes of Samuel Umtiti, Kalidou Koulibaly and Raphael Varane.
The trio would each represent upgrades on Jones but cost upwards of £70m, which would be money well spent if it meant United challenging for the Premier League title next season. Topics:

thread.title: Il supercomputer: "La Juve vincerà la Champions"
thread.title_full: Il supercomputer: "La Juve vincerà la Champions"

posts.title: Il supercomputer: "La Juve vincerà la Champions"
posts.text:
Scopri di più
A dirlo è stato il supercomputer: la Juve passerà il turno contro l'Ajax, ma anche contro il City di Guardiola e vincerà la Champions. La sentenza arriva da talkSPORT , sito di una delle più popolari emittenti radiofoniche britanniche, che ha inserito svariati dati e lasciato all'intelligenza artificiale il verdetto sui risultati di tutte le restanti tredici partite della coppa più prestigiosa d'Europa.
Quel che è certo, secondo il supercomputer degli inglesi, è che tutti i match saranno tiratissimi, tranne un paio dei quarti di finale, dove - già dall'urna di Nyon - erano emerse quattro favorite nei confronti delle avversarie. Per i bianconeri di Allegri la prima partita in Olanda sarà ostica, e chiusa presumibilmente con un 1-1, salvo poi vincere 2-0 allo Stadium. Il Liverpool farà invece valere il proprio fattore campo all'andata vincendo 3-0 ad Anfield contro il Porto, per poi passare 2-1 anche in Portogallo. Avanti anche il City che - stando ai calcoli di talkSPORT - pareggerà l'andata col Tottenham per poi vincere il ritorno 3-1 in casa; mentre il Barça batterà 2-1 il Manchester United in entrambi gli incroci. Verso il Wanda
Dunque le partite decisive, con una Juve che - da sorteggio ufficiale e dovesse passare il turno - giocherà l'andata della semifinale in trasferta e il ritorno in casa. In quel di Manchester altro 1-1 esterno, poi confermato dal 2-1 in casa che proietterebbe Cristiano Ronaldo in finale contro… Leo Messi : 2-1 al Liverpool al Camp Nou e 2-2 ad Anfield. E al Wanda? L'eterna sfida tra il portoghese e l'argentino si potrebbe risolvere una volta per tutte, e a sorridere sarebbero i bianconeri, che il supercomputer dà vincenti per 2-1. tag

thread.title: Ligue 1 : la plus grosse fortune britannique veut racheter Nice
thread.title_full: Ligue 1 : la plus grosse fortune britannique veut racheter Nice

posts.title: Ligue 1 : la plus grosse fortune britannique veut racheter Nice
posts.text:
id="8046849" data-shield="1"> Ligue 1 : la plus grosse fortune britannique veut racheter l’OGC Nice > Sports > Football | V.G. | 05 avril 2019, 0h11 | MAJ : 05 avril 2019, 6h06 | Ratcliffe, 66 ans, est à la tête du groupe industriel Ineos, AFP/Andy Buchanan Jim Ratcliffe est à tête d’une fortune estimée à environ 24 milliards d’euros. Son frère Robert était dans les Alpes-Maritimes ce jeudi. L’OGC Nice va-t-il bientôt prendre l’accent britannique ? Selon Nice-Matin , le club suscite les convoitises de Jim Ratcliffe, homme le plus riche du Royaume-Uni avec un patrimoine estimé à 24 milliards d’euros. Ratcliffe, 66 ans, est à la tête du groupe industriel Ineos, qui a repris le mois dernier l’équipe cycliste Sky .
L’homme n’en est pas à sa première incursion dans le football. La presse britannique a récemment rapporté que ce supporter de Manchester United envisageait de racheter le club londonien de Chelsea, après avoir déjà pris sous son égide l’équipe suisse plus modeste du FC Lausanne.
Objectif : se qualifier en Ligue des champions Son frère Robert était sur la promenade des Anglais ce jeudi pour évoquer le dossier niçois avec le maire Christian Estrosi. « On veut acheter un club, le développer et lui faire franchir un palier, assure-t-il dans un entretien au quotidien régional. Il promet « des investissements conséquents, un plan de développement clair et ambitieux sur le long terme ». « La (qualification en) Ligue des champions, c’est un objectif bien sûr », affirme Robert Ratcliffe.
« C’est l’ancienne direction, à savoir Jean-Pierre (Rivère) et Julien (Fournier), qui a souhaité entrer en contact avec nous », raconte-t-il. Les discussions seraient plus compliquées avec Chien Lee, le propriétaire du club. Robert Ratcliffe l’a rencontré le mois dernier mais « vingt-quatre heures plus tard, on nous a fait savoir qu’il ne voulait plus recevoir d’offre » et aucune offre de rachat n’a pour le moment été effectuée.
V.G. Football Nice Jim Ratcliffe Ligue 1 Patrick Vieira annonces auto-moto avec la centrale + de 300.000 annonces autos et motos pour changer de véhicule

thread.title: Man City might have already found their next captain - Joe Bray - Manchester Evening News
thread.title_full: Man City might have already found their next captain - Joe Bray - Manchester Evening News

posts.author: Joe Bray
posts.title: Man City might have already found their next captain - Joe Bray - Manchester Evening News
posts.text:
Share Comments By Joe Bray 06:00, 5 APR 2019 Sport opinion Manchester City have a perfect replacement for Vincent Kompany as captain. Get the biggest Manchester City FC Vincent Kompany has changed what it means to be captain of Manchester City.
The Belgian not only has the required passion for the club on the pitch, but he knows the responsibility that comes with the armband outside a matchday at the Etihad.
Kompany regularly speaks with authority and class on a range of subjects. When the All or Nothing documentary crew showed Kompany speaking to schoolchildren about Nelson Mandela, it perfectly encapsulated that he is not just at City to win football matches.
The captain of the club is by definition a role model, and Kompany's recent drive to tackle homelessness in Manchester as part of his testimonial year sums up his character just as much as any performance on the pitch.
However much Manchester City is becoming a truly international club, its roots remain in Manchester - and Kompany gets that.
Read More Man City star Raheem Sterling arranges 550 Wembley tickets for kids from his old school But Kompany is not getting any younger, and while a one or two-year contract extension seems likely, his future is still to be decided. There is still a chance he could play his testimonial game at the Etihad later this year having left the club.
Even if he does extend his 11-year stay at the Etihad, Kompany has missed 45 games over the last two seasons through injury, equating to over 200 days where he has been unavailable.
So as City look to the future and hand out multiple long-term contracts to their best players, a new captain is an underlying appointment that needs to be made.
Luckily for Pep Guardiola, there is one clear candidate for the role - Raheem Sterling.
Read More Man City forward Raheem Sterling calls out Leonardo Bonucci over Moise Kean racism comments Like Kompany, Sterling leads by example on and off the pitch. He knows the responsibility of being a Premier League footballer for Manchester City, and uses that platform to raise awareness of important social issues.
The England international's stance on media coverage of young black players has been commendable, and there has already been signs of change as a result of his comments.
Sterling has also been a leading voice in the fight against racism in football, and has rightly been praised for his defiant response to abuse directed towards him in games against Chelsea and Montenegro this season.
Raheem Sterling reacting to racist abuse in Montenegro (Image: Michael Regan/Getty Images) Then there is his contribution to social issues from his home town, where he clearly is looking to give back to an under-privileged area. If City were to reward him with the armband, he would only continue to set an example set by Kompany off the pitch.
And for all the waves Sterling is creating away from the Etihad, it is important to note how much he has matured since his £57m move from Liverpool in 2015.
Clearly a promising talent when he joined, Sterling has become one of the most dangerous attackers in world football this season - and one of the first names on Guardiola's strongest team sheet.
But perhaps the most respectable thing about Sterling is that he doesn't need an armband to continue doing what he has done over the past couple of years.
Read More Man City extend impressive Manchester United record with Premier League win over Cardiff He will carry on scoring important goals and creating chance after chance. And he will not stop championing causes he passionately believes in.
Sterling is approaching the end of his third season with City - the same point of Kompany's career that he took the armband.
Kompany has left big boots to fill when he eventually departs the club, but in Raheem Sterling, City have a perfect replacement.
Read More Man City star Kevin De Bruyne makes bold England Euro 2020 claim Read More Man City third in Premier League agent fees list for 2018/19 behind Liverpool FC and Chelsea

thread.title: Matthijs De Ligt could play for Manchester United - Manchester Evening News
thread.title_full: Matthijs De Ligt could play for Manchester United - Manchester Evening News

posts.author: Charlotte Duncker
posts.title: Matthijs De Ligt could play for Manchester United - Manchester Evening News
posts.text:
Charlotte Duncker 11:02, 5 APR 2019 Sport Matthijs De Ligt has impressed for Ajax. Ajax defender Matthijs De Ligt would be a 'perfect fit' at Manchester United according to former winger Jesper Olsen.
De Ligt, 19, has established himself as one of the best young players in Europe over the last couple of years and has caught the eye of some of Europe's biggest clubs. United are looking to make a number of signings in the summer and the Ajax defender has been repeatedly linked with a move to Old Trafford.
United failed to sign a central defender last year amid interest in Kalidou Koulibaly, Toby Alderweireld, Milan Skriniar, Jerome Boateng and Diego Godin. The MEN revealed last week the club had changed their transfer strategy to focus on youthful targets. Barcelona and Liverpool are both said to be interested in De Ligt but Olsen believes he would fit in perfectly at United under Ole Gunnar Solskjaer.
"No doubt about it [he could play for United]," Olsen told Omnisport. "Playing at Ajax, you have to be a quality player. So, of course, he could. No doubt about it. He could fit into any top team at the moment."
Read More Manchester United might already have David de Gea's replacement United were so wary of De Ligt's distribution in their preparation for the Europa League final that Jose Mourinho instructed his forwards to press the Dutchman whenever he had the ball, but stand off partner Davinson Sanchez. De Ligt made his debut for Ajax in 2016 and has already made more than 100 appearances for the Dutch side and captained them earlier this season.
"I think nowadays the top clubs are very much of the same belief in how you play, they like to be in control of the game," 1985 FA Cup winner Olsen added. "So as long as he goes to one of those clubs, I think a player of [his] calibre would fit in in most teams."

thread.title: Paul Pogba wants new £500,000-a-week contract at Man United amid Real Madrid interest | GiveMeSport
thread.title_full: Paul Pogba wants new £500,000-a-week contract at Man United amid Real Madrid interest | GiveMeSport

posts.title: Paul Pogba wants new £500,000-a-week contract at Man United amid Real Madrid interest | GiveMeSport
posts.text:
Paul Pogba wants £500,000-per-week to extend his stay at Man United. Paul Pogba wants new £500,000-a-week contract at Man United amid Real Madrid interest 24/7
Paul Pogba caused alarm last month when he said a move to Real Madrid would be a 'dream'.
“Like I’ve always said, Real Madrid is a dream for anyone. It’s one of the biggest clubs in the world,” said Pogba, per talkSPORT.
“There is also [Zinedine] Zidane as a coach and it’s a dream for anybody who likes football.
“For now, I’m at Manchester. We don’t know what the future holds. I’m at Manchester and I’m happy.”
Naturally, almost immediately after those comments, multiple outlets reported that Real Madrid were interested in buying Pogba in the summer.
Zinedine Zidane is expected to be backed in the summer transfer market and the club would likely have the financial power to fund a move for Pogba.
Zidane even said on the weekend that he 'likes Pogba a lot.'
“I like Pogba a lot,” Zidane said, per the Independent. “That is not something new. I know him personally, he's different and he gives you something different that very few players can offer.
“If when his experience at United is over and he wants to come why would he not come to Madrid?”
But, what is Pogba's preference? Does he actually want to move to Real Madrid, or will he extend his stay at Manchester United?
The Sun have reported that Pogba is 'flattered by the prospect of moving to Madrid'.
Man United want to do everything in their power to keep Pogba and want to sit down with the Frenchman to discuss a new contract.
But he will not come cheap.
The report adds that Pogba wants an eye-watering £500,000-per-week to extend his contract with the English club.
That would be a dramatic increase from the £300,000-per-week he currently earns and would put him on par with Alexis Sanchez as the highest paid player at the club.
And Mino Raiola is aware that his player is in high demand and will push United all the way when negotiations begin.
The report doesn't say whether Pogba will pursue a move away if his demands aren't met but, it's likely that it won't go down well with the Frenchman if talks don't go as planned.

thread.title: Manchester United transfer news LIVE United prepare for Barcelona clash as Eric Bailly emerges as 'shock' target for Real Madrid - Manchester Evening News
thread.title_full: Manchester United transfer news LIVE United prepare for Barcelona clash as Eric Bailly emerges as 'shock' target for Real Madrid - Manchester Evening News

posts.author: msn.com
posts.title: Manchester United transfer news LIVE United prepare for Barcelona clash as Eric Bailly emerges as 'shock' target for Real Madrid - Manchester Evening News
posts.text:
Share By Richard Fay Updated 14:01, 5 APR 2019 Sport Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Manchester United have a rare weekend off this week meaning they have a full week to prepare for their Champions League quarter-final first leg against Barcelona.
Whereas the La Liga side will prepare for the game at Old Trafford with a gruelling game against Atletico Madrid at the Camp Nou.
However, they have been given an injury boost as French winger Ousmane Dembele came through a training session on Thursday unscathed.
Meanwhile United centre-back Eric Bailly has emerged as a 'shock summer transfer target' for Real Madrid, according to The Sun.
It's reported that Madrid manager Zinedine Zidane is a 'fan of the player from his previous time in La Liga' and his name is on a list of 'first-tier options.'
It's claimed that it would cost Los Blancos £35m for Bailly.
Stick with us for all the latest transfer news, early team news and gossip LIVE throughout the day.
Key Events Lukaku agent hints at possible summer exit 07:55 14:01 Berbatov reveals United vs Barcelona prediction Dimitar Berbatov says he is worried Barcelona and Lionel Messi will ‘punish’ former side United when they meet in the Champions League.
“I’m concerned by United’s poor form and, if they continue to make mistakes like they have been doing recently, then, let’s face it, they’re going to be punished by Barcelona,” Berbatov told Betfair .
“They are making their lives difficult at the moment and it’s looking tough to make the top four in the Premier League now.
“United went on that incredible undefeated run when Ole Gunnar Solskjaer took over and this is their first bad patch.
“You know, when you’re winning everything feels natural and good but an important thing is knowing how to react to a defeat. I’m sure Ole knows what to do here and he will have his side fired up and ready for Barca.
“In football sometimes you have that strange thing where a club can falter against small teams but turn it on against big teams. It’s crucial to get motivated for every game, not just the big ones.
“Sir Alex Ferguson sometimes didn’t need to motivate us for the big games, his job and real skill was to motivate us for the small games.
“I admit, Barcelona are the rightful favourites in the tie, but, of course, so were PSG, and nothing is certain in football.
“United can forget their recent form and make a statement here, but – and it’s nothing new or original – they must watch out for that man Messi.”
Lionel Messi celebrating yet another goal (Image: Jeroen Meuwsen/Soccrates/Getty Images) 13:38 United 'target' tipped to emulate City star Former Sporting Lisbon manager Jorge Jesus believes United ‘target’ Bruno Fernandes can emulate the success of Bernardo Silva in England.
Speaking to Portuguese sports daily A Bola, the former Sporting Lisbon boss said: “Bruno was a player I had identified, as did many others.
“I knew about his qualities and value. I knew that at Sampdoria he was not a certain starter but I realised he was an interesting player.
“He was not the same as the others.”
“There has to be somebody who believes in him because to play for a big European club, that counts a lot and not just talent.
“Some look and some do not.
“But he has everything to play at a higher level as did Bernardo Silva at Manchester City.
“Bruno Fernandes can reach those levels.”
Bruno Fernandes celebrates after scoring during the Europa League fixture between Villarreal and Sporting. 13:18 Umtiti 'talks with United have damaged relationship' with Barcelona Samuel Umtiti has damaged his relaationship with Barcelona after holding talks with United, according to reports.
Eurosport suggest the World Cup winner could leave the Nou Camp in the summer window after ‘flirting’ with United.
13:14 Allegri hoping to emulate Ferguson Juventus manager Max Allegri has spoken of his desire to emulate the achievements of Sir Alex Ferguson.
“There’s always someone who wants to make football more difficult, and it drives me crazy,” Allegri told Corriere della Sera .
“I don’t feel that way about anyone in particular. I can only say that they make what’s simple complicated.
“Simplicity is the most complicated thing, but we’re going in the wrong direction because complicating things makes our work even more difficult.
“A corporate coach is a coach who brings results. I consider myself a manager for the club, who has to bring home results at the end of the season, not only on a sporting level but also in terms of player growth.
“These are results that ultimately affect the club’s financial statements. I hope I have a role like Ferguson’s because it would mean staying at Juventus for so many years.”
12:51 Bookmakers' slash odds on De Gea transfer As speculation continues to mount over the future of David de Gea odds of a transfer away from United have been cut.
Ladbrokes have slashed their odds on a move away from United to just 7/4 as uncertainty surrounds his Old Trafford future.
Ladbrokes Latest Betting
David de Gea’s next club to be PSG – 7/4
David De Gea of Manchester United. 12:25 Tottenham 'lead United' in Ryan Sessegnon race Tottenham are leading the way to sign Ryan Sessegon from Fulham this season, according to reports.
The Mirror suggest Spurs could look to sign the youngster ahead of interest from United and Paris Saint-Germain.
Ryan Sessegnon's services will attract a wealth of interest this summer. (Image: (Photo by Justin Setterfield/Getty Images)) 11:59 Ander Herrera’s wage demands 'revealed' Ander Herrera will demand £200,00 a week in any new contract, according to reports.
The Sun, suggest the Spaniard could be set to pen a five-year contract in France after United reportedly refused to match his £160,000 a week demands.
11:54 Sancho subject of Ronaldo comparison Borussia Dortmund chief executive Hans-Joachim Watzke has compared Jadon Sancho with Cristiano Ronaldo.
“His progress is brilliant. For his age he plays extremely remarkable because he does things you cannot plan like this. But we have to be careful that we do not trigger the hype. This boy just turned 19 years old.
“He is not allowed to lose a millimetre of focus because for the top players every thousandth counts.
“Cristiano Ronaldo has not been at the top of the world for many years because of his talent, but because of his focus no one else has.
“If Jadon proves that in the next few years, we can talk about a world career as well. At this time, we can only speak about his huge potential.”
11:35 Chong praises Solskjaer influence Tahith Chong has thanked Ole Gunnar Solskjaer for giving youth a fair chance during his time at Manchester United.
“It was just a proud moment making my debut against Reading,” Chong told ManUtd.com. “For me and everyone, in and around the club. We won the game as well, which was good.
“The hard work eventually pays off, which is good to see.
“I think, ever since the manager came in, he has given me my debut and others have had theirs too. I think nine players that have come through the Academy have now appeared under him now so it’s amazing to see the trust both him and the club are willing to put in youth.”
11:09 A moment to remember United supporters have been reminiscing about *that* Macheda goal.
10:50 Solskjaer to go on 'scouting mission this weekend' Ole Gunnar Solskjaer will be in position to watch Barcelona this weekend, according to reports.
Mundo Deportivo , suggest the Norwegian will travel to the Nou Camp this weekend to watch Barca take on Atletico Madrid in La Liga.
(Image: Getty Images) 10:22 Why Matthijs De Ligt would be 'perfect for United' Former Ajax and United midfielder Jesper Olsen believes De Ligt would be a perfect fit for United.
“No doubt about it [he could play for United],” Olsen told Omnisport.
“Playing at Ajax, you have to be a quality player. So, of course, he could [play for United], no doubt about it. He could fit into any top team at the moment.”
10:01 Bailly linked with Real Madrid United centre-back Eric Bailly has emerged as a surprising transfer target for Real Madrid, according to reports.
The Sun reports that Bailly is a ‘shock summer transfer target’ for the La Liga juggernauts as manager Zinedine Zidane is a ‘huge fan’ of the defender after his previous spell in Spain.
The Ivorian spent three years in Spain first as a youth-teamer at Espanyol before establishing himself at Villarreal, where he made 47 appearances in an 18-month spell, before making his £34m move to United.
Now it’s reported that Bailly is ‘ready to move on after being plagued by injuries and falling down the pecking order’ and The Sun claim that Madrid will be his escape route in a £35m transfer.
Eric Bailly of Manchester United (Image: Chloe Knott - Danehouse/Getty Images) 09:53 United transfer plans 'to be delayed' after Solskjaer board meeting United’s transfer plans have been delayed following a meeting between Ole Gunnar Solskjaer and the club board, according to reports.
The Metro ,suggest the Norwegian manager met with club officials last month but was unable to agree a finalised budget.
(Image: Getty Images) 09:19 Smalling's special night United’s first-team coaching staff were in attendance as Chris Smalling celebrated his patronage of education charity Football Beyond Borders, last night.
09:16 Valencia's throwback Antonio Valencia is looking back at some of his fondest memories with the Ecuadorian national team.
09:13 Ivan Rakitic responds to praise from Jose Mourinho Ivan Rakitic admits he was flattered to receive such glowing admiration from former Manchester United manager Jose Mourinho.
“‘He’s a fantastic player at every level,” the Portuguese said. “ He’s one of the most underrated players. So I want to finish by saying that because normally we speak about the big names and for me Rakitic [is at that level].”
Rakitic was blown away by the comments Mourinho made, and while thanking the former United manager he also revealed that he hopes to see the Portuguese return to management soon.
“It was amazing to hear that. When I heard it, I said that not even my Dad would not say that,” Rakitic told GQ.
“He is one of the greatest coaches in the world and gave me a lot of confidence and motivation. I want to see Mourinho in football soon.”
08:56 Even signing Mbappe 'wouldn't make United title challengers' Signing a player like Kylian Mbappe this summer wouldn’t make United into immediate title challengers, according to Duncan Castles.
“I don’t think there’s any one player who could turn Manchester United back into title contenders, I think the problems are deeper than that,” he told The Transfer Window podcast .
“Outside of Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi, let’s say you take the third best player at present, Kylian Mbappe, and put him in the team.
“Yes, that would make a big difference to Manchester United’s attack. He would suit the way Solskjaer’s playing, which is very much, and becoming more so as the season progresses, counter-attack based football, turning defence into attack very quickly.
“Mbappe would be ideal for that, but would that be enough to turn them into title contenders, to bridge that gap to Liverpool and Man City? No I don’t think it would be, because there’s so many other areas in the team that need fixing.”
08:52 United 'regularly scout' Saul Niguez United have regularly been scouting Saul Niguez over a potential move, according to reports.
ESPN suggest the club are interested in a move for the Atletico Madrid midfielder this summer have been scouting the playmaker since the early days of his professional career in 2013-14.
Saul Niguez (Image: Gonzalo Arroyo Moreno/Getty Images) 08:35 Rakitic reveals United 'respect' Ivan Rakitic admits he can’t help but respect United for what they have achieved in the Champions League already this season.
“Man United is having good results and to score three goals in Paris was incredible,” he told GQ .
“You have to respect Manchester for this comeback, for the organisation and fight in the team with so many young players.
“I have a lot of respect for the British people and the passion which they have for football, the full stadiums.”
08:23 Phelan has 'concerns' on staying on as United assistant Mike Phlean has concerns about remaining as an assistant coach at United, according to reports.
The Mail reports Phelan holds concerns over the current management and recruitment systems at the club, and wants assurances before he commits his long-term future the United.
08:16 United fans make Koulibaly transfer demand after viral training video United supporters have demanded the club to sign Kalidou Koulibaly this summer after a video of his skills in training went viral.
Koulibaly is a target for United as they look to reinforce their back line with a new top quality addition at the end of the season, and based on his latest exploits he is exactly what the club need.
Although the Senegal international is known for his composure at the heart of defence, it is his skills with the ball at his feet which have really had supporters talking.
Napoli uploaded a clip to social media on Thursday which showed the centre-back in training beating a teammate with step overs before scoring an outrageous rabona effort into the top corner of the net.
The skill shown from Koulibaly was a world away from some of the football seen at United this season, and supporters are demanding he is signed in the coming months.
Read the best fan reaction and see the clip here.
07:55 KEY EVENT Lukaku agent hints at possible summer exit Romelu Lukaku’s agent, Federico Pastorello, has hinted the Belgian striker could look to leave the club at the end of the season.
“At the moment he is very focused on finishing the season,” the agent told Sky Sports.
“The competition for third and fourth place in England is very tight so let’s see what will happen in the future at the end the season.
“It’s his second season here and he will still have three years on his contract until the end. Let’s see. He’s someone who loves to know a different culture, a different football.
“He sees a way to have a career playing in different countries because he would like to win some trophies and prove himself and say to his children ‘I won there and I won there and I won there’ and ‘I was a very good player in all the top championships’ so let’s see, the future is really very open but, at the moment, we don’t discuss about that because really the season is in a big moment.”
Romelu Lukaku celebrates against PSG (Image: FRANCK FIFE/AFP/Getty Images) 07:48 PSG 'willing to match' De Gea demands Paris Saint-Germain would be willing to offer David de Gea £350,000 a week in order to bring him to the French capital, according to reports.
The Independent suggest PSG have made the Spaniard a top transfer target and are willing to meet his latest wage demands in order to secure his signature.
Manchester United keeper David De Gea. (Image: Getty Images) 07:21 Koulibaly 'sacks agent' amid United interest Napoli defender Kalidou Koulibaly has parted company with his agent Bruno Satin amid rumours linking him with a move to United, according to reports.
The Independent suggest the Senegalese centre-back is looking to change representatives in order to secure a summer move away from Naples.
Kalidou Koulibaly of Napoli (Image: Danilo Di Giovanni/Soccrates/Getty Images) 07:09 Pogba 'wage demands for new United deal revealed' Paul Pogba will only sign a new long-term deal at United if the club make him their highest earner, according to reports.
The Sun suggest the World Cup winner will demand a weekly wage of roughly £500,000 if he is to agree a new deal to keep him at Old Trafford.
Barcelona handed major injury boost ahead of Manchester United fixture Barcelona have been handed a sizeable injury boost ahead of their trip to Manchester United next week after Ousmane Dembele came through a training session on Thursday unscathed.
The French winger hasn’t played since he sustained a hamstring injury during the Blaugrana’s last Champions League game against Lyon on March 14.
Barca play Atletico Madrid this weekend before facing United at Old Trafford on April 10. It is not clear if Dembele will be risked against Atleti but Spanish outlet Mundo Deportivo say it is unlikely.
Dembele did some light training on his own before completing a section of the group session with his teammates.
Read more here.
BARCELONA, SPAIN - MARCH 13: Oussame Dembele of Barcelona celebrates his goal with Jordi Alba, Lionel Messi, Arturo Vidal during the UEFA Champions League Round of 16 Second Leg match between FC Barcelona and Olympique Lyonnais (OL, Lyon) at Camp Nou stadium on March 13, 2019 in Barcelona, Spain. (Photo by Jean Catuffe/Getty Images) The surprising Anthony Martial stat that sees him ranked third among Premier League's top strikers Anthony Martial has gone through up and down periods since arriving at Manchester United back in 2015.
After a slow start, the Frenchman enjoyed a successful spell under Louis van Gaal scoring 11 goals and assisting four in his debut season at Old Trafford. However, he suffered a fractured relationship with manager Jose Mourinho thereafter.
The pari’s relationship reached boiling point last summer when Martial returned to France from the club’s pre-season tour of the United States for the birth of his child.
The player’s agent Philippe Lamboley was even Quote: d as stating Martial wanted to leave because United had not demonstrated they wanted make the then 23-year-old “an important member of the team”.
But the departure of Mourinho and arrival of Ole Gunnar Solskjaer was followed by a new contract for the Frenchman that will keep him at United until June 2024, with the option to extend for a further year.
Read more here.
MANCHESTER, ENGLAND - MARCH 30: Anthony Martial of Manchester United celebrates after scoring his team's second goal during the Premier League match between Manchester United and Watford FC at Old Trafford on March 30, 2019 in Manchester, United Kingdom. (Photo by Shaun Botterill/Getty Images) Manchester United's Eric Bailly a 'shock summer transfer target for Real Madrid' Manchester United centre-back Eric Bailly has emerged as a surprising transfer target for Real Madrid, according to reports.
The Sun reports that Bailly is a ‘shock summer transfer target’ for the La Liga juggernauts as manager Zinedine Zidane is a ‘huge fan’ of the defender after his previous spell in Spain.
The Ivorian spent three years in Spain first as a youth-teamer at Espanyol before establishing himself at Villarreal, where he made 47 appearances in an 18-month spell, before making his £34m move to United.
Now it’s reported that Bailly is ‘ready to move on after being plagued by injuries and falling down the pecking order’ and The Sun claim that Madrid will be his escape route in a £35m transfer.
It’s also reported that Los Blancos were trying to sign Bailly when he initially moved to Old Trafford and now ‘bosses at the Bernabeu have him on a list of first-tier options.’

thread.title: The 2018/19 Premier League table if the top six were completely removed | GiveMeSport
thread.title_full: The 2018/19 Premier League table if the top six were completely removed | GiveMeSport

posts.title: The 2018/19 Premier League table if the top six were completely removed | GiveMeSport
posts.text:
Wolves, Watford & Leicester are three of the 'best of the rest'. The 2018/19 Premier League table if the top six were completely removed 24/7
It is no secret that the Premier League's top six teams have been utterly dominant in the 2018/19 season.
The gap between Manchester United in sixth and Wolves in seventh stands at 14 points, while Manchester City at the top are currently 33 ahead of Nuno Espirito Santo's men.
There is also the startling fact that not a single member of the division's bottom three clubs has picked up a single point against the top six, which we reported on HERE .
Thirty-one games, 31 losses, the gulf in class is becoming more and more obvious in a league famed for the phrase 'anyone can beat anyone'.
However, there is no doubting that there is quality outside of the top six in the Premier League. Eric Bailly is being targeted by Real Madrid
Wolves, Watford, Leicester, Everton and Crystal Palace all possess some of the finest players in the league and often provide tough tests for the top teams.
But who would reign supreme if the sextet at the summit of the league were wiped from the records this season? Well, Watford would be on course to land the title.
In their 22 games against those around them and below them, the Hornets have mustered a very impressive 43 points, five ahead of Everton in second.
You can view the full table below, which further highlights just how bizarre Wolves' record against the top six has been. THE CURRENT TABLE
There's a very familiar feel about the bottom half, with Fulham recording just two points away from home against the rest all season - even Huddersfield have managed six.
Southampton actually have the second worst home record against those around them, earning just 11 points all season.
What the table will look like come the end of the season should make for interesting reading, especially with Watford, Wolves and Brighton all involved in FA Cup semi-finals. Topics:

thread.title: Herrera to pocket £52m if he quits Man Utd for five-year PSG deal as one of world’s top-paid stars
thread.title_full: Herrera to pocket £52m if he quits Man Utd for five-year PSG deal as one of world’s top-paid stars

posts.author: ian tuckey
posts.title: Herrera to pocket £52m if he quits Man Utd for five-year PSG deal as one of world’s top-paid stars
posts.text:
EFL NEW PAY ERA Herrera to pocket £52MILLION if he quits Man Utd for five-year PSG deal as one of world’s top-paid stars
Midfielder's contract ends this summer and he's set for £200k-a-week Paris move as Utd chiefs don't like his £160k demands Exclusive 5th April 2019, 12:16 am Updated: 5th April 2019, 1:25 am By Andrew Dillon Invalid Date, ANDER HERRERA stands to trouser a whopping £52MILLION if he walks out of Old Trafford this summer.
The Manchester United midfielder is poised to sign a five-year contract with French giants Paris Saint-Germain worth around £200,000 a week which will make him one of the richest players in world football. Getty - Contributor 1 In-form midfielder Ander Herrera is thought to want £160,000 a week but Manchester United seem certain to reject that - meaning he could join PSG
Spaniard Herrera is reluctantly leaving the club he joined in 2014 from Athletic Bilbao having failed to agree new terms.
The 29-year-old will be a free agent come June after five years with the Red Devils, which has enabled moneybags PSG to offer such huge wages long term.
United’s board would not meet Herrera’s request for £160,000 a week which looks set to trigger a parting of the ways.
Herrera and many other leading figures at United believe they deserve some pay parity with striker Alexis Sanchez who is believed to earn around £505,000 a week.
But new permanent boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is set to let at least four other senior stars leave this summer. most read in football

thread.title: Mike Phelan considering his future at Manchester United after voicing concerns over club’s structure
thread.title_full: Mike Phelan considering his future at Manchester United after voicing concerns over club’s structure

posts.author: Metro Sport Reporter
posts.title: Mike Phelan considering his future at Manchester United after voicing concerns over club’s structure
posts.text:
13 Shares Ole Gunnar Solskajer is desperate for Mike Phelan to stay (Picture: Getty)
Ole Gunnar Solskjaer’s assistant, Mike Phelan, is yet to commit his future to the club as he is concerned about the structure behind the scenes at Manchester United .
The former United midfielder served under Sir Alex Ferguson for a decade before the Scot’s retirement and was sorely missed as David Moyes opted against keeping the 56-year-old at Old Trafford.
Solskjaer’s first call after being offered the United job was to Phelan and the Lancashire-born coach has proved pivotal in restoring the mindset lost at the Theatre of Dreams since Ferguson’s departure in 2013.
Solskjaer has already signed a three-year deal with the club to become their permanent manager and is desperate for Phelan, who has spent much of his time in Australia in the last five years, to stay. Phelan has been working with the Central Coast Mariners (Picture: Getty)
However, the Daily Mail claim Phelan is concerned by the club’s ‘convoluted’ management structure and feels there’s a muddled approach to their recruitment system.
Moyes was said to be shocked at the club’s bloated scouting network and Solskjaer shares the Scot’s view, believing that the club need to streamline their approach to reduce their 58 scouts around the world to a more manageable number.
Phelan is happy to be back at the Theatre of Dreams but it’s been over a week since Solskjaer signed his deal and the club are still trying to persuade him to sign his own.

thread.title: It’s really OLD Trafford as new Tottenham Stadium shows Man Utd need to escape time warp
thread.title_full: It’s really OLD Trafford as new Tottenham Stadium shows Man Utd need to escape time warp

posts.author: ian tuckey
posts.title: It’s really OLD Trafford as new Tottenham Stadium shows Man Utd need to escape time warp
posts.text:
Old Trafford was already looking dated - but now it is paling into comparison with venues like the new Tottenham Stadium and Barcelona's revamped Camp Nou
Manchester United have the soul but Spurs have the stadium.
When the world got its first proper look on Wednesday they set the benchmark for modern, iconic sporting venues.
Spurs are future-proofing football in North London by investing £1BILLION on this impressive facelift.
Their financial results, published yesterday, reinforced their grip on the game. They made a net profit of £112.9million and boasted record income of £380.7m while they were squatting at Wembley.
United, who have spent 30 years figuring out a way to upgrade their main stand, have been caught short.
Sure enough one of the biggest rebuilding jobs in their history will soon take place on the pitch.
Players will come and go as Ole Gunnar Solskjaer shapes and moulds and kneads a modern United.
The stadium, this sprawling sporting cathedral, will stay the same.
When the Glazers start scratching their heads to work out a way to maximise corporate income with future trends in mind, they could imitate Spurs and start again. ANTIQUATED FACILITIES
United have the site, a giant apron of land behind the Stretford End where you can park as close to the stadium as the manager on a matchday.
When they peek over the neighbours’ fence, they will see that the rest of Europe has been sprucing itself up.
Barcelona are spending £500m revamping Nou Camp and Real Madrid are finding a similar amount from the back of the sofa to remodel the Bernabeu.
Of the 20 biggest clubs in Europe, Manchester City , Arsenal, Juventus, Bayern Munich, Borussia Dortmund, Schalke, Atletico Madrid and West Ham have also moved into, or rebuilt, stadiums in the last 20 years. They are all planning for the future.
Once the Spurs hotel is operational and they have sorted out the gremlins with the transport links, they will be in the mix to host a Champions League final.
United, with its antiquated and squashed facilities, last had this honour in 2003.
They are well down the pecking order as the rest of European football is undergoing a transformation. History and heritage will only take United so far.
The walk-up to Old Trafford triggers memories, with those cantilevered stands bursting with stories about past glories.
It is a traditional football stadium, with a firm nod to their humble beginnings in every pocket of the stadium.
The modern trend is to play in a giant bowl, to exploit the extra internal space to build ever more attractions, more restaurants, create more opportunities.
Spurs’ project is not perfect and the mind boggles as to why a tram link has not been put in place to ease congestion by shuttling fans up and down the High Road.
Once the sheen and the stadium envy wears off, the money men at United will re-evaluate. 5 La Liga champions Barcelona are not just content to stay at the top on the pitch - they also want to stay in the elite for facilities
The rest of Europe are exploring the options and working out a way to bring in additional revenue. Spurs have joined United as a money-making machine.
Corporate cash is king, with swish restaurants such as The Vault, The H and Galvin’s bringing in premium clientele on matchdays.
Next season the Sky Walk will open, transforming the way to watch football from a suite suspended off the roof of the North Stand.
The street food and the micro-brewery flogging craft beers on the concourses cater for the hipster crowd who follow Spurs around.
These Third Rail ideas, borrowed from American sports, will catch the attention of a millennial audience.
United are famous for extracting cash from every pore, with tie-ups in place for official wine partners, spirits partners, digital transformation partners, even paint partners.
What became obvious after Wednesday is that it will take more than a fresh coat to modernise United. Tottenham remember a momentous day after new stadium opens for first game against Crystal Palace WOMEN NEEDING A BOOST
AT FIRST glance it looked like the kick-off time.
Amid the fanfare of Barclays’ celebrated sponsorship deal with the FA for the Women’s Super League, the official attendance for the clash between Everton and ­Yeovil was 230.
That game was played just nine days after Barclays announced their contract, worth £10million over three seasons.
For the women’s game to evolve, it will need some serious planning to generate increased interest and hold an audience.
The ability of the players cannot be questioned because anybody who sat down to watch the Continental League Cup final between Manchester City and Arsenal will readily confirm the quality of the two teams.
Attendances is a key issue, with the women’s game struggling to compete for a market share.
It is a head-scratcher for Barclays because they will be allocating a hefty marketing spend on this product shortly. When they do, they need people to start filling these grounds. AP:Associated Press Juventus defender Leonardo Bonucci came under fire for saying team-mate and racial abuse victim Moise Kean had 50 per cent of the blame Getty Images - Getty Juve's Italy striker Moise Kean responded to abuse from Cagliari fans with this celebration after being subjected to monkey chants ONE LOVE NOT HATE
IT IS a small gesture, but the Premier League could promote racial equality by introducing a “One Team” photo before kick off at every game, every week.
Instructing both sets of players to be pictured interlinked would remind idiots spreading racial hatred from the stands that footballers — Leonardo Bonucci aside — are united in this cause.
It would not solve it, but this simple act would add another layer to the fight against racial intolerance. most read in football

thread.title: Prem fight for four Champions League places could become redundant as Euro elite bids for Champions League closed shop
thread.title_full: Prem fight for four Champions League places could become redundant as Euro elite bids for Champions League closed shop

posts.author: ian tuckey
posts.title: Prem fight for four Champions League places could become redundant as Euro elite bids for Champions League closed shop
posts.text:
EFL top flaw Prem fight for four Champions League places could become redundant as Euro elite bids for Champions League closed shop
As Spurs, Arsenal, Chelsea and Man Utd fight for the last two qualification spots this term, there are plans for a revamp By Martin Lipton 4th April 2019, 10:40 pm Updated: 4th April 2019, 11:11 pm THE top-four race for a Champions League spot could become redundant if Europe’s big clubs get their way.
This season the battle between Spurs , Arsenal , Chelsea and Manchester United for the final two places and 65million in Uefa cash looks set to go down to the wire. AP:Associated Press 2 Clubs like Real, who won the Champions League three times in a row under Zinedine Zidane, would be safe but the possible changes would hit Prem representation
But today Premier League clubs will be told about plans to revamp the Champions League — and effectively turn it into a closed shop.
The plans are being ramped up by Juventus president Andrea Agnelli, the head of the European Clubs Association.
And the 20 Prem clubs will hear at their shareholders meeting that among the ideas on the table would be a “locked-in” top-24 each season.
Agnelli and his supporters at the ECA — whose board includes United executive vice-chairman Ed Woodward — are pushing for wholesale changes from 2024.
ECA hardliners want the current eight groups of four clubs changed to four groups of eight.
That means 14 group-stage games — and 21 to win the European Cup.
One proposal is for the top six in each of the new four groups to earn automatic qualification for the following year. most read in football

thread.title: Man Utd ready to open contract talks with Pogba to fend off Real Madrid – but star wants £500k a week
thread.title_full: Man Utd ready to open contract talks with Pogba to fend off Real Madrid – but star wants £500k a week

posts.author: Joshua Jones
posts.title: Man Utd ready to open contract talks with Pogba to fend off Real Madrid – but star wants £500k a week
posts.text:
EFL PAUL'S HAUL Man Utd ready to open contract talks with Pogba to fend off Real Madrid – but French star wants £500,000-a-week
The World Cup winner still has two years left on his current deal at Old Trafford but the Red Devils are acutely aware of Zinedine Zidane's interest Exclusive 5th April 2019, 7:11 am Updated: 5th April 2019, 7:12 am By Martin Lipton Invalid Date, MANCHESTER UNITED are ready to open contract talks with Paul Pogba — in a bid to fend off Real Madrid.
But the star midfielder wants an eye-watering £500,000 a week to put him up with Alexis Sanchez as the club’s top-paid player. Getty - Contributor 2 Paul Pogba is eyeing a staggering £500,000-per-week contract to stay at Manchester United
Real boss Zinedine Zidane hopes to land fellow Frenchman Pogba as well as Chelsea’s Eden Hazard as part of his Bernabeu summer refit.
But while Pogba, 26, is thought to be flattered by the prospect of moving to Madrid, United will do everything in their power to keep the midfielder.
And that means agreeing with boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer that Pogba must remain a key part of the United squad for the long-term.
Pogba’s current deal has two years to run, although United have an option to extend that for a further 12 months.
But the Red Devils could be willing to put a three-year extension on the table, tying Pogba to Old Trafford until 2024.
Pogba’s agent Mino Raiola is aware that his player is in high demand and will push United all the way when negotiations begin next week.
Any new deal would need a huge wage increase with Pogba currently on a basic of £300,000 a week, significantly less than flop Sanchez’s £505,000. Latest Manchester United news Sir Alex Ferguson's company's value rises to £11m after earning £2m last year QUEUE BEAUTY Solskjaer plots Carrington revamp to give Man Utd stars separate dinner queue Exclusive VERY ANDY Herrera gets £52MILLION if he quits Utd for PSG to be one of world's highest paid Live Blog Man United transfer news LIVE - Latest updates from Old Trafford Comment It's so OLD Trafford as Tottenham Stadium proves Man Utd must escape time warp top flaw Prem fight for four Champions League spots may end as Euro elite eyes closed shop 'STAND OUT THERE' Paul Parker urges players NOT to walk off the pitch if racially abused
Raiola is also acutely conscious of Solskjaer’s desperation to keep Pogba with United set to lose out-of-contract pair Ander Herrera and Juan Mata.
Meanwhile, Sanchez’s troubled stay at Old Trafford is on the brink of ending if the club can find a buyer.
That all puts Pogba and his agent in the box seat but, for United, winning the battle with Real is seen as a vital statement of intent and ambition. thread.title: Le PSG encore prêt à des folies pour De Gea ?
thread.title_full: Le PSG encore prêt à des folies pour De Gea ?

posts.title: Le PSG encore prêt à des folies pour De Gea ?
posts.text:
Il y a 10 heures Mis à jour Il y a 9 heures 0 0 TRANSFERTS - Le PSG (r)entre dans la course pour David De Gea. Officiellement en fin de contrat en juin prochain, le gardien de Manchester United serait une piste du club parisien sur le mercato. Selon le quotidien The Independent, une offre salariale pourrait rapidement être transmise. Et si le PSG faisait d'une pierre deux coups ? Annoncé (très) proche d'Ander Herrera , qui est en fin de contrat à Manchester United, le club de la capitale s'intéresserait à un autre joueur des Red Devils. Et pas n'importe lequel, puisqu'il s'agit d'un certain... David De Gea. Voilà ce qu'affirme le quotidien britannique The Independent , précisant que les dirigeans parisiens seraient prêts à offrir le salaire que réclame le gardien espagnol à son club pour prolonger, soit 21 millions d'euros/an. Imbroglio autour de la durée de contrat Si la priorité de De Gea est celle de prolonger avec les Red Devils, le Guardian expliquait ce jeudi matin que les négociations sont actuellement au point mort. Une information d'ailleurs confirmée par The Independent . Résultat, un départ en fin de saison n'est pas à exclure pour le portier de 28 ans. Officiellement, ce dernier est en fin de contrat en juin prochain. Officieusement, certains médias affirment que le situation est bien différente. En effet, une option d'une année supplémentaire figurerait dans le contrat du gardien. Et United en aurait profité pour la lever il y a quelques mois. Toutefois, cette information n'a jamais été officialisée par les parties concernées. Le PSG conserve donc toutes ses chances dans ce dossier. Quid de l'avenir de Gianluigi Buffon et Alphonse Areola ? En concurrence cette saison, les deux gardiens parisiens s'interrogeraient forcément sur leur avenir proche en cas d'arrivée de De Gea, qui serait assuré de devenir le titulaire du poste. Les problèmes ne feraient alors probablement que commencer...

thread.title: David De Gea open to Juventus transfer but Paris Saint-Germain lead way for Manchester United star
thread.title_full: David De Gea open to Juventus transfer but Paris Saint-Germain lead way for Manchester United star

posts.author: Metro Sport Reporter
posts.title: David De Gea open to Juventus transfer but Paris Saint-Germain lead way for Manchester United star
posts.text:
80 Shares David De Gea is considering his future at Manchester United (Picture: Getty)
Paris Saint-Germain are willing to meet David De Gea’s wage demands as the race heats up to sign the Manchester United goalkeeper.
The Spaniard has 15 months left on his current deal at Old Trafford and the club have so far refused to meet his wage demands, which are believed to be in the region of £350,000-a-week before bonuses.
United’s decision to hand Alexis Sanchez record wages of around £400,000-a-week has caused friction within the squad, particularly as the Chilean has failed to vindicate their decision at any point in the last 18 months.
De Gea is not unhappy at Old Trafford and will consider staying at the club if they increase their offer. De Gea had viewed Juventus as an ‘attractive’ option (Picture: Getty)
However, the Spaniard is aware he may have to end his eight-year stay in the north-west and the Independent claim he viewed Juventus as an ‘attractive’ option. Advertisement Advertisement
The Italians allowed Gianluigi Buffon to move to PSG last summer and were expected to enter the market for a top level goalkeeper this summer.
However, Wojciech Szczesny’s form has convinced the club that such a move would be unnecessary and that’s opened the door to PSG.

thread.title: Man Utd told they will have to pay £100m to sign Aaron Wan-Bissaka and Wilfried Zaha from Crystal Palace
thread.title_full: Man Utd told they will have to pay £100m to sign Aaron Wan-Bissaka and Wilfried Zaha from Crystal Palace

posts.author: Joe Miles
posts.title: Man Utd told they will have to pay £100m to sign Aaron Wan-Bissaka and Wilfried Zaha from Crystal Palace
posts.text:
EFL wil cost you Man Utd told they will have to pay £100m to sign Aaron Wan-Bissaka and Wilfried Zaha from Crystal Palace
Eagles veteran John Salako insisted Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's side will have to splash the cash to sign the duo this summer By Joe Miles 4th April 2019, 3:15 pm Updated: 4th April 2019, 3:30 pm MANCHESTER UNITED will have to spend £100m to sign Aaron Wan-Bissaka and Wilfried Zaha from Crystal Palace, according to Eagles legend John Salako.
The Selhurst Park duo have emerged as top targets for Ole Gunnar Solskjaer - who is planning a complete overhaul of his squad this summer. 1 Wilfried Zaha and Aaron Wan-Bisska are first-team regulars at Selhurst Park
It is understood that United are set to launch a £35m bid to bring English right-back Aaron Wan-Bissaka to Old Trafford this summer.
Solskjaer is keen to bolster his defence with Antonio Valencia and Matteo Darmian both expected to leave at the end of the season.
But Salako, who played for Crystal Palace from 1986 until 1995, insisted United will need to splash the cash if they want to sign them both. 'BIG MONEY'
When asked to name a price for Wan-Bissaka, Salako told talkSPORT: "I would say probably £40million.
"I mean Luke Shaw came in at United for £30m, so £35m to £40m for a fledgling, young lad who has only had one season, that would be big money."
For Zaha, he said: "For Wilfried, probably more like £50m to £60m."
Zaha failed to live up to expectations during his first spell with United and he was sent straight back to Palace on loan in 2013.
The forward worked with Solskjaer during his 2014 loan spell with Cardiff and the pair are said to have enjoyed a good relationship. latest man utd news

En Inglaterra aseguran que el ciclo Marcos Rojo en el Manchester United está llegando a su fin. El defensor argentino que fue contratado en 2014 no sería tenido en cuenta por el técnico Ole Gunnar Solskjaer para la próxima temporada. ¿Vuelve a Estudiantes?
Toda Pasión pudo averiguar que la intención del jugador es regresar a la Argentina y ponerse la camiseta del Pincha nuevamente: ¿será a partir de junio?
Leé también La maestra de Marcos Rojo: “Quisiera que todos mis alumnos logren triunfar como vos” Rojo estuvo hace algunas semanas en City Bell entrenándose con Estudiantes ya que era plena fecha FIFA y vino a la Argentina para pasar su cumpleaños con su familia. Al defensor se lo vio feliz.
ROJO. Con la ropa de Estudiantes el pasado 20 de marzo (Fuente: Estudiantes). ROJO. Con la ropa de Estudiantes el pasado 20 de marzo (Fuente: Estudiantes). En una de las imágenes se lo vio a Rojo charlando con Gabriel Milito, actual técnico de Estudiantes que ya planifica el plantel para la pretemporada y el próximo campeonato.
Rojo perdió mucho terreno en Manchester United. Tras un pobre desempeño en el Mundial de Rusia con la Selección argentina, el lateral izquierdo apenas disputó cuatro partidos esta temporada.
Su regreso a Estudiantes no sería sencillo ya que tiene contrato con el club inglés hasta 2021. En caso de llegar a un acuerdo, sería un refuerzo de lujo para el Pincha y un gran regreso para el fútbol argentino.

thread.title: Tottenham post record-breaking £139m profit | Business
thread.title_full: Tottenham post record-breaking £139m profit | Business News | Sky News

posts.author: John-Paul Ford Rojas, business reporter
posts.title: Tottenham post record-breaking £139m profit | Business
posts.text:
Tottenham Hotspur have reported a world record pre-tax profit of £138.9m - as the club moves into its £1bn new stadium.
The north London club's earnings for the year to the end of June 2018 were more than double the £51.7m reported a year before.
Tottenham trumped Premier League rivals Liverpool which set the previous record when it reported a pre-tax profit of £125.1m earlier this year.
Revenues rose 23% to a record £380.7m, though income from TV broadcasting rights was slightly lower at £147.6m as the club slipped down to third in the league after finishing as runners-up the year before.
Image: Harry Kane pictured during Tottenham's 2-0 win over Crystal Palace in the first game at the new stadium Spurs said Premier League gate receipts more than doubled to £42.6m during a season when it played home matches at Wembley as its own venue was rebuilt.
Advertisement The club also earned £53m in prize money as it reached the knock-out stages of the Champions League.
It sold an average of 68,500 tickets for every home game - and said this underlined the need for a higher capacity stadium to meet demand.
More from Business No-deal Brexit would be 'catastrophic', farmers warn Children's snacks not as healthy as they claim, says study Divorce leaves MacKenzie Bezos as world's third-richest woman When will the penny drop? Pensions crackdown has sparked NHS staffing crisis New technology sparks hopes of a mining revival in Cornwall Lorries face huge queues in a no-deal Brexit, say industry insiders Tottenham's new ground, the construction of which was dogged by delays, has a capacity of 62,000 compared to 36,000 at the old White Hart Lane ground.
Image: The new stadium has a capacity of 62,000 The club's financial results showed that during the financial year it increased the size of the bank loan to finance the stadium from £400m to £537m.
Tottenham made a £73m profit on the sale of players over a period when it sold Kyle Walker to Manchester City, Nabil Bentaleb to Schalke and Kevin Wimmer to Stoke City.
Its wage bill for 2017-18 rose to £147.6m, more than £20m higher than the year before but still far lower than those of a number of its top rivals and half that of Manchester United.
Profits after tax were £113m, up from £36.2m the year before.

thread.title: FA Report Reveals Liverpool Top Premier League Agent Fee List With £44m Spent Between 2018-19
thread.title_full: FA Report Reveals Liverpool Top Premier League Agent Fee List With £44m Spent Between 2018-19

posts.author: Robbie Copeland
posts.title: FA Report Reveals Liverpool Top Premier League Agent Fee List With £44m Spent Between 2018-19
posts.text:
​Manchester City might be leading the way in the Premier League table, but as far as agent fees between 2018 and 2019 go, it's Liverpool who are out on top, according to a report published by the FA.
The Reds saw the likes of Fabinho and Alisson Becker arrive in big money moves, and spent more than anyone else on transfer fees throughout 2018, so it comes as no major surprise to see them leading the pack.
The information comes from an ​FA report published on Wednesday, which details the amounts each Premier League club paid to registered intermediaries between February 2018 and January 2019 - accounting for both the summer and winter transfer windows.
With ​Liverpool out in front, here are the top ten.
1. Liverpool – £43,795,863 ​ Perhaps the only surprise here is how much Liverpool are leading by here, considering they spent £160m on four players ​ in the summer - though it's unclear if payments made to Naby Keita's agent are included, since that deal was finalised over a year ago.
As boldly as they've spent, however, they have definitely backed it up. Their investment has transformed them from a plucky top-four contender into the genuine challenger to Manchester City we weren't sure we would get this season.
2. Chelsea - £26,850,552
Coming in at a distant second-place is Chelsea, whose spending will likely be attributed to the managerial changeover - as well as the £120m they spent to secure Jorginho and Kepa in the summer.
You can expect their figure to drop for 2019-20, however, given that they've been ​banned from signing any players.
3. Manchester City - £24,122,753
By their own standards, City spent fairly modestly in 2018-19, perhaps reflecting the stability that Pep Guardiola has been able to instil in the Premier League champions.
The signing of Riyad Mahrez will account for much of their spending here, with the rest made up by the renewal of several key players' contracts in the last 12 months or so.
4. Manchester United - £20,759,350
The only other team to break the £20m barrier is United, who splashed out on Fred and Diogo Dalot back in the summer.
It seems likely, now that Ole's at the wheel, that this could be on the up over the next 12 months or so. Raphael Varane's agent won't come cheap, after all...
5. Everton - £19,116,370
The Toffees spent almost £90m on transfers and brought in Marco Silva to replace Sam Allardyce in the summer, so it's no surprise they place so highly in the standings here.
They sit tenth in the Premier League, which is far from a disaster, but given how much they've paid out over the last year, you'd think Europe would be the minimum expectation.
6. West Ham - £14,414,845
This one's not surprising in the slightest. In fact, you might have expected to see the Irons place a notch or two higher here.
They wasted no time in facilitating Manuel Pellegrini's revolution with no less than ten new arrivals, including high profile moves for Felipe Anderson and Andriy Yarmolenko, and pushed £100m on transfer fees in total, with agent fees taking their net spend over that barrier.
7. Leicester - £12,720,618
On the face of it, Leicester ranking so highly here does seem strange, considering some of the big hitters we haven't got to yet, and especially since there were no huge signings at the King Power - not on the level of Richarlison or Felipe Anderson at least.
The Foxes' spending was more widespread, but James Maddison, Ricardo Pereira, Caglar Soyuncu and Rachid Ghezzal all set them back a fair bit. It's likely, however, that Riyad Mahrez's £60m move to Manchester City offset much of their lofty spend on both transfers and keeping agents happy.
8. Arsenal - £11,181,730
Unai Emery's arrival didn't quite come with the transfer overhaul some expected, with the Spaniard generally opting to work with what he had, and that's why they rank so far down in relation to their stature.
There was some business at the Emirates, however, and most of it has paid off. Lucas Torreira has justified his £27m price tag, while Bernd Leno has proven competent between the sticks, and Matteo Guendouzi - signing for just £7m from Ligue 2 side Lorient - has been something of a revelation considering the low risk nature of his arrival.
9. Tottenham - £11,141,255
Just £40,000 separates Tottenham from rivals Arsenal in the agent fee rankings, and that's surprising, considering Spurs haven't bought a single player over the last 12 months.
Harry Kane, Son Heung-min and Mauricio Pochettino's contract renewals all fall into the bracket here, however, which perhaps explains why they aren't entirely detached from the pack.
